itemType.name: Devil Fruit
entriesTemplate: A rare item found in the world of One Piece.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The porcupine has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Quills
entries: Any creature that makes a melee attack within 5 feet of the giant porcupine must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage. Any creature that attempts to grapple the porcupine takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage when they make the attempt and at the start of each of their turns they maintain the grapple.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The porcupine makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit ({@dice 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit ({@dice 2d4 + 1}) slashing damage

trait.name: Stable
entries: Whenever an effect knocks the turtle {@condition prone}, it can make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw to avoid being knocked {@condition prone}. A {@condition prone} turtle is upside down. To stand up, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity check on its turn and then use all its movement for that turn.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the giraffe moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the giraffe can make another attack with its hooves against it as a bonus action.

If the target is {@condition prone}, the leopard can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The unicorn's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The unicorn can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: • At will: detect evil and good, druidcraft, pass without trace • 1/day each: calm emotions, dispel evil and good, entangle

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the unicorn moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The unicorn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The unicorn's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The unicorn makes three attacks: two with its hooves and one with its horn.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit ({@dice 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit ({@dice 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
entries: The unicorn touches another creature with its horn. The target magically regains 11 ({@dice 2d8 + 2}) hit points. In addition, the touch removes all diseases and neutralizes all poisons afflicting the target.

action.name: Teleport (1/Day)
entries: The unicorn magically teleports itself and up to three willing creatures it can see within 5 ft. of it, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, to a location the unicorn is familiar with, up to 1 mile away.

trait.name: Ice Walk
entries: The Okuchi no Makami can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra moment.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Okuchi no Makami has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Okuchi no Makami's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The Okuchi no Makami has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Okuchi no Makami makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit ({@dice 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus ({@dice 1d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit ({@dice 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Cold Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The Okuchi no Makami exhales an icy blast in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: **Saving Throws:
entries: Dex +11, Wis +10, Cha +12 Damage Immunities bludgeoning from nonmagical attacks Condition Immunities {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened} Senses passive Perception 16 Languages: Common Challenge 20 (25,000 XP)

trait.name: Drums of Liberation
entries: Any creature friendly to Nika within 30 feet of Nika cannot be {@condition frightened} while Nika is conscious.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Nika's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Stretchy Limbs
entries: Nika's melee weapon attacks have a reach of 30 feet.
Innate spellcasting. Nika's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}). Nika can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

items: At will: arms of hadar, earth tremor, enlarge/reduce (Self)
3/day each: call lightning, erupting earth, freedom of movement (Self)
1/day each: bigby's hand (opaque hand which replaces one of Nika's fists), move earth, wall of stone

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Nika makes four unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 30ft., one target. Hit ({@dice 6d8 + 8}) piercing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage. The target takes the secondary bludgeoning damage if Nika is using its Colossal Growth.

action.name: Colossal Growth (1/Day)
entries: Nika polymorphs into a giant, with its size increasing to gargantuan, for 1 minute. Nika's stats remain the same in this form, and its Unarmed Strikes deal an extra {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage while polymorphed. It reverts to its true form if it falls to 0 hit points or falls {@condition unconscious}.

item.name: Inu Inu No Mi: Model: Kyubi no Kitsune

entries.name: Fruit Appearance
entries: This devil fruit appears as a white melon with cloud-like swirls across its surface and 9 bright golden stems sprouting out

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to have the abilities of the Mythical Beast: Kitsune

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Shape Change
entries: The Devil Fruit User's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: {@spell shapechange}, {@spell polymorph}.
(Note: Since you are lvl 1 I only gave you 2 I'll add more as we go)

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A small teal blueberry with a dotted pattern resembling a shrinking spiral.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to shrink their body to a minuscule size and return to their normal size at will. The user's strength remains the same regardless of size.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Tiny Form
entries: As an action, you can halve your size, and your weight is reduced to one-eighth of normal, or you can return to your normal size. This reduction decreases your size by one category—from Medium to Small, for example (down to a minimum of tiny). You can use a subsequent action in your Tiny form to further halve your size by one category. Your weapons also shrink to match your new size. While these weapons are reduced, your attacks with them deal {@damage 1d4} less damage for each size category you have decreased by (this can't reduce the damage below 1). Your tiny form lasts for 10 minutes or until you fall {@condition unconscious}.

entries.name: Shrink Resistance
entries: While shrunk, you are harder to hit. You gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws, but have disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

entries.name: Size Stealth
entries: When shrunk, you can attempt to hide even when you are only {@quickref Vision and Light||2||lightly obscured}. You also have advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks when in your shrunken state.

entries.name: Spells (Shrinking Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Expeditious Retreat} (Self; 1 charge), {@spell Misty Step} (2 charges), . The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Mini Field)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast Reduce, without expending any charges or material components, on any number of creatures of your choice that you can see within range of the spell (no {@status concentration} required). Creatures affected by this awakening also benefit from your Shrink Resistance and Size {@skill Stealth} features. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. Dark red berries decorated with spiral patterns resembling separated pieces.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to split and divide parts of their body into pieces and control said pieces telekinetically. However, the user's feet cannot float and must be on the ground.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Cut Immunity
entries: You are immune to slashing damage, as your body can divide to avoid slashes from weapons.

entries.name: Divide Form
entries: As a bonus action, you can split any part of your body into pieces and control them telekinetically. These pieces retain your original strength and dexterity. As another action, you can reassemble your body.

entries.name: Floating Limbs
entries: When you divide your body, any part (except your feet) can float telekinetically up to 30 feet away from you. Appendages act similar to the {@spell Mage Hand} cantrip. You can use these floating pieces to perform tasks, attack, or defend. Additionally, your reach for unarmed strike or melee weapons with the light property are 30 feet greater than normal when using floating limbs.

entries.name: Spells (Chopping Technqiues)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Chop Chop Cannon (as {@spell Catapult|XGE}, using a body part; 1 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Blur} (2 charges), or Chop Chop Festival (as {@spell Conjure Barrage}, but you create a storm of floating limbs; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Telekinetic Carnival)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Telekinesis}, without expending any charges or material components, on any number of objects or creatures of your choice that you can see within range of the spell (no {@status concentration} required), with a duration of 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. Your divided body parts can be used to increase the range or control multiple objects simultaneously. Additionally, you can telekinetically control yourself (as if using Telekinesis) for the duration, even affecting your feet. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A glossy pink strawberry with brain-like spiral patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: Makes the user's body smooth and slippery, causing most attacks to slide or slip off the user, protecting them from harm.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Slippery Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to bludgeoning and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, as physical attacks slip off your body. Additionally, you are immune to falling {@condition prone} due to slipping or tripping.

entries.name: Swift Movement
entries: Your movement is unaffected by {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. You also gain advantage on any Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks made to avoid being pushed or {@condition grappled}.

entries.name: Spells (Smooth Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Grease} (Range: Self; 1 charge), {@spell Blur} (2 charges), or Slip 'n Slide ({@spell Kinetic Jaunt|SCC}; 2 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Ultra Glide)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Freedom of Movement} on yourself with a 1 minute duration or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, without expending any charges or material components, focusing on enhancing your agility and speed. While this spell is active, your speed doubles, you gain immunity to bludgeoning and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, and you leave a 30-foot square trail of grease (like the {@spell Grease} spell) on any surface beneath you at the end of your turn. You and your allies are ammune to this slippery trail, and move at twice the regular speed within the trail. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A rough-textured, spiky green kiwi with protruding thorns.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to grow and retract spikes from any part of their body, turning them into a living weapon. The spikes can be used both defensively and offensively.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Spike Immunity
entries: You are immune to nonmagical piercing damage, as your body has adapted to the nature of spikes and sharp objects.

entries.name: Impaling Strike
entries: As a bonus action, you can cause your next melee attack against a creature to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} piercing damage on a hit, as long spikes emerge from your attacks until the start of your next turn. If you grapple a creature, you can choose to impale them on your spikes, dealing {@damage 1d6} piercing damage at the start of each of your turns while the grapple lasts.

entries.name: Spells (Spike Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Armor of Agathys} (deals piercing damage; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Spike Growth} (2 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Thorny Dominion)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to envelop yourself and the surrounding terrain in a 120-foot radius centered on you with menacing, fortified spikes. For 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, any creature, not including you or your allies, that moves within or enters this area takes {@damage 3d6} piercing damage every 5 feet it travels. Additionally, your skin hardens with a protective layer of spikes, granting you resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning and slashing damage and causing melee attackers to take damage equal to half of what they deal to you. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A yellow banana in the shape of a swirl, with a similar black curved pattern covering it, topped with a spring-like stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to turn their limbs and body parts into springs, giving them an extended reach for attacks, greater speed, and heightened jumps.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Spring-Loaded Lunge
entries: The first melee weapon attack you make during your turn gains a +5 ft bonus to its range.

entries.name: Spring Legs
entries: Your long jump is up to 20 feet and your high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start, unless your current jump distance is higher. Additionally, if you land during a fall, you can use a reaction to reduce the impact uisng your springs, and you do not take any fall damage and can land on your feet.

entries.name: Bounce Back
entries: Whenever you come into impact with a hard surface, such as by jumping against it or by falling onto it, you can use a bonus action during your turn to use your spring body to bounce back in the opposite direction for free using your long jump or high jump (depending on the direction you are jumping) without using any movement.

entries.name: Spring Hopper
entries: As an action on your turn, you can spend 3 devil fruit charges to unleash a spring assault onto your enemies. If you choose to do so, until the end of your turn, you do not provoke any opportunity attacks, you can make up to two additional long or high jumps without expending any movement to do so, and after you complete a jump, you can make a free melee weapon attack against a creature within 5 feet from where you land.

entries.name: Spells (Spring Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Jump} (Self; 1 charge), Spring Snipe (as {@spell Thunderous Smite}; 1 charge), or {@spell Thunder Step|XGE} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Ultra Coil Zone)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cause the surrounding terrain in a 120-foot radius centered on you to become spring-like. For 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, each creature of your choice in the area gains a long jump of up to 60 feet and a high jump of up to 30 feet, with or without a running start, and doesn't take fall damage. You and your allies gain advantage on the next attack roll made after making a jump for the first time during their turn. You and your allies also gain immunity to bludgeoning damage for the duration, as the air around you absorbs the impact of the attack. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A flat, long brown pear with several square indents along it surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to create doors on any surface, including air, granting them access to different locations or dimensions.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Doorway Creation
entries: As an action, by expending 2 devil fruit charges, you can touch a nonmagical surface or an empty space next to you to create a 5-foot wide by 8-foot tall door on it. This door either leads to the same location in the ethereal plane or functions as a 5-foot deep passwall (choose one). The door remains open until the end of your next turn or until you close it as a bonus action, after which the surface reverts to its original state. If created in mid-air, the door exclusively leads to the ethereal plane.

In the ethereal plane, you can view creatures and objects in the material plane up to 60 feet away. You can also use an action to create a door returning to the material plane without using a devil fruit charge once after entering the ethereal plane. Subsequent uses require the usual charge expenditure.

entries.name: Spells (Door Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Revolving Door (as {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter}, causing a part of the target's body to rotate like a door; 1 charge), {@spell Knock} (2 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Doorway Domain)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to manipulate the fabric of space within a 120-foot radius centered on you. For 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, you can freely create doors leading to any location within this radius, allowing creatures to instantly teleport from one door to another. You and each allied creature in this zone can use Dimension Door as an action for free during their turn, which can only lead to another space within the zone. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A silver strawberry-shaped fruit with red lines running across it.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to mark a target, allowing them to flawlessly aim and hit the marked target with any object or attack from any distance.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Precision Marking
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature within 5 feet of you, forcing it to make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failure, the creature is marked. While that creature is marked, every ranged weapon attack and ranged spell attack you make against it can reach it even if the creature isn't in range of your attack or you can't see it, unless it is behind full cover. You still have disadvantage on creatures outside of your normal range, and you cannot apply any advantage to attack rolls against a creature outside of your long range. You can only mark up to two creatures like this at a time, and when you mark a new creature the oldest mark disappears.

A creature marked by you an make a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) or Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your Devil Fruit save DC to determine which direction the attacks are being made from if it is outside your normal range and it cannot see you.

entries.name: Spells (Mark Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Hunter's Mark} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Death Mark (as {@spell Bestow Curse}; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Bullseye Zone)
entries: Once you awaken your power, you can take an action to mark any creature you choose within a 60-foot range that you can see. Each chosen creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. If they fail, they are cursed with your mark for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}.

Creatures marked in this manner experience the effects of your Precision Marking, which does not count against your usual number of uses. They also shimmer with the glow of Faerie Fire for the duration. Allies benefit from your Precision Marking when targeting creatures that bear this mark during this effect's duration.
Furthermore, any creature marked by you this way takes an additional {@damage 1d6} damage from weapon attacks. After using this action, you must wait 24 hours before using it again.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A white pear-shaped fruit with a yellow propeller-shaped stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to create propellers around their body, giving them the ability of flight and spinning abilities.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Propeller Immunity
entries: You are immune to nonmagical slashing damage, as your body spins like a propeller in the direction of the slash to abosrb the slash.

entries.name: Propeller Strike
entries: As a bonus action, you can cause your next melee attack against a creature to deal an extra {@damage 1d8} slashing damage on a hit, as propeller blades emerge from your attacks until the start of your next turn. If you hit with your propeller, you can move yourself 5 feet in any direction with your propellers without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Propeller Form
entries: As an action, you can choose to enter a propeller form, or back into your regular form. In your propeller form, your walking speed becomes 5 feet and your flying speed is 50 feet, as you begin to fly like a propeller plane.

entries.name: Spells (Spin Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Feather Fall} (1 charge), {@spell Gust of Wind} (2 charges), Dizzying Spin ({@spell Hypnotic Pattern}; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Spinning Vortex)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to transform the surrounding area within a 120-foot radius centered on a point you can see within 300 feet, into a spinning vortex for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. Enemies within the zone have their speed halved and must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC at the start of each turn. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} slashing damage, and is pulled in a straight line toward the center of the sphere, ending in an unoccupied space as close to the center as possible, falling if midair. You and your allies gain a flying speed equal to their movement speed while within the vortex and can move freely within it. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A green melon-shaped fruit with many white lines intersecting each other.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to stitch things together without the need for a needle, as well as control and manipulate threads with precision.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: High Class Sewing
entries: You learn the {@spell Mending} cantrip, no material components required. Additionally when using this cantrip, you can attach multiple objects together, no longer limiting yourself to only fixing broken ones.

entries.name: Unstich Restraints
entries: If you are {@condition restrained} or {@condition grappled} by any means, you can use an action to end the condition on yourself, no check required.

entries.name: Stitching Mastery
entries: As an action, you can touch a creautre or object to stitch it to another object or surface using your sewing threads. If used on a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be {@condition restrained} while attached to a nearby object or surface for 1 minute. If another creature is within 5 feet of the target, that creature must also save or become {@condition restrained} and attached to the original target, up to a maximum of 2 total targets. A creature {@condition restrained} by the threads can use its action to make a Strength check against your Devil Fruit save DC to break free. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition restrained}. As a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can tug on the thread of one creature you have {@condition restrained} this way, dealing {@damage 1d6} slashing damage to the creature.

entries.name: Spells (Sewing Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Wound Stitching ({@spell Cure Wounds}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Web} (2 charges), Binding Stitch (as {@spell Hold Person}; 2 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Tailor's Domain)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to weave the very fabric of reality within a 120-foot radius centered on you for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. The area in the zone becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for enemies. Each creature of your choice that starts its turn in this zone or that enters the zone during its turn must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} piercing damage and is {@condition restrained} by threads as long as it remains in the zone or until it breaks free. A creature {@condition restrained} by the threads can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition restrained}. Additionally, you can use your Stitching Mastery on any point within this zone without the need for direct line of sight. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A lime green and brown coconut-shaped fruit with wavy purple linen topped with two banana peel-like appendages sprouting from the top.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to generate and control trash. This includes stinking waste, discarded items, rusted metals, old plastics, and other garbage.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Trash Immunity
entries: You are immune to poison damage, as your body is now built to hold rotten garbage. Additionally, you are immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition and nonmagical diseases.

entries.name: Garbage Disposal
entries: You learn the {@spell Poison Spray} cantrip. Additionally, you use an action to create a magical garbage bag which has the properties of a Bag of Holding. You can create a number of these equal to your proficiency bonus. If this bag is destroyed or stolen, you can use an action to magically teleport it back to your hands.

entries.name: Spells (Trash Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Surprise Trash ({@spell Chromatic Orb}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Garbage Beam ({@spell Ray of Enfeeblement}; 2 charges), or {@spell Stinking Cloud} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Landfill Kingdom)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to turn the ground within a 120-foot radius centered on you into a stinking landfill for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. The area becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3} for enemies. Each creature of your choice that starts its turn in this zone or that enters the zone during its turn must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until your awakening ends or it leaves the area. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. As a bonus action on your turn, you can cause an avalanche of trash to hit a creature of your choice within the zone. The target must succeed on a DC Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and get knocked {@condition prone}. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A translucent melon-shaped fruit with a yellow glowing core.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to generate {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light} from any part of their body.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Bright Resistance
entries: You are resistant to radiant damage, as your body is used to bright lights. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}.

entries.name: Glowing Aura
entries: As an action, you can emit a 20-foot radius of {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light}. This light dispels any darkness in its range, whether it's magical or non-magical. The radius lasts for 10 minutes or until you decide to end it.

entries.name: Focused Illumination
entries: You learn the {@spell Word of Radiance|XGE} cantrip, no material components required. Additionally, any creature that fails its saving throw against this cantrip also becomes {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Spells (Brightness Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Faerie Fire} (1 charge), {@spell Light} Beam ({@spell Moonbeam}; 2 charges), {@spell Daylight} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Luminescent Field)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast the {@spell Holy Aura} spell, without expending a spell slot or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A deep purple banana covered in black swirls.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to grow and manipulate long, flexible tendrils from any part of their body, allowing for grappling, reaching distant objects, or delivering powerful whip-like strikes.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Tendril Growth
entries: As an action, you can sprout tendrils from any part of your body, which last for 1 minute or until you are knocked {@condition unconscious}. These tendrils can extend up to 15 feet from your body. These tendrils can manipulate an object, open or close a door or container, and pick up or set down a Tiny object. They can retract or be dismissed as a free action.

entries.name: Whip Strike
entries: As a bonus action, you can use your tendrils to lash out at a creature within 15 feet of you. Make a melee Devil Fruit spell attack against the target, dealing {@dice 1d8} in bludgeoning damage on a hit.

entries.name: Grasping Tendrils
entries: You can use your tendrils to grapple an opponent within 15 feet as a bonus action as per grappling rules. When you successfully grapple a target, you can also restrain it until the end of your next turn or until your grapple is broken.

entries.name: Spells (Tendril Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Arms of Hadar} (Deals bludgeoning damage; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), or {@spell Evard's Black Tentacles} (fills a 10-foot square instead; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Tendril Hell)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cause tendrils to erupt from the ground within a 60-foot radius centered on you. For 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, the area becomes covered in Evard's Black Tentacles. You and your allies are unaffected by the tentacles. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A lime green, segmented orange with jagged black lines crisscrossing its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to split and separate any object or surface into two parts, creating gaps, openings, or chasms. The user can control the size and shape of the split, making it a versatile power for both offense and defense.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Material Split
entries: As an action, you can touch a large or smaller nonmagical object, causing it to magically split apart into two equal halves for 1 minute. This can be a chest, door, or other similar object. The object returns back to normal once the duration ends, unless you end the effect early on it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Chasm Creator
entries: As an action, by expending 1 devil fruit charge, you can split the ground beneath a creature you can see within 60 feet. The creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall into the chasm, taking fall damage if the chasm is more than 10 feet deep. The chasm can be up to 10 feet wide and 30 feet deep. The chasm remains open this way until the creature climbs out and no other objects or creatures remain inside it.

entries.name: Barrier Divide
entries: As an action, you can expend 3 devil fruit charges to split open even a magical barrier, object, or surface by touching it. Upon touching it, it splits in half, opening a gap opens along it that is no more than 5 feet wide along its surface from one end to another for 1 minute. The gap cannot be longer than 30 feet along the surface and the depth of the opening cannot be more than 5 feet.

entries.name: Spells (Split Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Earthen Mouth (as {@spell Maximilian's Earthen Grasp|XGE}; 2 charges), or Erupting Split (as {@spell Erupting Earth|XGE}; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Spacetime Split)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast the {@spell Gravity Fissure|EGW} spell, without expending a spell slot or material components. Your allies are unaffected by the fissure. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A blue onion-shaped fruit with a small tear drop-shaped pattern.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to produce a gaseous substance in the air from their palms, producing the scent similar to that of cutting an onion, causing those around to uncontrollably cry.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Chopped Onions
entries: You learn the {@spell Vicious Mockery} cantrip, but instead making your target cry. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.

entries.name: Weeping Weaponry
entries: As a bonus action, you can fire your own tears at a creature within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged Devil Fruit spell attack against the target, dealing {@damage 1d8} cold damage on a hit.

entries.name: Spells (Crying Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Hideous Crying (as {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter}; 1 charge), Ray of Sadness (as {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement}; 2 charge), or Bawling Breath ({@spell Fear}; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Tidal Wave of Sorrow)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to release a massive wave of crying gas in a 60-foot radius centered on you. Each creature of your choice in the area must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, creatures are overwhelmed by sorrow for 1 minute. Affected creatures are {@condition frightened} and {@condition blinded} for the duration and spends its turn crying uncontrollably, and must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. Additionally, the tears of crying creatures are contagious and will spread to any other creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of a crying creature, forcing it to also make the save to avoid crying. A crying target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on themselves on a success. Additionally, any surface a crying creature moves across becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3} due to the pooling tears for 1 minute. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A red, yellow and green apple-shaped fruit with a stem in the shape of a ribbon.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to generate and manipulate wrapping materials, from ribbons to toughened wraps. These wraps can be used for binding, defense, or other creative applications.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Wrap Generation
entries: As an action, you can produce wrapping materials from your body. These can be as soft as silk ribbons or as tough as steel bands, depending on your need. You can produce up to 60 feet of wrapping material at once. You can throw this material up to 60 feet, allowing it to serve as a bridge across a canyon, a grabbable surface for climbing up walls, etc., as it is able to remain sturdy according to your will.

entries.name: Defensive Wrap
entries: As a reaction when you are hit by a melee attack, you can spend 2 devil fruit charges to wrap the attacking weapon or limb in a thick parchment, potentially disarming the attacker and forcing them to drop their weapon if they fail a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. The wrapped weapon or body part requires an action to unwrap and become usable again.

entries.name: Spells (Wrap Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Entangle} (as you wrap the ground around foes; 1 charge), {@spell Web} (as you create a wall or cube of wrapping material; 2 charges), or {@spell Slow} (wrapping targets together; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Wrapping Realm)
entries: Upon awakening your devil fruit powers, you can, as an action, envelop a 60-foot radius centered on you in a vast network of ethereal wraps. These wraps are almost transparent and can hardly be seen by enemies within the area, halving their movement speed and imposing disadvantage on their attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws. Additionally, you can, as a reaction, wrap a weapon attack you can see being made in the area, forcing the attacking creature to make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or miss the attack and have their weapon wrapped (as if using the Defensive Wrap feature). This realm lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, and once used, you can't activate it again for 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A large, round yellow fruit with numerous holes and a crumbly texture, resembling a wheel of cheese.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the power to produce and control cheese. This cheese can be molded into various shapes and structures, from barriers to weapons, and even used to trap foes.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Cheese Creation
entries: As a cheese being, you are able to produce and control cheese in various ways. Any cheese produced with this devil fruit is thick and viscous enough to not be considered water to devil fruit users, but creatures fully submerged in cheese will suffocate and drown normally as if they are underwater. You are immune to suffocating in your own cheese.

You can spend 1 devil fruit charge to cast {@spell create or destroy water} as a 1st-level spell slot, without expending a spell slot or material components. Instead of producing or destroying water with this spell, you produce or destroy edible cheese that is much thicker than water in the same amount and volume. This cheese counts as food when consumed, but spoils after 24 hours. You may spend additional devil fruit charges to increase the level of this spell by 1 for every charge expended as a part of casting the spell. Additionally, you learn and can use the {@spell Shape Water|XGE} cantrip on this cheese.

Additionally, you can spend a bonus action to harden the mochi into a solid block of mochi which can expand up to a 10-by-10 ft cube, but counts as the same amount of food. A creature in the cheese's space when it expands is pushed out safely to the nearest space.

entries.name: Spells (Cheesy Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Cheese Armor (as {@spell False Life}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell web} (replace webbing with sticky cheese; 2 charges), {@spell tidal wave|XGE} (liquid cheese instead of water; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Cheese Kingdom)
entries: Once awakened, you can transform the terrain within a 60-foot radius centered on you into a cheesy landscape. You and allies can use the Passwell spell for free as a bonus action on any cheesy surface in the area, effectively opening up a hole in it for the duration, or closing it as a free action. An enemy in this area must make a Dexterity saving throw at the start of its turn, or fall 20 feet into a hole which opens out of the cheese beneath it. This effect lasts for 1 minute, at which point the terrain returns to normal. After you use this action, you can't use it again for 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A black, leather-textured orange with stitch-like patterns and a zipper-shaped stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the power to transform into a jacket and be worn by other creatures, allowing the user to enhance or manipulate the wearer.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Disguise Expert
entries: You gain proficiency with Disguise Kits.

entries.name: Jacket Form
entries: As an action, you can transform into a jacket form, which can move through the spaces of other creatures, which is treated as {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and be worn by a willing creature of your choice. Your weight becomes 0 for the duration, not including any items or equipment you are carrying. An allied creature must spend a bonus action to wear you or remove you from their body. This form lasts for 1 minute, or until you end it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Wearer Enhancement
entries: While worn by an allied creature, you share the same space as the creature wearing you. Your movement speed becomes 0, and you move with the creature wearing you. If the wearer gains full cover while wearing you, and if it is targeted by a spell, effect, or attack, you can choose to become the target instead. Both you and the wearer can still act on your turns, but the wearer can choose to let you roll for any Strength or Dexterity checks or saves it makes during its turn, using your roll in place of its own. If a spell or effect would force you to become {@condition grappled}, {@condition restrained}, knocked {@condition prone}, or pushed, it also affects the wearer until they remove you from their body.

entries.name: Wearer Manipulation
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to attempt to take control of an unwilling creature you can see within 5 ft. of you while in your jacket form. The target must make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, your turn ends and the creature is forced to wear you (as if using Wearer Enhancement), and you control their actions and movement until the end of their next turn, at which point you are removed and pushed into an empty space within 5 feet of the target.

entries.name: Spells (Jacket Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Jump} (only on Wearer; 1 charge), {@spell Longstrider} (only on Wearer; 1 charge), {@spell Disguise Self} (1 charge), or {@spell Warding Bond} (only on Wearer; 2 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Coat of Arms)
entries: Once awakened, you can use an action to toss magical jackets at up to five humanoid creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you. The targets must make Wisdom saving throws or become controlled by the worn jackets. While controlled, they are affected by the {@spell Dominate Person} spell ({@status concentration} required) for 1 minute. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A white apple-shaped fruit with a black "X" shaped pattern wrapping around it.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to create a soundproof field as well as the ability to cancel out all noises.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Sound Immunity
entries: You are immune to thunder damage and any effect that relies on sound, such as the {@spell Shatter} spell.

entries.name: Silent Zone
entries: You can cast the {@spell Silence} spell as an action, no charges required. Additionally, you can choose to allow those within the sphere to hear and make noise without those outside the sphere to hear noise coming from inside.

entries.name: Stealthy Movement
entries: While in your Silent Zone, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks, as your movements do not produce any noise.

entries.name: Spells (Silent Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Eerie {@spell Silence} (as {@spell Cause Fear|XGE}; 1 charge), {@spell Blindness/Deafness} (deafness only; 2 charge), or {@spell Pass without Trace} (2 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Maddening Silence)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a zone of silence up to a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within 120 feet. All sound of your choice within this area is completely nullified, alied creatures are immune to thunder damage while inside the area, and enemy creatures in the area are {@condition deafened}. Additionally, any creature of your choice that starts its turn in the area must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} psychcic damage and is {@condition frightened} by the silence until the start of its next turn. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A beige melon-shaped fruit with small holes dotting it.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to produce and manipulate biscuits, including shaping them into various forms and hardening them into durable structures.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Biscuit Creation
entries: You learn the {@spell magic stone|XGE} cantrip, using small biscuits instead of stones. As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to produce biscuits from your body, which can be used as sustenance or shaped into various objects and structures. The biscuits can be as soft and crumbly or as hard and tough as stone, depending on your needs. You can produce enough biscuits to fill a 5-foot cube, and they count as 15 pounds worth of food (as if using the {@spell Create food and Water} spell).

entries.name: Biscuit Molding
entries: You can spend an action to harden or reshape up to a 10-foot cube of your biscuits into a solid, stone-like material. You can also mold it into any shape you want, so long as its overall volume doesn't increase. This can be used to create walls or barriers. Hardening biscuits make them have an AC of 17 and 30 hit points per 5-foot section.

entries.name: Biscuit Soldier
entries: You can expend 2 devil fruit charges an action to magically manifest a large biscuit soldier in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you for up to 1 minute ({@status concentration} required).

This biscuit soldier counts as a Large Animated Object, as if using the {@spell Animate Objects} spell, with an AC of 17, and follows the same rules as per the spell description. As an action, you can choose to mount or dismount a biscuit soldier (using Mounted Combat rules) by using half of your movement speed, but take shelter within the solider instead and gaining full cover while inside it. You are considered {@condition blinded} while inside a biscuit solider, but you can see through its eyes and use it's senses. You can also speak and hear through it.

entries.name: Spells (Biscuit Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Biscuit Toss (as {@spell Catapult|XGE}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), or Biscuit Barrage (as {@spell Conjure Barrage}; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Biscuit Legion)
entries: Once awakened, you can use an action to create up to ten large biscuit soldiers, using your Biscuit Solider feature (no {@status concentration} required), for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, without expending any Devil Fruit charges. Each Biscuit solider has an AC of 17 for the duration, and deals magic damage with its weapon attacks. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A melty, off white pear-shaped fruit with a short green stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to produce and manipulate butter, including shaping it into various forms and making it slippery or sticky.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Butter Creation
entries: As a butter being, you are able to produce and control butter in various ways. You learn the {@spell acid splash} cantrip. Any butter produced with this devil fruit is thick and viscous enough to not be considered water to devil fruit users, but creatures fully submerged in butter will suffocate and drown normally as if they are underwater. You are immune to suffocating in your own butter.

You can spend 1 devil fruit charge to cast {@spell create or destroy water} as a 1st-level spell slot, without expending a spell slot or material components. Instead of producing or destroying water with this spell, you produce or destroy edible butter that is much thicker than water in the same amount and volume. This butter counts as food when consumed, but spoils after 24 hours. You may spend additional devil fruit charges to increase the level of this spell by 1 for every charge expended as a part of casting the spell. Additionally, you learn and can use the {@spell Shape Water|XGE} cantrip on this butter.

entries.name: Butter Shield
entries: As a reaction, when you are hit by a melee or ranged attack, you can expend 1 or more devil fruit charges to create a butter shield that provides you with temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} (for each charge spent) + your proficiency bonus. While these temporary hit points remain, you are resistant to nonmagical bludgeoning and slashing damage. The shield lasts for 1 minute or until your temporary hit points are depleted.

entries.name: Spells (Butter Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Grease} (1 charge), Butter Glide ({@spell Kinetic Jaunt|SCC}; 2 charges), {@spell Tidal Wave|XGE} (liquid butter instead of water; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Butter Surf)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Freedom of Movement} on yourself with a 1 minute duration or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, without expending any charges or material components, focusing on enhancing your agility and speed by covering yourself in butter. While this spell is active, your speed doubles, you gain immunity to nomagical bludgeoning and slashing damage, and you leave a 30-foot square trail of butter (like the {@spell Grease} spell) on any surface beneath you at the end of your turn. You and your allies are ammune to this slippery trail, and move at twice the regular speed within the trail. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A melty, white apple-shaped fruit with a large red stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to produce and manipulate cream, including shaping it into various forms and attacks.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Cream Creation
entries: As a cream being, you are able to produce and control cream in various ways. You learn the {@spell fire bolt} cantrip. Any cream produced with this devil fruit is thick and viscous enough to not be considered water to devil fruit users, but creatures fully submerged in cream will suffocate and drown normally as if they are underwater. You are immune to suffocating in your own cream.

You can spend 1 devil fruit charge to cast {@spell create or destroy water} as a 1st-level spell slot, without expending a spell slot or material components. Instead of producing or destroying water with this spell, you produce or destroy edible cream that is much thicker than water in the same amount and volume. This cream counts as food when consumed, but spoils after 24 hours. You may spend additional devil fruit charges to increase the level of this spell by 1 for every charge expended as a part of casting the spell. Additionally, you learn and can use the {@spell Shape Water|XGE} cantrip on this butter.

entries.name: Burning Cream Monster
entries: As a reaction to being attacked, you can expend 1 or more Devil Fruit charges to cast {@spell Hellish Rebuke}. The level of the spell depends on the number of charges you expend. You also gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus times the spell level, for 1 hour.

entries.name: Spells (Cream Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Cream Tentacles ({@spell Arms of Hadar}, dealing fire damage instead; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Scalding Cream (as {@spell Aganazzar's Scorcher|XGE}; 2 charges), {@spell Tidal Wave|XGE} (liquid cream instead of water; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Burning Cream Kraken)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cause tendrils to erupt around you in a 30-foot radius aura which follows you. For 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, the area within the aura becomes covered in Evard's Black Tentacles, which deal fire damage. You and your allies are unaffected by the tentacles. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A dark purple, oblong fruit with a twisted texture that resembles a wrung-out cloth.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to wring out and manipulate any object, including living creatures, as if they were a wet cloth, altering their shape, extracting fluids, or even wringing out intangible concepts like emotions.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Twist and Wring
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature or object and wring it out, manipulating its form or extracting liquids. If you target a creature, it must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. You also regain 1 Devil Fruit charge if you wring out a creature with a CR equal to 1/8 or higher, as you pour the creature's essence and strength into a glass or container for you to drink.

entries.name: Impurity Wringing
entries: As an action, you can touch yourself or a willing creature and wring out negative emotions or any toxins inside the target, removing a condition that affects its emotions, such as the {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} condition, or removing any nonmagical disease or poisons affecting it.

entries.name: Spells (Wring Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Healing Smoothie (as {@spell Cure Wounds}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Protein Smoothie (as {@spell Enhance Ability}; 2 charges), Enlarging Smoothie ({@spell enlarge/reduce}; enlarge only, 2 charges), or Power Smoothie (as {@spell Haste}; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges only by wringing out creatures using your Twist and Wring feature.

entries.name: Awakening (World Wringing)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to twist and wring out the essence of all creatures within 30 feet of you. Each enemy creauture of your choice in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much necrotic damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

Additionally, the total amount of necrotic damage each creature takes in this area fills a health pool which can restore a number of hit points equal to that amount. Choose any creatures within 30 feet of you, and divide those hit points among them. You can't use this feature on an undead or a construct. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A brown kiwi-shaped fruit with sharp silver colored protrusions all around it.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to burrow through the ground or any solid material quickly and efficiently, creating tunnels, holes, or pits. The user can also manipulate the earth to create barriers, traps, or reshape the terrain.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Tunnel Vision
entries: While burrowed, you have {@sense tremorsense|MM} out to a range of 30 feet.

entries.name: Burrow
entries: You learn the {@spell Mold Earth|XGE} cantrip. Additionally, you gain a burrow speed of equal to half your movement speed. You cannot burrow into solid rock, but you can move through softer material like soil or loose rubble, leaving a usable tunnel 5 feet in diameter. You can burrow through stone this way as well, but you must spend 1 Devil Fruit charge for every 30 feet of stone you burrow through until you complete a long rest. When you resurface for the first time during your turn, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage to your next melee attack roll made during your turn.

entries.name: Spells (Dig Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Earth Tremor|XGE} (1 charge), or {@spell Erupting Earth|XGE} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Excavation Zone)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to give yourself and up to 5 allied creatures within 60 feet of you a burrow speed of 60 feet, allowing everyone with this burrow speed to dig through even solid rock and stone, leaving a usable tunnel 5 feet in diameter in their wake. This effect lasts for 1 minute, or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. You and your allies gain advantage on the next attack roll made after unburrowing for the first time during their turn for the duration of this awakening. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A red, wrinkled fruit that resembles a dried prune with age spots on its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to rapidly age objects, turning new items old and decrepit, or cause plants to mature and bear fruit. The user can also increase the ages of living creatures.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Age Manipulation
entries: As an action, you can touch a non-magical object or surface, or a creautre within 5 feet of you, to attempt to magically age it. If you touch an unwilling creature, it must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failure or if the creature is willing, you age it by one year at the start of each of its turns for {@dice 1d10} rounds. If a creature progresses in age to such an extent that it becomes a new age category (from child to adult, adult to elderly, etc.), the DM may adjust the target's stats to match it's new age. If the target is an object, it may fall apart or wither based on its increase in age (cumulative 10% chance it will crumble for each turn it ages).

You can only affect up to a 5-foot square worth of nonmagical material at a time using this feature. If the material or material is equal to the durability of stone or greater, you must spend 1 devil fruit charge to age it this way. You can spend 2 charges as an action to instantly age a creature or 5-foot square of material this way, which guarantees it will age up to 10 years if it is a creature and that it will crumble if it is a non-magical object.

entries.name: Spells (Maturing Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Entangle} (as you cause plants and materials to grow rapidly; 1 charge), {@spell Spike Growth} (as you cause the ground to age and become rough; 2 charges), or {@spell Plant Growth} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Extreme Aging)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to concentrate all aging power from the surrounding area into one creature and cast {@spell Time Ravage|EGW} on it, no spell slots or material components required. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A gray coconut-shaped fruit surrounded in a red aura.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to harden their body, making their outer flesh extremely difficult to damage with physical attacks. They can also alter parts of their hardened external shell to change appearance.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Hardened Shell
entries: Your AC can't be less than 16, regardless of what kind of armor you are wearing. By spending 1 devil fruit charge as a bonus action, you can gain a +2 bonus to your AC for up to 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious} (this effect doesn't stack).

entries.name: Focused Hardness
entries: You can spend 3 Devil Fruit charges as an action to make yourself extremely hard for 1 minute ({@status concentration} required). For the duration, you have resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

entries.name: Spells (Hardening Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Thunderous Smite} (1 charge), Shell Shift (as {@spell Disguise Self}; 1 charge), or Mold Flesh (as {@spell Alter Self}; 2 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Unbreakable Fortress)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to harden the ground, walls, and any objects within a 60-foot radius centered on you, turning the area into an unbreakable fortress. For 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, the hardened surfaces and objects become immune to all damage and cannot be destroyed. Additionally, you gain immunity to all damage except force for the duration. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.
Nemu Nemu no Mi (Sleep)

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A deep blue melon-shaped fruit with yellow stars dotting it.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to put others to sleep and manipulate sleep-related effects, or alter and read their {@condition unconscious} dreaming state.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Slumber Resistance
entries: Any form of magic cannot forcefully put you to sleep. Additionally, you only require 4 hours of meditative rest to complete a Long Rest.

entries.name: Sleeping Touch
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and force it to make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature falls asleep for 1 minute or until it takes damage, is shaken awake, or uses an action to wake up. A creature that saves against this effect becomes immune to it for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Dreamy Visions
entries: You learn the Decode Thoughts cantrip. Additionally, you can use this cantrip on another creature without the usage of detect thought or modify memory if the target is asleep or {@condition unconscious}.

entries.name: Spells (Sleep Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Sleep} (1 charge, can be cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Calm Emotions} (2 charges), or {@spell Catnap|XGE} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Dreamscape)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a dreamscape within a 60-foot radius centered on you. For 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, the area becomes a surreal and otherworldly landscape. Each creature that starts its turn in the area or moves into the area during its turn must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature falls asleep for the duration or until it takes damage, is shaken awake, or uses an action to wake up. While asleep in the dreamscape, the creature is immune to all damage and effects from sources originating outside the dreamscape. A creature can use its action to attempt to wake up by making another Wisdom saving throw. Your allies are immune to the dreamscape's effects. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A translucent blue cube-shaped fruit with a small green cube-shaped stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to manipulate and reshape objects into cubes, as well as manipulate the properties of the cubes.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Cubification
entries: As an action, you can touch a non-magical object or creature and transform it into a cube for 1 minute. If the target is a creature, it must save on a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be transformed against its will. The cube retains the weight and properties of the original object or creature, but its dimensions are altered to fit a perfect cube shape. The maximum size of the object or creature that can be cubified is determined by a 5-foot cube. If the object or creature is larger than this, only a portion of it is transformed into a cube. Creatures transformed into cubes are {@condition incapacitated} for the duration of the transformation, and can make additional Constitution saving throws at the end of each of its turn to break free. A creature that saves against this effect becomes immune to it for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Cube Manipulation
entries: You learn the {@spell magic stone|XGE} cantrip, which you can use to toss cubes you've transformed. As an action, you can manipulate any cubes you've created, causing them to levitate, move, or stack. You can move a cube up to 15 feet in any direction, but it must remain within your line of sight. You can also stack cubes to create structures or barriers. The maximum weight of the cubes you can manipulate at once is equal to your carrying capacity.

entries.name: Spells (Cube Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Catapult|XGE} (targeting a Cube you've created; 1 charge, can be cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Air Cube (as {@spell Shatter}, in the same of a cube; 2 charges), or {@spell Conjure Barrage} (targeting a cube you've created; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Cubic Dimension)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to transform the area within a 60-foot cube centered on you into a cubic dimension. The ground, walls, and objects within this area become cubic and can be manipulated by you for the duration. You can create up to 10 large cubes this way out of nonmagical terrain or objects, which can be moved up to 30 feet as a bonus action as per your Cube Manipulation feature. As an action, you can attempt to slam a cube into a creature. It must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 5d10} bludgeoning damage and fall {@condition prone}. The effect lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A beige banana-shaped fruit with grooves spiraling it.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to produce and manipulate ropes, including shaping them into various forms, hardening them into durable structures, or using them to bind and restrain targets.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Rope Creation
entries: You learn the {@spell Thorn Whip} Cantrip, which deals bludgeoning damage. As an action, you can produce ropes from your body, which can be used for various purposes. You can produce up to 500 feet in total using this ability. You can destroy up to 100 feet of rope you've created as a bonus action.

entries.name: Climber's Blessing
entries: The rope you produce serves as a Climber's Kit, which you are proficient with. Additionally, you can launch a rope to grab a hold of a ledge or protruding object, granting you a climbing speed equal to your walking speed when scaling rough or rocky vertical surfaces. Additionally, slippery surfaces do not hinder you when climbing.

entries.name: Luring Lasso
entries: As an action, you can make a melee Devil Fruit spell attack with your ropes against a creature within 30 feet of you (if you have produced at least 30 feet of rope or more). On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage, and becomes {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} (Escape DC equal to your Devil Fruit save DC). You can use a bonus action to pull a lasso'd creature up to 20 feet straight toward you.

entries.name: Spells (Rope Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Snare|XGE} (1 charges), or {@spell Rope Trick} (2 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Rope Domain)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to transform the area within a 60-foot radius centered on you into a rope domain. The ground, walls, and objects within this area become covered in ropes that you can manipulate as if using your Rope Creation feature. Creatures within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be {@condition restrained} by the ropes. Once per turn, you can spend an action to make up to five Luring Lasso attacks targeting any creature in the area, and then pull up to 5 retrained creatures 20 feet toward you as a part of the same action. The effect lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A terracotta-colored, round fruit with a rough texture that resembles a plant pot.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to transform into a plant pot. The user can manipulate the growth of plants within these pots and use them for various purposes.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Pot Form
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 Devil Fruit charge transform into a metallic plant pot equal to your size. While in pot form, you are resistant to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and you gain resistance to all other damage types except force. Your movement speed stays at 0 in this form, and you are {@condition restrained}. You can remain in pot form for up to 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Green Thumb
entries: You have a natural affinity for plants. You learn the {@spell Druidcraft} cantrip. You have advantage on {@skill Nature} and {@skill Survival} checks related to plants, and you can cast the {@spell Speak with Plants} spell at will, without expending a spell slot.

entries.name: Spells (Pot Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges.
