You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Entangle} (1 charge), {@spell Spike Growth} (2 charges), or {@spell Plant Growth} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Garden of Eden)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Druid Grove|XGE} (casting time 1 action), without expending a spell slot or material components, as you awaken the plant life around you. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A blue melon-shaped fruit covered in fish scales, topped with a hook-shaped stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to generate fishing poles, nets, and other fishing tools. The user can also manipulate the movements of aquatic creatures and detect them with ease.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Fisherman's Tools
entries: You learn the {@spell thorn whip} cantrip, which appears as a fishing pole. As an action, you can create fishing poles, nets, or other fishing tools, such as a Fishing Tackle kit. You can create up to three sets of these tools using this feature, and they remain until you dismiss them as a bonus action. You have advantage on checks made when fishing or using fishing tools.

entries.name: Aqua Sense
entries: You gain a supernatural sense of the presence of aquatic creatures. You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to locate or track aquatic creatures. You can sense any aquatic creatures that are within 300 feet of you. Additionally, you can communicate telepathically with any aquatic creature within 60 feet of you that isn't a Sea King.

entries.name: Surfacing Bind
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil Fruit charge and target one aquatic creature you can sense within 300 feet of you and force it to make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature must spend its movement during its turn moving up toward that surface.

entries.name: Spells (Fishing Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Animal Friendship} (aquatic beasts only; 1 charge), {@spell Locate Animals or Plants} (aquatic beasts only; 2 charges), or {@spell Conjure Animals} (aquatic beasts only; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Ocean's Call)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to command the creatures of the sea to come to your aid, forcing every aquatic beast within 300 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw or become affected by the {@spell Dominate Beast} spell for 1 minute. This works even if you can't see the aquatic beast.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A brown, heart-shaped fruit with a glossy texture that resembles a chocolate truffle.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the power to produce and control chocolate. This chocolate can be molded into various shapes and structures, from barriers to weapons, and even used to trap foes.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Chocolate Creation
entries: As a chocolate being, you are able to produce and control chocolate in various ways. Any chocolate produced with this devil fruit is thick and viscous enough to not be considered water to devil fruit users, but creatures fully submerged in chocolate will suffocate and drown normally as if they are underwater. You are immune to suffocating in your own chocolate.

You can spend 1 devil fruit charge to cast {@spell create or destroy water} as a 1st-level spell slot, without expending a spell slot or material components. Instead of producing or destroying water with this spell, you produce or destroy edible chocolate that is much thicker than water in the same amount and volume. This chocolate counts as food when consumed, but spoils after 24 hours. You may spend additional devil fruit charges to increase the level of this spell by 1 for every charge expended as a part of casting the spell. Additionally, you learn and can use the {@spell Shape Water|XGE} cantrip on this chocolate.

Additionally, you can spend a bonus action to harden the mochi into a solid block of mochi which can expand up to a 10-by-10 ft cube, but counts as the same amount of food. A creature in the chocolate's space when it expands is pushed out safely to the nearest space.

entries.name: Spells (Chocolate Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Chocolate Armor (as {@spell False Life}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell web} (replace webbing with sticky chocolate; 2 charges), {@spell tidal wave|XGE} (liquid chocolate instead of water; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Chocolate Prison)
entries: Once awakened, you can cast Forceage, without expending a spell slot or material components, which appears as an opaque and invincible chocolate material. After you use this action, you can't use it again for 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A square-shaped fruit with a dark blue exterior and a zipper-like pattern around its edges.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to create pocket-like spaces on any surface, including their own body, where they can store objects, hide, or even trap enemies.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Pocket Creation
entries: As an action, you can create a magical pocket on your body or a piece of equipment, clothing, or armor that you are wearing. You can create an number of these pockets equal to twice your proficiency bonus at a time. As an action you can store an item no larger than 10 x 10 feet in size into a pocket, with each pocket being able to magically store up to 500 lbs. of items in weight. These pockets store objects in an extradimensional space, where they remain until the pocket is destroyed or the contents are manually removed by you or another creature. You can spend an action to retrieve an object stored within a pocket on your person. As a bonus action, you can destroy a pocket, ejecting the contents into an empty space adjacent to you.

entries.name: Pocket Trap
entries: As an action, you can conjure up a Portable Hole (see standard 5th Edition {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG} under "Items"), which appears folded in your hands. This acts as a large portable "Pocket", which you can use to trap enemies or store valuables. If the Portable Hole is ever lost or gets stolen, you can use an action to summon it back folded into your hands. Storing this Portable Hole in your pockets does not cause it to get destroyed.

entries.name: Spells (Pocket Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Pocket Ejection ({@spell Catapult|XGE}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Air Pocket (Wristpocekt; 2 charges), or Pocket Surprise ({@spell Conjure Barrage}; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Pocket Maze)
entries: Once awakened, you can pull a creature into one of your pockets and create a confusing maze within the pocket dimension to trap it. When you do so, you cast the {@spell Maze} spell, without expending a spell slot or material components, which appears as a large maze made of clotfabric. After you use this action, you can't use it again for 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A bright red, bell-shaped fruit with a green stem and a shiny surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to produce and manipulate sounds, creating jingles, music, or other sound effects that can affect the listener's emotions or even have physical effects.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Sound Manipulation
entries: You can manipulate sounds within a 60-foot radius of you using jingling bells that emerge from your body. You can amplify, dampen, or change the quality of any sound you can hear. You can also create new sounds, such as music or jingles, from scratch. You learn the {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrip, but can only use the effects related to sound.

entries.name: Emotion Manipulation
entries: As an action, you can play a jingle that affects the emotions of creatures within 30 feet of you. Choose one of the following effects: Calm, Fear, or Joy. Each creature in the area must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature is affected by the chosen emotion for 1 minute or until it takes damage. If a creature is calmed, it is under the effects of the {@spell Calm Emotions} spell. If a creature is under the Fear effect, it is {@condition frightened}. If a creature is under the Joy effect, it is {@condition charmed}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that saves against this effect becomes immune to it for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Spells (Jingle Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Thunderwave} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Shatter} (2 charges), or {@spell Hypnotic Pattern} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Symphony of Emotions)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a symphony of jingles within a 60-foot radius aura centered on you. For 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, the aura is filled with music that manipulates the emotions of creatures in the area. Choose one of the following effects: Calm, Fear, or Joy. Each creature of your choice in the aura must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC at the start of each of its turns. Additionally, any enemy creature that starts its turn in the aura takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage due to the overwhelming emotions. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A small brown fruit shaped like a shoe, with a shoelace-patterned stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to transform their feet into various types of shoes, granting them unique abilities based on the type of shoe.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Kick Mastery
entries: You gain proficiency in unarmed strikes using your feet. Additionally, your kicks deal {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Sneaker's Stealth
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth} skill. Additionally, you can move silently and leave no footprints on any surface, including sand, snow, or mud.

entries.name: Shoe Transform
entries: As an action, you can transform your feet into one of the following types of shoes, gaining the associated benefits for 1 minute or until you choose to end the effect as a bonus action:

entries.name: Running Shoes:
entries: Your walking speed increases by 15 feet, and you gain advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks.

entries.name: Climbing Shoes:
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed and advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to climb.

entries.name: Jumping Shoes:
entries: You gain advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to jump, and your long jump is up to 20 ft. and your high jump is up to 10 ft., with or without a running start.

entries.name: Dancing Shoes:
entries: You gain advantage on Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks related to dancing, and you can move through the spaces of other creatures as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}.

entries.name: Spells (Shoe Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Swift Shoes (as {@spell Longstrider}; Self; 1 charge), Spring Shoes (as {@spell Jump}; Self; 1 charge), Spider Shoes (as {@spell Spider Climb}; Self; 2 charges), or Flying Shoes (as {@spell Fly}; Self; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Master Shoemaker)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to transform the feet of up to five creatures within 60 feet of you into any type of shoe (including your Shoe Technique Spells), granting them the benefits of one of your Shoe Transform feature, while also doubling their movement speed for the duration. These creatures can use a bonus action on their turn to switch between the types of shoes. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A smooth orange fruit with a swirling pattern that resembles a fingerprint.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to transform into a physical double of anyone they touch, making the user an Imitating Human. The user can mimic the physical appearance, voice, and mannerisms of the target, but not their abilities or memories.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Imitation Expert
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception} and {@skill Performance} skills, as well as proficiency with the Disguise kit. Additionally, creatures attempting to see through your disguises make {@skill Investigation} and {@skill Insight} checks at disadvantage unless they are very familiar with the creature you are imitating.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries: As an action, you can touch a humanoid creature and instantly "Store" the appearance of it into your mind. A creature can resist by succeeding on a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check against your Devil Fruit save DC to avoid having their appearance memorized by you.

As an action, you can transform yourself into a humanoid creature you have memorized (as if using the Diguise Self spell). You retain your own abilities, hit points, and statistics, but you gain the physical appearance, voice, and exact facial features of the target. You do not gain the creature's clothes or possessions. If the creature is a size larger or smaller than you, you cannot increase or decrease your size category to match it. You can maintain this form for up to 1 hour, until you take damage, or until you choose to revert to your original form as a free action.
To discern that you are disguised, a creature can use its action to inspect your appearance and must succeed on an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your Devil Fruit save DC.

entries.name: Spells (Imitation Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Funny Face (as {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter}; 1 charge), Terrifying Face (as {@spell Cause Fear|XGE}; 1 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), or Form Montage ({@spell Mirror Image}; 2 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Terrain Imitation)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can cast {@spell Mirage Arcane} with a casting time of 1 action, without expending a spell slot or material components. You can only transform the terrain into an area you have seen and touched before. This effect lasts for 12 hours. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A cylindrical burgundy fruit with the ends being green, and peach colored swirls going along it

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to create and control scrolls at will. These scrolls have special properties, including storing objects and generating drawings.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Scroll Creation
entries: As an action, you can create a scroll in your hand. This scroll can be up to 10 feet long and 2 feet wide. You can use this scroll to store objects, generate drawings, or use other scroll-related features. You can possess a total number of scrolls equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Store Object
entries: As an action, you can touch an object with a scroll and store it within the scroll. The object must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. You can store up to three objects in a single scroll. As an action, you can touch the scroll and release one stored object, which appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you.

entries.name: Scroll Drawing
entries: You learn the {@spell Minor Illusion} cantrip. As an action, you can draw on a scroll, creating a two-dimensional image of any object or creature you can see, allowing you to perfectly memorize its appearance for illusion spells.

entries.name: Spell Scroll
entries: An empty scroll can hold up to 3 levels worth of spells at a time. Any creature can cast a spell of 1st through 3rd level into the scroll by touching the scroll as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect, other than to be stored in the scroll. If the scroll can't hold the spell, the spell is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the spell determines how much space it uses.

While holding the scroll, you can cast any spell stored in it. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. The spell cast from the scroll is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

entries.name: Spells (Scroll Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Silent Image} (1 charge), {@spell Major Image} (3 charges), or Scroll Nullification (as {@spell Counterspell}; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Infinity Scroll)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use a reaction to nullify any spell, effect, or attack originating from a source you can see within 60 feet of you. If you choose to do so, the effect is completely negated and absorbed into a giant scroll you produce, for up to 1 minute. If the source is a creature, it can succeed on a Wisdom saving throw to avoid having its ability stored in your scroll. If the effect is stored in your scroll, you can use an action to recreate the attack, effect, or spell as if you were the source, so long as the scroll's duration hasn't ended. You can't use this ability again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A white Pomegranate fruit with orange swirls, looking a bit on the thin side but still quite edible

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to make their body and any object they touch become flat and flexible, letting solid objects ripple, billow, and flutter like a piece of cloth or a flag.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Flag Human
entries: You can use your action and 1 devil fruit charge to make your body become flat and flexible like a flag for 1 minute. While in this form, you can move through spaces as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing, you take no fall damage (as if using feather fall on yourself for the duration), and you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks and Dexterity Saving Throws. You can revert to your normal form as a bonus action.

entries.name: Fluttering Object
entries: As an action, you can touch an object no larger than Large and make it become flat and flexible like a flag for up to 1 minute. The object retains its original size and weight, but it can flutter and ripple in the wind. You can manipulate the object as if it were a piece of cloth, allowing it to wrap around objects, unfurl, or billow in the wind. The object takes no damage from fall damage, and is easily pushed by any strong wind or gusts. You can only affect one object at a time, and using this ability on a new object ends the effect on the previous object.

entries.name: Fluttering Attack
entries: As a bonus action, you can target a melee weapon you are holding. For 1 minute or until you target a new weapon, the weapon's reach increases to 15 feet, as it becomes fabric-like and flexible. Alternaitvely, you can target your unarmed strikes instead, allowing your reach with them to be extend up to 15 feet.

entries.name: Spells (Flag Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Earth Ripple (as {@spell Earth Tremor|XGE}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Wind Ripple (as {@spell Gust of Wind}; 2 charges), {@spell Levitate} (Self or Object only; 2 charges), Flutter Dance (as {@spell Kinetic Jaunt|SCC}; 2 charges), or Rippling Release (as {@spell Conjure Barrage}; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Billowing Tempest)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast the Investituture of Wind spell with a 1 minute duration, no spell slots or material components required, on you and up to four other creatures within 30 feet of you. Additionally, you and the other target creatures also gain the benefits of your Flag Human form for the duration. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A red peach fruit that has lime green swirls on it, at first appearance nothing is unusual until you pick it up and it starts jiggling

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to make their body, as well as any object they touch, become soft, flexible, and jiggly like gelatin.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Jiggle Human
entries: You can use your action and 1 devil fruit charge to make your body become jiggly and bouncy like a gelatin for 1 minute. While in this form, you can squeeze through spaces as narrow as 1 inch wide, you take no fall damage (as if using feather fall on yourself for the duration), and your minimum long jump is up to 20 ft. and minimum high jump is up to 10 ft., with or without a running start. You can revert to your normal form as a bonus action.

entries.name: Gelatinous Object
entries: As an action, you can transform a Large or smaller object or up to a 10 ft. cube of terrain and make it become soft and jiggly like gelatin for up to 1 minute. The object retains its original size and weight but becomes flexible and bouncy. Creatures don't need a running start to jump while standing on the area, and jump distances are doubled if jumping from the surface of the area. You may bounce on this substance like a trampoline (Negating fall damage) or move through it as if it were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. If you end your movement you begin to suffocate, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage. You can only affect one object at a time, and using this ability on a new object ends the effect on the previous object. Ending this effect on an object causes creatures within it to be forced out of the object

entries.name: Spells (Jiggle Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Jump} (Self; 1 charge), Jiggle Slam (as {@spell Thunderous Smite}; 1 charge), Sticky Surface ({@spell Web}; 2 charges), or {@spell Thunder Step|XGE} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Gelatinous Transmutation)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to convert up to four 10-by-10 ft. objects or squares of terrain within 60 feet of you into a Gelatinous Cube (see standard 5th Edition {@book Monster Manual|MM} for stats) per converted area, up to four total. The Galetinous Cubes form in the converted objects' spaces and obey your commands for 1 minute or until they are destroyed. You can dismiss one Gelatinous Cube as a free action during your turn, once per turn, and form a Large 10-by-10 ft. cube of gelatinous material (with the characteristics of your Gelatinous Object ability). You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A small, cubic fruit with six sides, each side featuring a different number of dots, resembling a six-sided dice. The fruit is primarily red with white dots.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to create magical dice and create dice-based effects.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Magic Dice
entries: As an action, you can produce up to three magical six-sided dice from your hands. These dice are magical and can alter the fate of you and the creatures around you in any way you choose. You cannot use this action again to produce dice until the next dawn. You can have up to three of these magic dice at a time.

entries.name: Alter Fate
entries: You learn the {@spell guidance} cantrip. Additionally, when a creature you can see within 60 feet of you makes an Ability Check, Saving Throw, or {@action Attack} roll, you can choose to expend one of your Magic Dice to alter the fate of the roll. If the target is an enemy, you can decrease it's roll by {@dice 1d6}. If the target is an ally, you can increase it's roll by {@dice 1d6}.

entries.name: Spells (Dice Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Cursed Dice (as {@spell Bane}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Blessed Dice (as {@spell Bless}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Augury} (2 charges), {@spell Fortune's Favor|EGW} (2 charges), or Voodoo Dice (as {@spell Bestow Curse}; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Dice Hurricane)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to unleash a storm of magical dice in a 60-foot radius centered on you. The area becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and any creature in the area is subject to having their fate altered by the flying dice. When a creature within the area makes an Ability Check, Saving Throw, or {@action Attack} roll, you can choose to alter the fate of the roll using your Alter Fate feature, without expending any Magic Dice. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, and you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A cream colored bundles of grapes with peach colored swirls, their top layer feels a bit slimy compared to what one would expect.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to alter and control the fat composition inside one's body to change its overall size and volume. Can also transplant this fat into other creatures.

entries.name: Fat Transplant
entries: You learn the {@spell Ray of Frost} cantrip, which deals necrotic damage instead.

Additionally, you can use an action to transplant fat from your body to other creatures within 30 feet of you. A creature targeted against its will must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC, or begin to gain an increasing amount of fat around its body. Each time a creature fails this saving throw, it takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage and its speed is reduced by 10 feet, down to a minimum of 10 feet of movement. A creature burns off this added fat when it completes a short or long rest. You cannot add fat to constructs this way.

entries.name: Fat Form
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to transform your body into a fatter form, which greatly increases your weight for 1 minute. This halves your movement speed and you can't fly, but also grants you resistance to slashing, piercing and bludgeoning damage. While in this form you also cannot be pushed or made {@condition prone} thanks to your enhanced mass, but also gain disadvantage on dexterity checks and saving throws. You can revert to your normal form as a bonus action.

entries.name: Spells (Lard Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Layered Fat (as {@spell False Life}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Enlarge/Reduce} (Enlarge only; 2 charges), or Rapid Fat Burning (as {@spell Haste}; Self, but cannot use in Fat Form; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Lethargic Lane)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cause each creature of your choice within a 60 foot-radius centered on you to fatten up for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. Each creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw to avoid being fattened. For the duration, while fattened up, your enemies lose half their movement speed and can't fly (as per your Fat Form feature), but don't gain the same bonuses that you do. Additionally, they lose the ability to take the disengage or dash actions, and have disadvantage on dexterity checks and saving throws. You can't use this action again until 24 hours have passed.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A long baby blue fruit in a cylindrical shape, with dark blue swirls going around it, strangely it looks like it could quench your thirst.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to create and manipulate bottles, or turn the bottles into magical cola drinks.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Bottle Creation
entries: You can use your action to magically create a bottle in your hand. The bottle can be of any size or shape you choose and can hold up to 1 gallon of liquid. You can have a total number of bottles equal to twice your proficiency bonus at once. You can dismiss any number of bottles using a bonus action, causing any liquid inside them to also be destroyed.

entries.name: Bottle Projectile
entries: Your learn the {@spell magic stone|XGE} cantrip, using bottles instead of stones.

entries.name: Special Cola Delivery
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to fill a bottle you are holding with a magical cola. This cola acts as any single common or uncommon potion (see standard 5th edition {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}) of your choice when consumed. You can only have one potion effect active per bottle. The effects of the special cola drink expire after 24 hours, turning it into a regular cola that lacks carbonation.

entries.name: Spells (Bottle Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Catapult|XGE} (targeting a bottle you've created; 1 charge, can be cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Hero Cola (as {@spell Heroism}; 1 charge, can be cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Beast Cola (as {@spell Enhance Ability}; 2 charges), or Revival Cola (as {@spell Revivify}; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Bottle Banquet)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you create magic colas from the terrain around you, and you can use an action to grant up to 5 allies within 30 feet of you the effects of one of your special colas each for free (no charges or colas required for this ability). Additionally, as a part of the same action, you create up to 5 Rare Potions of your choice, which can be distributed and consumed instantly by you or the targets of your awakening. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A black dragon fruit which appears lightly transparent, with a very faint purple light flickering from within.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to manipulate light, causing areas to become dimmer or completely dark.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Shadow Sight
entries: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

entries.name: Area Dimming
entries: As an action, you can create a 20-foot-radius sphere of {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} centered on a point you choose within 60 feet. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is {@quickref Vision and Light||2||lightly obscured}. Alternatively, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge as a part of this action to make the area completely dark, making it {@quickref Vision and Light||2||heavily obscured} for creatures without {@sense darkvision} or light. It lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it as an action.

entries.name: Cloak of Night
entries: As a bonus action, you can wrap yourself in a cloak of darkness. While in {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} or darkness, you can take the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Spells (Dimming Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Darkness} (2 charges), or {@spell Hunger of Hadar} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Total Blackout)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast the {@spell Dark Star|EGW} spell, without expending a spell slot or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A gray, colorless pineapple-like fruit, however all the points and leaves are unnaturally dull to touch.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the power to drain the color and sharpness from their surroundings, making everything appear dull and lifeless.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Dulling Aura
entries: As a dulling being, you can emanate an aura of dullness that affects a 5-foot radius around you. You can activate or deactivate this aura as a bonus action. While the aura is active, all colors within the area become dull and muted, and creatures looking through or into the area have disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight. Additionally, any sharp or bladed traps, objects, or weapon receive a {@dice 1d4} reduction to damage rolls against you or other creatures within your Dulling Aura.

entries.name: Dulling Glare
entries: As an action, you can glare at an object or creature within 30 feet of you and drain its color. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or become dull. Objects affected by this ability lose any vibrant or distinct colors they may have had. Creatures affected by this ability have disadvantage on Charisma-based skill checks and saving throws, as their appearance becomes less appealing. Additionally, the creature has disadvantage on any weapon attacks which deal slashing or piercing for the duration, as its sharp and pointy weapons lose their potency. The effect lasts for 1 minute, and a creature can make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC at the end of each of its turns to end the effect on itself.

entries.name: Spells (Dulling Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Dulling Spray (as {@spell Color spray}, but removes color; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Blur} (2 charges), or {@spell Dispel Magic} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (World of Dullness)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a 60-foot radius sphere of dullness centered on you. The area within the sphere becomes dull and colorless, and creatures of your choice within the area are affected by your Dulling Aura. Additionally, each creature of your choice in the area is immune to the {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} condition.

Enemy creatures within the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw at the start of each turn or become dull until the start of their next turn. While dull, any piercing or slashing damage a creature deals becomes 0 for the duration. The area lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. After using this ability, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A black ball fruit that kind of looks like a disco ball, but instead of it being squares that reflect light, it's the swirls themselves that are tiny mirrors.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to dance very well while forcing others to break into dance, which can be incredibly useful if you wish to create a popular band.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Enchanted Rhythm
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Performance} skill, and gain advantage on checks made to dance. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being slowed or immobilized.

entries.name: Dance Performance
entries: As an action, you can choose to perform one of the following dance styles and gain its benefits for up to 1 minute. You cannot perform multiple dances simultaneously. You must concentrate on maintaining these performances, as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell:

entries.name: Disco
entries: As you perform a lively disco dance, you exude an aura of energy in a 30-foot radius centered on you. You and your allies within the aura have advantage on Charisma-based skill checks.

entries.name: Hip Hop
entries: With your hip hop performance, you channel raw energy. Your movement speed increases by 15 feet.

entries.name: Tango
entries: As you perform a passionate tango, you can choose one willing creature within 5 feet of you to be your dance partner. While you maintain the tango, both you and your partner gain a +2 bonus to AC, and you can move through other creatures' spaces without provoking opportunity attacks. If your partner is separated from you by more than 5 feet, the effect ends for both of you.

entries.name: Waltz
entries: Your graceful waltz mesmerizes those around you. As long as you maintain the waltz, you have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks, and hostile creatures within 30 feet of you have disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.

entries.name: Ballet
entries: Your elegant ballet dance enchants the area around you. While you maintain the ballet, you gain a flying speed of 30 feet, which only lasts during your turn, after which you fall to the ground if you are midair.

entries.name: Spells (Dancing Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Uncontrollable Breakdance (as {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter}; 1 charge), Flawless Footwork (as {@spell Kinetic Jaunt|SCC}; 2 charges), or Hypnotic Dance (as {@spell Hypnotic Pattern}, forcing creatures to dance in place if they fail; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Dance of Domination)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to perform a mesmerizing dance in a 30-foot radius centered on you. Each creature of your choice in the area must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, creatures are affected by the Otto's Irresistable Dance spell. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A toxic green devil fruit that looks like a bumpy cloud, it's swirls are a darker shade of green.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to produce and control foul odors, making them a Stinking Human. The user can release these odors in various ways to affect their surroundings and others.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Stench Resistance
entries: You are immune to the effects of your own stink and any other stinking or nauseating effects.

entries.name: Skunk Spray
entries: You learn the {@spell poison spray} cantrip.

entries.name: Stinking Aura
entries: As an action, you can activate an aura of stink that extends 5 feet from you in all directions for up to 1 minute. Any creature that enters or starts its turn in the area must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or become {@condition poisoned} until the start of their next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to your Stinking Aura for 24 hours. You can deactivate the aura as a bonus action.

entries.name: Stink Bomb
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to create and hurl a stink bomb at a point within 60 feet. The bomb explodes in a 20-foot radius cloud of foul odor, which lingers for 1 minute. Any creature in the cloud must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a successful save. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to your Stink Bomb for 24 hours.

entries.name: Spells (Stink Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Ray of Sickness} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), or {@spell Stinking Cloud} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Foul Miasma)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to release a miasma of stink in a 60-foot radius centered on you. The area in the radius acts as the {@spell Cloudkill} spell, except you and your allies are immune to its effects, but cannot see through it. The miasma lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. After using this ability, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A violet, delicate-looking fruit with a soft, velvety texture. It has pink, wavy patterns covering its surface and exudes a sweet, alluring aroma.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to produce and control various perfumes with different effects, making them a Perfume Human. The user can release these perfumes in various ways to affect their surroundings and others.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Perfume Resistance
entries: You are immune to the effects of your own perfumes and any other perfumes or scents.

entries.name: Pleasant Aroma
entries: You learn the {@spell friends} cantrip, no material components required.

entries.name: Scented Aura
entries: As an action, you can activate an aura of pleasant perfume that extends 5 feet from you in all directions for up to 1 minute. Any creature that enters or starts its turn in the area can choose to be {@condition charmed} by you until the start of their next turn. The {@condition charmed} creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to your Scented Aura for 24 hours. You can deactivate the aura as a bonus action.

entries.name: Spells (Perfume Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Charming Perfume ({@spell Charm Person}; 1 charge and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Enchanting Perfume (as {@spell Suggestion}; 2 charges), Hypnotizing Perfume (as {@spell Hypnotic Pattern}, 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Enchanting Fragrance)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can release a powerful fragrance into the air around you, allowing you to cast {@spell Mass Suggestion}, no spell slots or material components required. After using this ability, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A brown cube fruit that has cream swirls covering the surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to create and manipulate boxes of various sizes and materials, making them a Box Human. The user can use these boxes for storage, transportation, or even as a weapon.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Box Creation
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to create a 5-foot square magic box in your hands. The box can be of any appearance or texture you choose, as long as it fits within a 5-foot cube. You can have a total number of boxes equal to your proficiency bonus at once. You can dismiss any number of boxes as a bonus action, causing any contents inside them to spill out. Boxes are able to be destroyed, having 20 hit points and 11 AC. If a box is destroyed, objects stored within spill out.

entries.name: Box Storage
entries: As an action, you can touch an object with a box and store it within the box. The object must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. You can store up to three objects in a single box. As an action, you can touch the box and release one stored object, which appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you.

entries.name: Box Teleportation
entries: As an action, you can link two adjacent boxes you have created together by touching them. For 1 hour, any creature that steps into one of the linked boxes using 15 feet of movement to climb into a box magically teleports and appears within the other linked box. You can spend an action to seal the lid of a box from the top, which blocks any creatures from emerging from it, or an action to unseal it. Once you use this action to link two boxes together, you cannot do so again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Mystery Box
entries: As an action, you or an ally can place a box on the ground within 5 feet of you and make it a Mystery Box. It retains these properties for 1 minute, or until you end it as a bonus aciton. As an additional bonus action, so long as a box remains a mystery box, you can clap your hands togehter and cause it to trigger a random effect centered on itself. If you do so, roll a {@dice d10} on the Mystery Box table below to determine the effect. The duration of any effect or spell created by the box is 1 minute, after which the box is destroyed. The DC or modifier of any spell or effect it triggers is equal to your Devil Fruit spell save DC or modifier.

entries.caption: Mystery Box
rows: Roll twice on this table, triggering two effects on this table instead of one and re-rolling if you get this result again.
The box spits out {@dice 1d4} magic cookies at the start of each of your turns, which act as goodberries when consumed.
The box transforms into a wooden Dire Wolf, which is considered a construct, for the duration and attacks any creature closest to it.
The box animates (as if casting animate objects on a medium sized object), and fights for you for the duration.

Any creature within 10 feet of the box must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become transformed into a box until the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition incapacitated} for the duration.
The box spits out a Wand of Magic Missiles (see standard 5th edition DMG), which is immediately identified by every creature that sees it, and it lasts for the duration of the box.
Every creature within 30 feet of the box becomes vulnerable to bludgeoning damage for the duration.
The box releases five +3 pieces of ammunition that can be used by any ranged weapon, which lose their magical properties after the duration ends.
The box casts healing word on the creature closest to it at the start of each of your turns.
Roll a {@dice d100}, and the box casts a random Wild Magic Surge effect from itself, using your modifiers.

entries.name: Spells (Box Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Box Blast (as {@spell Thunderwave}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Box Toss (as {@spell Shatter}; 2 charges), or Box Shelter (as Tiny Hut; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Box Prison)
entries: Once awakened, you can cast Forceage, without expending a spell slot or material components, which appears as an opaque and invincible box material. After you use this action, you can't use it again for 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A beige fruit with green swirls, it's form is soft and slightly malleable before eating, which is definitely unappealing.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to regurgitate dangerous and destructive substances from their mouth, making them a Vomit Human.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Acidic Spit
entries: Thanks to your new abilities, you learn the {@spell Acid Splash} cantrip to "Hurl" at your enemies. Additionally, you are immune to acid damage.

entries.name: Vomit Stream
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to shoot a stream of vomit from your mouth at a target creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or take {@damage 2d8} acid damage. Unless the target avoids taking any of this damage, any nonmagical metal armor worn by the target takes a permanent -1 penalty to the AC it offers, and any nonmagical metal weapon it is carrying or wearing takes a permanent -1 penalty to damage rolls. The penalty worsens each time a target is subjected to this effect. If the penalty on an object drops to -5, the object is destroyed.

entries.name: Spells (Vomit Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Caustic Vomit (as {@spell Tasha's Caustic Brew|TCE}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Vomit Arrow (as Acid Arrow; 2 charges), or Explosive Vomit (as {@spell Fireball}; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Vomit Torrent)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a massive torrent of vomit in a 30-foot radius aura centered on you, which lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. When you activate this awakening, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and when the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 7d8} acid damage and is subjected to your Vomit Stream's armor and weapon penalties. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't subjected to your Vomit Stream's effects. After using this ability, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A golden lock shaped fruit with the stem forming the handle, dark gray swirls go around the fruit except the center which is a black keyhole symbol.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to create and manipulate keys, making them a Key Human. The user can use these keys to unlock or lock any lock, as well as create weapons made of keys.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Key Creation
entries: As an action, you can create a key that can open a single mundane door, lid, or lock that you can see and touch within 5 feet. The key can be any shape or size you choose, as long as it fits into the lock and isn't larger than 5 feet in length. This key only work on standard locks, and does not allow you to unlock more complex doors, contraptions or magical devices.

entries.name: Master Key
entries: As an action, you spend 3 devil fruit charges to create a Master Key, which disappears after 1 minute has passed. When you attempt to unlock, disable, or otherwise manipulate any contraption that would require thieves tools or a single unlocking device, you automatically succeed on any checks with the master key. Once this master key is used, it is destroyed.

entries.name: Key Blade
entries: As an action, you can target a single melee weapon you are proficient with your devil fruit powers. It now becomes a "Key" weapon, which can bypass any resistance to nonmagical damage from the selected weapon's damage type. You can only have one Key weapon at a time, and any time you create a new Key weapon, any previous Key weapons you have made revert back to their original form and properties.

entries.name: Spells (Key Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Magic Keychain (as Magic Misile; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Arcane Lock} (2 charges), {@spell Knock} (2 charges), or {@spell Glyph of Warding} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Key Swarm)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a massive swarm of keys in a 60-foot radius centered on you. The area becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and any creature of your choice within the area which enters the area for the first time during its turn or starts its turn in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} force damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn, becoming "Locked" for the duration. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition stunned}. A creature can repeat this save at the end of each of its turns. The swarm lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. After using this ability, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A blood red watermelon with black swirls, with vein-like protrusions across it.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to manipulate and harness the power of anger, making them an Anger Human. The user to fling themselves into a superhuman rage, or make others do so.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Mental Resistance
entries: You become immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.

entries.name: Reckless Anger
entries: By increasing your anger, you can throw aside all concern for defense to attack with fierce desperation. When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to a⁠ttack recklessly. Doing so gives you advantage on melee weapon a⁠ttack rolls during this turn, but atta⁠ck rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

entries.name: Anger Amplification
entries: As an action, you can expend 1 devil fruit charge to amplify the anger within a creature within 60 feet of you. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature is affected by the {@spell Confusion} spell for 1 minute, and deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of its weapon's damage type on each of its melee weapon attacks for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, an affected target can make a Wisdom saving throw. If it succeeds, this effect ends for that target, and it becomes immune to your Anger Amplifcaiton for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Spells (Anger Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Wrathful Smite} (1 charge), {@spell Compelled Duel} (1 charge), {@spell Enthrall} (2 charges), or {@spell Haste} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Rage Tempest)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a storm of anger in a 60-foot radius centered on you. Any creature of your choice within the area when it is first created must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or take {@damage 2d6} psychic damage and becomes consumed by anger, falling victim to the effects of your Anger Amplification for the duration. The creature can repeat this save at the end of each of its turns. If a creature succeeds on a save, it is immune to this effect for 24 hours. This awakening effect lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. After using this ability, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. An orange kiwi type fruit with hair only on the pink swirls, causing the fruit to either feel rough or smooth depending on where you touch it.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to manipulate and control friction, making them a Friction Human. The user can increase or decrease friction within a certain radius.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Frictionless Fighter
entries: Thanks to your newfound abilities, you are completely immune to {@quickref difficult terrain||3} caused by natural environments, you have 10 feet of extra movement, and your movement speed cannot be reduced by your devil fruit's spells or abilities.

entries.name: Friction Control
entries: As an action, you can increase or decrease the friction within a 20-foot radius centered on a point you can see within 60 feet. The area becomes either high-friction or low-friction, respectively. If the area is high-friction, it becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. If the area is low-friction, creatures move at twice their movement speed within the area. The effect lasts for 1 minute or until you use this feature again.

entries.name: Spells (Friction Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Decreased Friction (as {@spell Grease}; 1 charge), Total Friction (as {@spell Hold Person}; 2 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), or Friction Zone (as {@spell Plant Growth}; affecting any area, not just plants; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Friction Mastery)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to manipulate friction on a grand scale. You can increase or decrease the friction within a 120-foot radius centered on a point you can see within 300 feet, and the area becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3}. A creature that moves inside the area or starts its turn in the area must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC if it moves into the area or starts inside the area during its turn. On a failure, if the area is frictionless, the creature falls {@condition prone}, taking {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage, and cannot stand up for the rest of its turn, sliding in a random direction for up to half the target's movement, taking up it's full movement. Alternatively, on a failure, if the area has enhanced friction, the target takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage from the friction and is {@condition restrained} until the end of its turn. Your allies are immune to the effects of this area. After using this ability, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A shiny and clear cluster of crystal grapes, with silvery swirls on each grape. The stem itself is still completely visible.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to create glass out of any material, making them a Glass Human. The user can also transmute objects into glass objects, manipulate existing glass, and change the properties of glass.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Light Refraction
entries: You can control the air around you as if it were glass, allowing you to refract light in different ways. You learn the {@spell minor illusion} and {@spell word of radiance|XGE} cantrips, no material components required.

entries.name: Glass Transmutation
entries: As an action, you can make a Larger or smaller object, or up to a 10-foot area of an object or material, into clear glass. The object retains its durability and stats, but can be seen through by you and other creatures as if it is fully transparent glass. You can also make this glass one-way, only allowing creatures to see through it from one side, while the other sides are opaque when viewing it from a different angle, allowing for the user to spy on others very effectively. The effect lasts for 1 minute or until you use this feature again.

entries.name: Mirror Reflection
entries: As a bonus action, you can use 1 devil fruit charge to create a mirror-like surface on any glass object you can see within 30 feet, which lasts for 1 minute or until the object is destroyed. The mirror reflects light and can be used to blind creatures. Each creature which starts its turn within 15 feet of the mirror must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their turn.

entries.name: Spells (Glass Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Refractive Bolt (as {@spell Guiding Bolt}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Silent Image} (1 charge), {@spell Mirror Image} (2 charges), Refractive Beam (as {@spell Moonbeam}; 2 charges), or Refractive Zone (as {@spell Spirit Guardians}; radiant damage only; 3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Glass Mastery)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to manipulate the refraction of light on a grand scale, allowing you to cast {@spell Sunburst}, without expending a spell slot or material components . After using this ability, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A rose colored lemon in the shape of lips, the swirls are a deep red like a nice shade of lipstick.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to manipulate laughter, making them a Laughter Human. The user can induce laughter in others, manipulate the volume and tone of laughter, and even use laughter to create shockwaves.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Mental Resillience
entries: You are resistant to psychic damage, as you are always in high spirits.

entries.name: Mocking Joke
entries: You learn the {@spell vicious mockery} cantrip, forcing targets to laugh uncontrollably from your jokes. When a creature fails their saving throw against this cantrip when you use it, they also fall {@condition prone} due to laughter.

entries.name: Laughter Manipulation
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Performance} and {@skill Persuasion} skills. You can spend 1 devil fruit charge to gain advantage on any charisma check, as you induce a state of eurphoric laughter in creatures around you.

entries.name: Joyful Aura
entries: As an action, you can expend 1 devil fruit charge to create an aura of joy and laughter around you. For 1 minute, all creatures within a 10-foot radius of you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} and gain temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus at the start of each of their turns.

entries.name: Spells (Laughter Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Tasha's Hideous Laughter} (1 charge), {@spell Calm Emotions} (2 charges), Booming Laughter (as {@spell Shatter}; 2 charges), or {@spell Beacon of Hope} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Laughter Overdrive)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to unleash an overwhelming wave of laughter energy. Each creature within a 30-foot radius of you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature falls {@condition prone}, becoming {@condition incapacitated} with laughter for 1 minute, during which it can't speak or move. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. After using this ability, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.ability, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A white apple with peach coloured swirls going along it, the stem growing In a Volume symbol to represent sound.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to manipulate their hearing and the volume of sounds around them, making them a Hearing Human.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Hearing Aids
entries: You are immune to being {@condition deafened}, and gain resistance to thunder damage.

entries.name: Enhanced Hearing
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill, and you have advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Tuning In
entries: You gain {@sense blindsight} up to a range of 40 feet. As an action, you can amplify any sound you can hear within 120 feet. You can make a whisper audible to everyone in the area, cause a normal conversation to become deafening, or make a loud noise even louder. You can also focus your hearing to listen to a specific conversation or sound within range, even if it's behind a closed door or wall.

entries.name: Spells (Hearing Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Dissonant Whispers} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Silence} (2 charges), or {@spell Shatter} (2 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Sonic Resonance)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create an intense sonic resonance in a 30-foot radius centered on you. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 7d10} thunder damage, is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition deafened} or knocked {@condition prone}. After using this ability, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A black pear-shaped fruit with a white crack down the middle. On both sides of the crack, the swirls seem to be going in opposite directions.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to create powerful elemental attacks by snapping their fingers, making them a Snapping Human. The user can unleash bursts of fire, bolts of electricity, or gusts of wind with a simple snap.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Deadly Snapping
entries: You learn the fire bolt, gust, and {@spell lightning lure|TCE} cantrips, no material components required.

entries.name: Elemental Snap
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to snap your fingers and choose one of the following elemental effects: Fire Snap, Electric Snap, or Wind Snap. Each elemental snap has a range of 60 feet and targets a creature or point you can see within range:

entries.name: Fire Snap:
entries: The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage and catches on fire. At the start of each of its turns, a creature on fire takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. A creature can use its action to put out the flames, ending the effect.

entries.name: Electric Snap:
entries: The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} lightning damage and is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition paralyzed}.

entries.name: Wind Snap:
entries: The target must make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 15 feet away from you. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

entries.name: Spells (Snap Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 5 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Chaos Bolt|XGE} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Gust of Wind} (2 charges), {@spell Fireball} (3 charges), or {@spell Lightning Bolt} (3 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Final Snap)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to unleash a massive elemental explosion in a 60-foot cone originating from you. Each creature in the cone must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d6} fire damage, {@damage 5d6} lightning damage, and is pushed to the end of the cone and knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}. After using this ability, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

item.name: Inu Inu no Mi, Model: Dalmation

entries.name: Type
entries: Standard Zoan
Fruit appearance. This devil fruit appears as a fuzzy white grapefruit with black spots covering its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into a dalmation.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Shape
entries: As an action, you are able to transform into a Wolf (reflavored as a dalmation) from the standard 5th Edition {@book Monster Manual|MM}. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Hybrid Form
entries: You can use your action to enter a "hybrid" zoan state, combining a mix of qualities from both your humanoid form and beast form together for a temporary period of time. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Awakening
entries: Upon the awakening of your Zoan Devil Fruit power, when you enter your Hybrid Form, you can temporarily enter your Awakened State, which lasts for 1 minute.

While your Awakened State is active, your hit point maximum and hit points increase by 50, your weapon attacks and unarmed strike attacks deal extra damage of their primary damage type equal to your character level, and you are able to select an additional hybrid form option. Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

Should the duration of your Awakened State expire, you hold the option to extend its span for an additional minute, at the cost of incurring a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If needed, you can further extend this state by enduring an extra level of {@condition exhaustion} for each additional minute. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

entries: Upon the awakening of your Zoan Devil Fruit power, when you enter your Hybrid Form, you can temporarily enter your Awakened State, which lasts for 1 minute.

While your Awakened State is active, your hit point maximum and hit points increase by 50, your weapon attacks and unarmed strike attacks deal extra damage of their primary damage type equal to your character level, and you are able to select an additional hybrid form option. Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

Should the duration of your Awakened State expire, you hold the option to extend its span for an additional minute, at the cost of incurring a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If needed, you can further extend this state by enduring an extra level of {@condition exhaustion} for each additional minute. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Hybrid Form
entries: You can use your action to enter a "hybrid" zoan state, combining a mix of qualities from both your humanoid form and beast form together for a temporary period of time. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Awakening
entries: Upon the awakening of your Zoan Devil Fruit power, when you enter your Hybrid Form, you can temporarily enter your Awakened State, which lasts for 1 minute.

While your Awakened State is active, your hit point maximum and hit points increase by 50, your weapon attacks and unarmed strike attacks deal extra damage of their primary damage type equal to your character level, and you are able to select an additional hybrid form option. Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

Should the duration of your Awakened State expire, you hold the option to extend its span for an additional minute, at the cost of incurring a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If needed, you can further extend this state by enduring an extra level of {@condition exhaustion} for each additional minute. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A small pink cherry blossom-shaped fruit with intricate petal patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to heal wounds and restore vitality through tears. The user can also accelerate natural healing processes in living creatures.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Healing Hands
entries: You have a pool of healing power that replenishes at the start of each dawn. With that pool, you can restore a total number of hit points equal to your level × 5. As an action, you can touch a creature and draw power from the pool to restore a number of hit points to that creature, up to the maximum amount remaining in your pool.

entries.name: Spells (Healing Tears)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Cure Wounds} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Lesser Restoration} (2 charges), {@spell Aura of Vitality} (3 charges), {@spell Greater Restoration} (4 charges), {@spell Mass Cure Wounds} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Full Bloom)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Mass Heal} without expending any charges or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A bright orange pineapple with an extra sharp rind and spiraling patterns across its surface.

entries.name: Description
