entries: This fruit allows the user to transform any part of their body into scissors, which can be used to cut and manipulate objects and space as if they were paper. The user is also able to fold and transform objects or terrain that have been snipped.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Scissor Hands
entries: Your hands can transform into scissors, granting you the ability to cut through nonmagical materials effortlessly. Your unarmed strikes deal an additional {@damage 1d6} slashing damage. You deal double damage to structures and objects with your unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Material Cut
entries: As an action, you can make an unarmed strike against any object or structure within range. If the attack hits and the object isn't made of seastone, you can carve or remove up to a 5-foot square of space out of the material. The removed material is then moved out into an empty space within 5 feet of you.

entries.name: Spells (Cutting Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Snipping Hands (as {@spell Burning Hands}, but dealing slashing damage instead; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Meld into Stone} (3 charges), {@spell Stone Shape} (4 charges), {@spell Wall of Stone} (5 charges), or {@spell Passwall} (5 cahrges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Spirit Thread Snip)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to perform a cutting technique that can sever even the threads of another creature's fighting spirit. Choose one creature you can see within 30 feet. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature's ties to one feature or ability, such as spellcasting or a special attack, are severed, rendering it unable to use that ability until it completes a long rest. On a successful save, the creature takes {@damage 6d6} force damage. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A colorful striped spherical fruit with a very long stem on the bottom of it.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to create and manipulate candy at will. This candy can be used in various ways, from construction to combat, and has unique properties that allow it to be both hard as steel or soft and sticky.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Candy Creation
entries: You can create objects, weapons, or structures made of candy. These objects have a hardness and weight similar to steel but can be shaped and colored as you desire. As an action, you can create a candy object of a size up to a 5-foot cube. The object lasts for 1 hour or until you dismiss it.

entries.name: Sweet Combat
entries: Weapons you create from candy have the same properties as their normal counterparts but are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance. You are proficient with any candy weapon you create.

entries.name: Candy Petrification
entries: As an action, you can spend 5 devil fruit charges to attempt to petrify a creature within 30 feet of you, turning them into candy. The target must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature is affected by the {@spell Flesh to Stone} spell and has one failure. On a success, the creature isn't affected.

entries.name: Spells (Candy Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Candy Slug ({@spell Tenser's Floating Disk}; 1 charge), Candy Armor ({@spell Mage Armor}; 1 charge), Candy Net ({@spell Web}; 2 charges), Candy Arrows ({@spell Cordon of Arrows}; 2 charges), Candy Tentacles ({@spell Evard's Black Tentacles}; 4 charges), or Wall of Candy ({@spell Wall of Stone}; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Candy Gallery)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cover everyone within 60 feet of you with an extremely sticky and hardening candy. Each creature of your choice in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition restrained}. It must then make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves three times, the spell ends. If it fails its save three times, it permanently turns to stone and is subjected to the {@condition petrified} condition. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind. You can't use this feature again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A long cylindrical pale yellow fruit, with dripping patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to create and manipulate wax, using it to form structures, weapons, and barriers. The wax is as hard as steel and can be shaped into nearly any form.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Wax Creation
entries: You can create objects, weapons, or structures made of wax. These objects have a hardness similar to steel but can be molded into complex shapes. As an action, you can create a wax object of a size up to a 5-foot cube. The object lasts for 1 hour or until you dismiss it.

entries.name: Wax Combat
entries: Weapons you create from wax have the same properties as their normal counterparts but are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance. You are proficient with any wax weapon you create.

entries.name: Wax Petrification
entries: As an action, you can spend 5 devil fruit charges to attempt to petrify a creature within 30 feet of you, turning them into wax. The target must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature is affected by the {@spell Flesh to Stone} spell and has one failure. On a success, the creature isn't affected.

entries.name: Spells (Wax Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Wax Armor ({@spell Mage Armor}; 1 charge), Wax Bind ({@spell Hold Person}; 2 charges), Wax Clones ({@spell Mirror Image}; 2 charges), Control Wax (as {@spell Control Water} but melting and controlling your wax instead of water; 4 charges), Wall of Wax ({@spell Wall of Stone}; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Wax Sculptor)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a lifelike wax duplicate of an allied humanoid you can see within 60 feet. The duplicate acts as a Simulacrum with half the hit points of the original creature and follows your commands. The duplicate lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A round, pink fruit with a stem that resembles a fuse, and spiral patterns across its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to create and detonate explosions at will. The user can also infuse parts of their body with explosive energy.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.
Explosion Immunity You gain immunity to fire damage.

entries.name: Bomb Body
entries: Your body becomes highly explosive. When you are hit with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to cause an explosion, forcing the attacker to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to your Devil Fruit save DC). On a failed save, they take {@damage 2d8} fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Explosive Creation
entries: You can flick your explosive boogers You learn the {@spell fire bolt} cantrip. Additionally, you can touch an object no larger than a 5-foot square and imbue it with explosive energy as an action. As a bonus action, you can cause the object to explode if it is within 60 feet of you. Any creature within a 10-foot radius must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC as above), taking {@damage 3d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Only a number of objects equal to your proficiency bonus can remain explosive at a time, and it can only remain explosive in this way for 1 hour.

entries.name: Spells (Explosive Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Bombing Hands ({@spell Burning Hands}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Explosive Impact ({@spell shatter}; 2 charges), Bomb Ball ({@spell fireball}; 3 charges), Explosion Wall ({@spell wall of fire}; 4 charges), and {@spell Flame Strike} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Final Detonation)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Delayed Blast Fireball}, without expending a spell slot or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A square-shaped fruit, similar in appearance to a die, with a blue-purple color and spiral patterns on its faces.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to eat virtually anything and everything, including inorganic substances, without harm to their body. Additionally, the user can gain the properties of anything they consume.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Anything Eater
entries: You can consume any material, including metal, wood, and stone, without suffering harm and it counts as food for you. Your teeth are also a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d10} + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Gained Properties
entries: As an action you can make one unarmed strike against a material with your teeth. If it hits, you consume up to a 5-foot square of that material and you gain certain properties associated with it. Based on the material you eat, you gain the following features for 1 hour after consuming it (you can only gain one of these benefits at a time):

entries.name: Cloth, Paper, or Rope
entries: your body becomes as light as paper. You have advantage on dexterity saves.

entries.name: Glass, Crystal, or Ice
entries: your body becomes transparent and you gain advanctage on dexterity (stealth) checks.

entries.name: Wood
entries: your skin has a bark-like appearance, and your AC can't be less than 16, regardless of what kind of armor you are wearing. You can also use the {@spell thorn whip} cantrip for the duration.

entries.name: Stone
entries: your body becomes as hard as stone. You have resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

entries.name: Metal
entries: your skin has a tough, metallic appearance, and your AC can't be less than 18, regardless of what kind of armor you are wearing.

entries.name: Spells (Munch Forms)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Regenerative Munch ({@spell Cure Wounds}; Self; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Gecko Munch ({@spell spider climb}; 2 charges), Air Bite ({@spell gaseous form}; 3 charges), Form-Stealing Munch ({@spell {@spell polymorph}} spell into creature you've bitten within last hour; Self; 4 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Ultimate Munch Form)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell true polymorph}, turning yourself into a creature you've bitten before, without expending a spell slot or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Altering Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A peach-shaped fruit with a purple top and a light orange bottom, with spiral patterns marking the division between the two colors.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to transform anything they touch into art and render it useless. This art can take any form the user imagines, so long as it vaguely resembles its previous form.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Art Transformation
entries: You can transform any inanimate, nonmagical object you can see into your own artistic interpretation of it. By spending 1 minute transforming an object no larger than 100 x 100 feet in size into a piece of art resembling its old form, you can render it useless in function for up to 10 hours. For example, if it is a ship or vehicle it can no longer take any actions to move. If it is a weapon or cannon, it can no longer be used to attack.

Creature painting. As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to target a creature within 30 feet of you. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against you Devil Fruit save DC or become {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute as it is transformed into a functionless piece of art. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the effect ends on the target.

entries.name: Spells (Art Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Sketch Mirage ({@spell Silent Image}; 1 charge), Illusion Painting ({@spell Phantasmal Force}; 2 charges), Materpiece Illusion ({@spell Major Image}; 3 charges), Art Swirl ({@spell Hypnotic Pattern}; 3 charges), Land of Art ({@spell Hallucinatory Terrain}; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Art Dimension)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Demiplane}, creating a demiplane full of art, without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A yellow fruit, reminiscent of a lumpy pear, covered in a pattern of sticky swirls.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to generate and control a sticky substance. This substance can be used for a variety of purposes, from ensnaring enemies to climbing walls.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Sticky Substance Production
entries: You can generate a sticky substance from your body. As an action, you can cover a surface within 5 feet of you in this substance. An area covered in this substance is considered {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, and a creature that steps on or touches the sticky surface must succeed on a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check against your Devil Fruit save DC or be {@condition restrained} until they succeed on the check. Objects that aren't being worn or carried will naturally stick and adhere to this substance. This coating lasts for 1 hour, and you can only cover up to 100 x 100 feet of a surface with this substance at once.

entries.name: Adhesive Travel
entries: You can use your sticky substance to stick to and climb vertical surfaces and ceilings without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Sticky Trap
entries: As an action, you can generate a large glob of sticky substance and fling it at a point you can see within 30 feet of you. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the sticky substance. A creature {@condition restrained} by the sticky substance can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it is no longer {@condition restrained}.

entries.name: Spells (Sticky Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Sticky Ground ({@spell entangle}; 1 charge), Sticky Net ({@spell web}; 2 charges), Sticky Bind ({@spell slow}; 3 charges), Sticky Tentacles ({@spell Evard's Black Tentacles}; 4 charges), Gorilla Glue ({@spell hold monster}, 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Maximum Adherence)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cover everyone within 60 feet of you with an extremely sticky and hardening substance. Each creature of your choice in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition restrained}. It must then make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves three times, the spell ends. If it fails its save three times, it permanently turns to stone and is subjected to the {@condition petrified} condition. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind. You can't use this feature again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A violet fruit with numerous ridges, covered in typical spiral patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: Gives the user the ability to generate and manipulate books. Anything depicted or written within these books can be brought to reality or stored away, creating a powerful connection between the realms of fiction and reality.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Book Creation
entries: You can create books out of thin air, these books can be about any subject you have knowledge of. As an action, you can generate a book about a particular subject, granting you advantage on an Intelligence check related to that subject when you consult the book as part of the check.

entries.name: Fictional Manifestation
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charges to create a book that depicts a creature or an object, then turn a page to make it manifest in the real world for up to 1 hour. You must maintain {@status concentration} on this power to keep it (like {@status concentration} on a spell), or else the creature will return to your book. This can create simple objects no larger than huge or non-hostile, non-magical beasts (like horses, dogs, etc.) with a CR no greater than 1. The created creatures are friendly to you and your companions and follow simple commands.

entries.name: Spells (Book Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Hovering Books ({@spell Tenser's Floating Disk}; 1 charge), Psychological Scroll ({@spell Detect Thoughts}; 2 charges), {@spell Find Steed} (2 charges), {@spell Conjure Animals} (3 charges), World of Books ({@spell Hypnotic Pattern}; 3 charges), Book Absorption ({@spell Banishment} into a book; 4 charges), {@spell Find Greater Steed|XGE} (4 charges), {@spell Conjure Elemental} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Library of Legends)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a grand book that brings a more powerful creature from its pages. You can summon any creature you've seen before with a CR no greater than 5. The summoned creature is friendly to you and obeys your commands. It disappears after 1 hour or when it drops to 0 hit points. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. Translucent purple apple with blue stripes

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows its user to phase through physical objects and forces physical projectiles and weapons to pass through the user as well.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Weapon Immunity
entries: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, as physical objects pass through you. However, attacks made of living tissue do not phase through you, meaning you are not immune to unarmed strikes for example.

entries.name: Phase Movement
entries: You can choose to pass through physical objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, similar to a specter's incorporeal movement. However, this feature does not allow you to pass through living creatures. You take 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if you end your turn inside an object.
Additionally, you can choose to allow any creature or object you are touching or grappling to share this feature with you so long as they are touching you.

entries.name: Spells
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. Using your ability to phase through nonliving materials at rapid speeds and reappear somewhere else, you can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Absorb Elements|XGE} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Misty Step} (2 charges), {@spell Blink} (3 charges), {@spell Passwall} (5 charges), {@spell Far Step|XGE} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Reality Phase)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Etherealness}. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A light pink, peach-shaped fruit with a curled stem and several swirly patterns across its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to see through everything and read the thoughts and memories of others. It also allows the user to project their vision in the form of floating eyes that can see far distances and through solid objects.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: X-Ray Vision
entries: You gain the ability to see through solid objects. As an action, you can activate this vision, allowing you to see through up to 5 feet of wood, dirt, or stone, 1 foot of metal, or any amount of flesh or similar materials.

entries.name: Memory Peering
entries: You have advantage on insight checks. Additionally, as an action, you can read the surface thoughts of one creature within 30 feet of you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or you gain insight into its reasoning (if any), its emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind (such as something it worries over, loves, or hates). Alternatively, you can use telepathy within 30 feet of you to transfer your memories or thoughts to another creature.

entries.name: Spells (Insight Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Detect Thoughts} ( 2 charges), Tear Animals ({@spell conjure animals}; 3 charges), {@spell Clairvoyance} (3 charges), {@spell Arcane Eye} (4 charges), {@spell Scrying} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Mind Pillage)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to delve deeper into a creature's mind, revealing its deepest secrets. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, the target takes {@damage 6d10} psychic damage if you choose, and you gain information about its stats, true name, thoughts, history, identity, and background. On a success, the creature takes half as much psychic damage and you only identify its true name and surface thoughts. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A red apple with swirl patterns covering its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to merge with different living things or objects, enhancing their size and strength. The user can also incorporate the properties or abilities of the fused entity.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Fusion Enhancement
entries: As an action, you can merge with another willing creature or an object you touch. For 1 hour, your size category increases by one (up to a maximum of Gargantuan), and you gain advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. Your melee weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage. You can only merge with one creature at a time using this ability. You can unmerge as a bonus action.

entries.name: Incorporate Properties
entries: When you merge with a creature or object, you can choose one of its properties or abilities to gain for the duration of the merge (subject to DM's discretion).

entries.name: Spells (Fusion Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Enlarge/Reduce} (1 charge), {@spell Jump} (2 charges), {@spell Longstrider} (2 charges), {@spell Enhance Ability} (2 charges), {@spell Stoneskin} (Self; 4 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Grand Fusion)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to merge with up to three willing creatures or objects at the same time for 1 hour. Your size category increases by three (up to a maximum of Gargantuan), you gain advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and your melee weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 3d4} damage. You can choose one property or ability from each fused entity to gain for the duration of the merge. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A light pink fruit covered with petal patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: This fruit gives the user the ability to sprout parts of their body (usually hands or feet) on the surfaces of objects and living beings.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Limb Sprouting
entries: As an action, you can cause parts of your body to sprout on the surfaces of objects or living beings within 30 feet, for 1 minute. You can see, hear, and speak through these body parts as if you were in their place. These limbs share your AC and hit points, and can be attacked.

entries.name: Multi-Limb Actions
entries: As a bonus action, you can make an unarmed strike or attempt to grapple a creature within 30 feet using a sprouted limb. The attack uses your attack modifier and deals damage equal to an unarmed strike. If you grapple a creature with this ability, they are also {@condition restrained} until the grapple is broken.

entries.name: Spells (Petal Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Arms of Hadar} (1 charge), Arm {@spell Web} ({@spell web}; 2 charges), {@spell Hold Person} (2 charges), {@spell Evard's Black Tentacles} (4 charges), {@spell Bigby's Hand} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Demonio Fleur & Gran Jacuzzi Clutch)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to invoke the Demonio Fleur. You sprout a gargantuan, demonic avatar of your upper body within 60 feet. This avatar reflects your current hit points and your base AC (without armor), and shares your stats, resistances, immunities, and vulnerabilities. It does not have any equipment or weapons, it can't cast spells, and it acts on your initiative and its actions are controlled by you. It has a reach of 30 feet for its unarmed strikes, which deal damage equal to {@dice 2d8} + your strength modifier.

The sheer terror invoked by the Demonio Fleur forces all hostile creatures within 60 feet that can see it to make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or become {@condition frightened} until the end of your next turn.

As a bonus action, you can command the Demonio Fleur to execute the Gran Jacuzzi Clutch. The Demonio uses its giant sprouted arms to grab a target within its reach. The target must make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failure, they are {@condition restrained} and take {@damage 6d10} bludgeoning damage; on a success, they take half damage and are not {@condition restrained}.
The Demonio Fleur persists for 1 minute or until it drops to 0 hit points. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A cube-shaped, peach-like fruit with checkered patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to transform living beings into toys by touching them. The user can also make a contract with the transformed toys, forcing them to obey their commands.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Toy Transformation
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature within 5 feet of you and force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature is transformed into a toy version of itself, taking on the stats of a Monodrone (from the 5e monster manual). This transformation is permanent, unless removed by a {@spell Greater Restoration} spell or a similar effect. Otherwise, its personality and mental ability scores remain the same. You can also determine its size (tiny to gargantuan). The creature also loses any ability to cast spells, and any special abilities it may have had in its original form. While in toy form, the creature is {@condition charmed} by you and cannot harm you, and you can erase its memories while it is a toy. If you fall to 0 hit points, fall {@condition unconscious}, or fall victim to your Sea Weakness, every creature under the effects of your Toy Transformation reverts back to their original form. Alternatively, a creature can be freed from this effect with the Greater Restoration or {@spell Wish} spells. A creature that succeeds on saving against your Toy Transformation or is otherwise reverted back to its original form is immune to the effects of it for 24 hours.

entries.name: Contract Making
entries: As a bonus action, you can make a contract with a toy you have transformed. The toy obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you), as long as they don't involve harming you. If you are absent, the toy acts on its own to carry out your last given command.

entries.name: Spells (Toy Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Toy Servant ({@spell unseen servant}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Hold Toy (as {@spell hold person}; only works on toys of any size; 2 charges), Summon Toy ({@spell summon construct|TCE}; 4 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Overdrive Transformation)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cause all creatures within 30 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, they are transformed into toys, and are subject to the effects of your Toy Transformation and Contract Making abilities. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A rounded, white fruit with a stem that spirals at the top, and multiple swirl patterns on its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to create and control spectral entities known as "ghosts", manifesting various effects.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Astral Projection
entries: As an action, you can create a ghostly avatar from your body, resembling yourself. You can see through the ghost's senses, speak through it, and hear what it hears while it is within 1,000 feet of you. The entity acts according to your will and is immune to all damage types. It can fly up to 60 feet during your turn, and it can pass through walls, as if using the Incorporeal Movement feature, though it cannot pass through water or seastone. As an action, you can cause it to phase into the Ethereal Plane or back into the Material Plane. As an action, you can increase or decrease its size by one category. You can only have one ghostly avatar active at a time and it lasts until you fall {@condition unconscious} or fall victim to your Sea Weakness.

entries.name: Negative Hollow
entries: As an action, you can summon a small hollow from yourself or your ghostly avatar to touch a creature within 30 feet of the source (you or your ghostly avatar). The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or become affected by the ghost's negative energy, causing the target to fall into deep depression and lose the will to fight and become {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success and it becomes immune to your negative hollow for 24 hours.

entries.name: Spells (Ghost Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Cause Fear|XGE} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Hollow Detonation ({@spell shatter}; 2 charges), {@spell Phantasmal Force} (2 charges), {@spell Fear} (3 charges), {@spell Confusion} (4 charges), {@spell Phantasmal Killer} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Phantom Uprising)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to unleash a spectral maelstrom. Ghosts flood from you in a 60-foot radius and move through creatures and objects within the area. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be affected by the ghost's negative energy, becoming {@condition frightened}, and {@condition incapacitated} with despair for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Additionally, non-magical objects in the area are phased into the ethereal plane for the duration. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A pink pineapple-shaped fruit with a curly stem, and several curly patterns around it.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to create and control various hormones, which can be used to modify the bodies and minds of other creatures.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Syringe Fingers
entries: Your needle-like fingers are a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Hormone Manipulation
entries: You can use an action to alter the hormones of one willing creature you touch. An unwilling creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. This can cause one of the following effects: change the target's sex, give the target advantage on checks made with Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution (pick one) for 1 minute, or alter the target's current emotional state.

entries.name: Life-Risking Operation
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and expend 1 devil fruit charge to remove any one disease or neutralize one poison affecting it. The creature can also immediately end one effect on it that causes it to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Spells (Hormone Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Cure Wounds} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Enhance Ability} (2 charges), {@spell Haste} (3 charges), {@spell Greater Restoration} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Endocrine Dominance)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to release a powerful surge of hormones within a 60-foot radius centered on yourself. Enemy creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC, and friendly creatures can choose whether they are affected or not. On a failed save, creatures are subject to one of the following effects of your choice for 1 minute:

entries.name: Adrenaline Surge:
entries: The creature's speed doubles, and it gains advantage on Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution (choose one) checks and saving throws.

entries.name: Emotional Collapse:
entries: The creature becomes slowed (as if affected by the {@spell slow} spell) with overwhelming emotions of sadness, fear, or joy.

entries.name: Physical Atrophy:
entries: The creature's Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution (choose one) checks and saving throws are made at disadvantage.
An affected creature can make a new Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect early. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A turquoise fruit resembling a melon with various intricate swirl patterns and star-like designs.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit grants the user the ability to summon a genie-like entity from their body. This powerful spirit is bound to the user's will and aids them in combat.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Genie Manifestation
entries: As an action, you can summon the genie from within you by rubbing your body like a lamp. A Djinni genie (stat block for Djinni is in the standard 5e {@book Monster Manual|MM}) appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you. The genie lacks its Innate Spellcasting ability and Elemental Demise, and has hit points equal to your own. It remains as long as you concentrate (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell), to a maximum of 12 hours, or until it drops to 0 hit points. It then returns into your body.

While summoned, the djinni is friendly to you and your companions. It obeys any commands you give it. If you fail to command it, the djinni defends itself against attackers but takes no other actions.
After the djinni departs, it can't be summoned again until the next dawn. You can only have one genie summoned at a time.

entries.name: Spells (Genie Abilities)
entries: The genie has a pool of 9 charges. It can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells without needing to expend material components: {@spell Thunderwave} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Detect Evil and Good} (1 charge), {@spell Gust of Wind} (2 charges), {@spell Invisibility} (2 charges), {@spell Gaseous Form} (3 charges), {@spell Wind Wall} (3 charges), {@spell Major Image} (3 charges), or {@spell Creation} (5 charges). The genie regains expended charges when it is re-summoned.

entries.name: Awakening (Genie Unleashed)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to enhance your genie's power, turning it into a massive, even more formidable form. The genie's hit points double, its size increases to huge, its attacks deal an extra ammount equal to your proficiency bonus, and it radiates an aura in a 20-foot radius. Enemy creatures within the aura must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be {@condition frightened} until the end of their next turn. This empowered state lasts for the duration of your Awakened state. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A rough-textured, grayish fruit resembling a boulder with jagged patterns on its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit grants the user the ability to merge with, control, and reshape any form of stone they come into contact with. This allows for a versatile range of combat and defensive capabilities, as well as the ability to traverse through stone as if it were liquid.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Stone Meld
entries: As an action, you can merge with any stone surface, allowing you to traverse through it, effectively disappearing from sight. While merged, you can move within and emerge from any connected stone surface within 60 feet.

entries.name: Stone Manipulation
entries: You can reshape and control stone structures within 30 feet of you. This can be used to form weapons, barriers, or even simple tools. As an action, you can create a large-sized stone object (AC 17; with 27 ({@dice 5d10}) hit points). You can only do this once per minute.

entries.name: Stone Body
entries: You can spend 4 devil fruit charges to mold the stone around you to polymorph (as if using the {@spell polymorph} spell) yourself into a stone construct or earth elemental that has a challenge rating equal to or less than your level for up to 1 hour. However, your mental ability scores remain the same and you can speak while in this form. You remain this way as long as you concentrate on maintaining it (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). The transformation lasts for the duration, or until you drop to 0 hit points or die. You can continue to use your Devil Fruit abilities and spells in this form, so long as they don't require {@status concentration}, but cannot use any other class or racial features or spells for the duration.

entries.name: Spells (Stone Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Earth Tremor|XGE} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Maximilian's Earthen Grasp|XGE} (2 charges), {@spell Erupting Earth|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell Stone Shape} (4 charges), {@spell Stoneskin} (4 charges), {@spell Wall of Stone} (5 charges), {@spell Passwall} (5 charges), or {@spell Transmute Rock|XGE} (5 charges). You regain expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Terracotta Titan)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to pull from the very essence of the earth beneath you, creating a massive golem or suit of stone armor around yourself for 1 minute. In this state, you gain the benefits of your Stone Body devil fruit feature without needing to expend devil fruit charges, but can increase your size up to garganutan while polymorphed. You gain resistance to all damage (except force), your physical attacks deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus, and you have advantage on strength checks and saving throws. This empowered state lasts for 1 minute. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A vibrant orange, bulbous fruit with white dot patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit grants the user the ability to produce, control, and manipulate various mushroom spores with different properties, ranging from healing to poisoning. The user can cultivate these spores on any surface, living or non-living.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Poisonous Spores
entries: You become immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition. Additionally, you can cast the {@spell poison spray} cantrip without expending any material components.

entries.name: Hallucination Spores
entries: As an action, you can eject spores at one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The {@condition poisoned} target is {@condition incapacitated} while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success and it becomes immune to your hallucination and pacifying spores for 24 hours.

entries.name: Pacifying Spores
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to eject spores at one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on itself on a success and it becomes immune to your hallucination and pacifying spores for 24 hours.

entries.name: Spells (Spore Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Sleep} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Spore Barrage (as {@spell Cloud of Daggers} but deals poison or acid damage; 2 charges), {@spell Stinking Cloud} (3 charges), Spore Bomb (as {@spell Vitriolic Sphere|XGE}; 4 charges), {@spell Cloudkill} (5 charges). You regain expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Maximum Melting Spore Cloud)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Incendiary Cloud}, without expending a spell slot or material components. It deals poison or acid damage (your choice) instead of fire damage. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A bright yellow, rough-skinned fruit resembling a kiwi but with pronounced spikes protruding outwards.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to produce dango dumplings which allow them to command and control any beast which consumes it, allowing for communication, understanding, and allegiance with the beast.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Command
entries: As an action, you can throw a dango at the mouth of a beast you can see within 30 feet of you by spending 1 Devil Fruit charge. The targeted beast must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC to avoid the Dango. On a failed save, the beast is under your command (as if using animal friendship) for 1 month. The beast must not be a Zoan user or an otherwise polymorphed creature. If the beast suffers harm from you or your allies, it can make a Wisdom saving throw, breaking free on a success.

Beast regeneration. Once per long rest, you heal a beast you control and can see within 30 feet of you with a dango. By spending 1 Devil Fruit charge, the beast regains one of its hit dice plus your proficiency bonus in hit points.

entries.name: Animal Empathy
entries: You gain advantage on all Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks related to understanding beasts and their emotions.

entries.name: Spells (Beast Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Bless} (targeting beasts you control; 1 charge), {@spell Enhance Ability} (targeting a beast you control; 2 charges), {@spell Beast Bond|XGE} ({@spell Warding Bond} on a beast you control; 2 charges), Elemental Collar ({@spell Protection from Energy} on a beast you control; 3 charges), Wild Surge ({@spell Haste} on a beast you control; 3 charges), or {@spell Greater Restoration} (targeting a beast you control; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Beast Master's Dominion)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to release an aura in a 120-foot radius. All beasts within this radius must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be brought under your command for 10 minutes. A targeted beast must not be a Zoan user or an otherwise polymorphed creature. If a controlled beast suffers harm from you or your allies, it can make another Wisdom saving throw, breaking free on a success. You can't use this feature again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A dark-purple, nearly black, heart-shaped fruit with spiraled patterns running from its stem to its base.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to manipulate shadows, stealing them from living beings, and attaching them to other entities, including inanimate objects, thereby animating them.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Shadow Thief
entries: As an action, you can attempt to grab the shadow of a creature within 10 feet of you, so long as it has a CR of 1/8 or higher. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or have its shadow stolen. A creature can retrieve its shadow by destroying an undead or object which holds its shadow, or by placing salt in its mouth (touch; athletics or {@skill Sleight of Hand} against the undead or object's {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics}), or by stealing it back from you if you are holding it (touch; athletics or {@skill Sleight of Hand} against your {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics}). A creature missing its shadow falls victim to a vampire's Sunlight Hypersensitivity weakness (5e {@book Monster Manual|MM}). When you successfully steal a shadow from a creature, you gain 1 Devil Fruit charge. If a creature who has had its shadow stolen dies, you lose its shadow and thereby lose 1 devil fruit charge.

entries.name: Shadow Animate
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to animate a single medium or smaller sized dead creature or inanimate object (as if using animate dead or animate objects) by infusing it with a shadow you have stolen, except it has the same stats it would have if it were alive. A dead creature's CR must be equal to or less than 1 to be animated this way. This effect lasts until you end it as a bonus action (thus gaining 1 devil fruit charge as the shadow leaves its body) or it is destroyed (and the shadow returns to its host's body). If you wish to infuse a higher CR dead creature or larger object with shadows to animate it, you must spend a total number of charges equal to its CR (CR must be no greater than half your character level rounded up), or an additional charge for each size category the object is over medium, up to Huge (E.g. 2 charges for large, 3 for huge).

entries.name: Shadow Asgard
entries: You can absorb stolen shadows into your body to become larger and more powerful. By spending 1 Devil Fruit charge, you absorb a shadow into yourself. For each shadow you absorb, you gain 10 temporary hit points (which only stacks with each additional shadow absorbed) up to a maximum of 30, your weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage (up to a maximum bonus of {@dice 3d4}), your reach with melee weapons extends by 5 feet (up to a 15 foot total bonus), and your size increases by one (up to gargantuan). While this form is active, you have advantage on strength checks and saving throws. When you lose all temporary hit points granted by this ability, the shadows are expelled from your body and returned to its original host, and this ability ends.

entries.name: Doppelman
entries: You can detach your own shadow and animate it as a bonus action in an unoccupied space you can see within 15 feet of you. This shadow is a magical, translucent, dark image of you that lasts until it is destroyed, until you dismiss it as a bonus action, until you manifest another shadow, or until you're {@condition incapacitated}.

Your shadow has AC 14 + your proficiency bonus, 1 hit point, and immunity to all conditions and all damage except force and radiant damage. If it has to make a saving throw, it uses your saving throw bonus for the roll. It is the same size as you, and it occupies its space. On your turn, you can mentally command the shadow to move up to 30 feet in any direction (no action required). If your shadow is ever more than a mile away from you at the end of your turn, it is destroyed. If your Doppelman touches water or salt, it is also destroyed.

As a bonus action, you can teleport, magically swapping places with your shadow at a cost of 15 feet of your movement, regardless of the distance between the two of you. When you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn, any attack you make with that action can originate from your space or the shadow's space. You make this choice for each attack.

When a creature that you can see within 5 feet of your shadow moves at least 5 feet away from it, you can use your reaction to make an opportunity attack against that creature as if you were in the shadow's space.
If your Doppelman is ever destroyed or dismissed, your shadow returns to you. While your shadow is missing, you also fall victim to the vampire's Sunlight Hypersensitivity weakness.

entries.name: Spells (Shadow Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 maximum charges, but you start with none. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components, with the source of the spell being yourself or your Doppelman: Shadow Arms ({@spell Arms of Hadar}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Darkness} (2 charges), {@spell Shadow Blade|XGE} (2 charges), Shadow Bat Barrage ({@spell Conjure Barrage}; 3 charges), {@spell Evard's Black Tentacles} (4 charges), Night Parade ({@spell Danse Macabre|XGE} or {@spell Animate Objects}; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges when shadows are collected from Shadow Thief.

entries.name: Awakening (Shadow Legion)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can pull shadows from all objects around you and use an action to conjure up to 10 Shadows (see the {@book Monster Manual|MM} for statistics), for up to 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. The Shadows form in unoccupied spaces within 100 feet of you and obey your commands for 1 minute or until they are destroyed. You can dismiss one shadow as a free action during your turn, once per turn, and animate a dead creature you can see within 60 feet of you. The target rises at the start of your next turn as a zombie that is under your command for the duration of your awakening, following your verbal orders to the best of its ability. Once you use ability, you can't use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A heavy, light red-colored cylindrical apple with a sturdy stem and swirls across its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: This fruit grants the user the ability to manipulate their weight without changing their size. At will, the user can become as light as a feather or as heavy as a ton, granting them significant advantages in combat and mobility.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Weight Manipulation
entries: As an action, you can adjust your weight to 1 gram or 10,000 kilograms (10 metric tons) for 1 minute, or return to your regular weight. Changing your weight does not change your physical size or shape, and you return to your normal weight if you are knocked {@condition unconscious}.

When you weigh 1 gram: Your movement speed doubles, you can move over water or fragile surfaces without breaking them, you don't take fall damage, and you make dexterity checks and saving throws at advantage but make strength checks and saving throws at disadvantage. Your jump distance is also tripled.

When you weigh 10,000 kilograms: Your melee attacks deal an extra {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage, your speed and jump distance is halved, and you make strength checks and saving throws at advantage but make dexterity checks and saving throws at disadvantage. You are also immune to being pushed or pulled against your will.

entries.name: Gravity Slam
entries: When you're in the air (such as from a jump or fall), as a part of your action to become 10,000 kilograms, you can also deliver a crushing blow to enemies below you. All creatures within a 10-foot radius from where you land must make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (their choice) against your Devil Fruit save DC or take {@damage 4d10} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. If they succeed, they take half damage and aren't knocked {@condition prone}. You do not take fall damage so long as you don't fall more than 30 feet as a part of this ability.

entries.name: Spells (Kilogram Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Earth Tremor|XGE} (while 10,000 kilograms; Self; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Misty Step} (while 1 gram; 2 charges), {@spell Erupting Earth|XGE} (while 10,000 kilograms; Self; Doesn't affect you; 3 charges), {@spell Levitate} (while 1 gram; Self; 3 charges), {@spell Destructive Wave} (while 10,000 kilograms; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Absolute Gravity)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Gravity Fissure|EGW} at the 7th level, without expending a spell slot or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A deep red, heart-shaped fruit with gold streaks across its surface resembling cheering hands.

entries.name: Description
entries: This fruit grants the user the ability to bolster and encourage allies, enhancing their abilities and healing their wounds through sheer willpower and motivation.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Encouraged Human
entries: You learn the {@spell guidance} cantrip. Additionally, you are immune to being {@condition frightened} and have advantage on saving throws against any effect that would discourage you from fighting. You have advantage on any Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check made to encourage a creature.

entries.name: Aura of Encouragement
entries: Whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, the creature adds a +2 bonus to the roll. Additionally, creatures in this range cannot be {@condition frightened} while you are conscious. You can spend 1 devil fruit charge to extend this radius up to 30 feet for 1 minute.

entries.name: Spells (Encourage Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Heroism} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Aid} (2 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Beacon of Hope} (3 charges), {@spell Motivational Speech|AI} (3 charges), {@spell Aura of Life} (4 charges), {@spell Mass Cure Wounds} (5 charges), or {@spell Circle of Power} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Unyielding Aura)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Holy Aura}, without expending a spell slot or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A pale lavender fruit, shaped like an intricate brain, with coiling patterns reminiscent of neurons and synaptic connections.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit grants the user the power to manipulate, alter, and even erase the memories of those they touch. It can also allow the user to implant false memories or even transfer memories from one individual to another.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Memory Thread
entries: As an action, you can touch a willing creature or unwilling creature and force it to make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failure or if the creature allows you, you can pull out film strips from the creature's head to view their memories for 1 minute. While the film strip is pulled out of the creature's head, it is {@condition incapacitated} for the duration. Each time the creature takes damage in this state, it can make an additional Wisdom saving throw at advantage to break free. You can edit the creature's memory film in the following ways while it is removed:

entries.name: Memory Alteration:
entries: As an action, while touching the creature, you can modify or erase parts of its memories. This alteration is permanent unless reversed by you or a spell like Greater Restoration.

entries.name: Memory Implantation:
entries: As an action, while touching the creature, you can implant a false memory into it. It will remember the false memory as if it really happened.

entries.name: Spells (Memory Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Bad Memory Threads ({@spell Bane}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Memory Flood ({@spell Hold Person}; 2 charges), {@spell Detect Thoughts} (2 charges), {@spell Zone of Truth} (2 charges), Memory Mail ({@spell Sending}; 3 charges), {@spell Dream} (4 charges), {@spell Modify Memory} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Destructive Memory Blast)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to flood enemies in the area with bad memories by casting Psychic Scream, without expending a spell slot or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A pink, heart-shaped fruit adorned with a multitude of arrow-like patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: This fruit grants the user the power to turn anyone who feels lust or attraction towards them into stone.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: As an action, you can meet the gaze of a creature within 30 feet. If that creature has ever felt any form of attraction or lust toward you, it must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature is affected by the {@spell Flesh to Stone} spell, and has one failure. If the creature avoids looking into your eyes (such as by averting their gaze or closing their eyes), they have advantage on the saving throw. Once a creature saves, it is immune to the effects of your Petrifying Gaze for 24 hours. Creatures that are incapable of feeling attraction or lust, such as by being immune to the {@condition charmed} condition, are also immune to this effect. You can end this petrification on a creature at will.

entries.name: Love Beam
entries: As an action, you can spend 3 devil fruit charges to shoot a 30-foot cone of magical attraction from your hands. Each creature in this cone must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they are {@condition charmed} with feelings of attraction and lust for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} in this way, they will move toward you and assist you during their turn and you can use a bonus action to use your petrifying gaze on one of the {@condition charmed} creatures, even if they hadn't felt attraction toward you before. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to you or takes damage, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the effect ends for that creature. Once a creature saves, it is immune to the effects of your Love Beam for 24 hours.

entries.name: Spells (Love Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Charm Person} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Enthrall} (2 charges), {@spell Hold Person} (2 charges), {@spell Compulsion} (4 charges), {@spell Dominate Person} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Love Arrow Storm)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to blast everyone within 60 feet of you with a barrage of love arrows. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition charmed} by you. It must then make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns while {@condition charmed} this way. If it successfully saves three times, the effect ends. If it fails its save three times, it permanently turns to stone and is subjected to the {@condition petrified} condition. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind. You can't use this feature again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. The Mira Mira no Mi looks like a shiny, silver apple, its surface perfectly reflective. The texture is smooth and cold to the touch, much like glass.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Mira Mira no Mi gifts its user the power to create and manipulate mirrors, as well as to use reflective surfaces as portals. The user becomes a "Mirror Human."

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Mirror Surface
entries: With a touch, you can transform any surface, no larger than a 10-foot square, into a mirror for up to 1 hour.

entries.name: Mirror Portal
entries: As an action, you can turn a mirror you touch into a portal to the mirror dimension until the start of your next turn. Any creature which enters the mirror is brought into the mirror dimension, similar to the {@spell Demiplane} spell. The mirror dimension connects all nearby mirrors, allowing you to exit out of a mirror connected to the dimension. You can speak to the mirrors in this dimension, as they are sentient, asking them questions they would understand and know. These can be questions about creatures the mirror has seen, where a specific mirror leads to, or where specific mirrors are located in the dimension.
The DM determines the size, shape, and terrain within the mirror dimension. A creature cannot enter or leave the mirror dimension unless a mirror portal is specifically activated by you.

entries.name: Reflective Defense
entries: When hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction and spend 5 devil fruit charges to create a mirror shield, causing the damage to become 0. The attacker must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the attacker takes half of the damage they would have dealt to you, as the attack is redirected back to them.

entries.name: Spells (Reflective Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Disguise Self} (1 charge), {@spell Silent Image} (1 charge), {@spell Mirror Image} (2 charges), {@spell Phantasmal Force} (2 charges), {@spell Major Image} (3 charges), {@spell Hallucinatory Terrain} (4 charges), {@spell Phantasmal Killer} (4 charges), {@spell Mislead} (5 charges), {@spell Seeming} (5 charges), and {@spell Scrying} (using a mirror as a focus; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Mirror Prison)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast the {@spell Maze} spell, no spells slots or material components required. The target is sucked into the mirror dimension and trapped there temporarily. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. An emerald green fruit resembling an hourglass, with swirling patterns on its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit bestows upon its user the unique ability to turn back the hands of time, reversing the age of creatures or even inanimate objects by 12 years.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Age Reversal (Creatures)
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to toss an orb of energy at a creature or Huge or smaller object within 30 feet of you, reducing its age by 12 years. If the target is unwilling to have its age reversed, it can make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a success, its age remains the same. This change affects the physical age only, not the creature's memories, mental maturity, or experiences. If a creature is reduced down from an adult to a child, it will have disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until its age is reverted by a {@spell Greater Restoration} spell or a similar effect, or if you choose to end the effect. Every creature and object that has been affected by this ability will be also be returned to its original age if you are knocked {@condition unconscious}, thus ending this effect on them. If a creature is reduced down to below 0 years in age, it is erased from exiistence.

entries.name: Object Restoration
entries: As an action, you can touch an inanimate object that is no larger than Huge and reverse its age, potentially repairing wear and tear or damage it has sustained over the years. This can be used to restore a broken item, undo the effects of time on a painting, or return a rusted weapon to its prime state. The object remains in its restored state permanently unless physically damaged again. An object that may have existed in a previous state of matter, such as volcanic rock, may be returned to its previous state (which would be lava) with this ability.

entries.name: Spells (Precise Reversal)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Wound Reversal ({@spell Cure Wounds}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Lesser Restoration} (2 charges), Reverse Death ({@spell Revivify}; 3 charges), {@spell Fabricate} (4 charges), Greater Reverse Death ({@spell Raise Dead}; 5 charges), {@spell Passwall} (5 charges), or {@spell Greater Restoration} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Maximum Reversal)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Time Ravage|EGW}, no spells slots or material components required. However, you instead reverse a creature's age to 30 days after it is born on a failed save, and its size becomes tiny. If the targeted creature is exactly 12 years old or less, it is instantly erased from existence on a failed save. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A deep-red fruit resembling a chili pepper with small flame-like patterns scattered over its skin.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit grants its user the ability to generate intense heat from their body, allowing them to raise the temperature of objects they touch or emit scorching waves of heat around them.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Burning Touch
entries: You learn the {@spell Shocking Grasp} cantrip, but deal fire damage with it instead of lightning. Additionally, you are immune to fire damage.

entries.name: Heat Emission
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to emit a wave of heat in a 15-foot radius around you. Creatures in this area must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, creatures take {@damage 3d6} fire damage, and half as much on a success. The heat ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entries.name: Heat Armor
entries: As a bonus action, for up to 1 hour or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, you can raise the temperature of your body to such an extent that any creature making a melee attack against you and hits within 5 feet takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. A creature which touches you or starts its turn in contact with you also takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage. You can end this effect early as a bonus action.

entries.name: Spells (Heat Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Searing Smite} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Heat Metal} (2 charges), {@spell Flame Blade} (2 charges), {@spell Fire Shield} (warm {@spell shield} only; 4 charges), {@spell Immolation|XGE} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Inferno Emanation)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Fire Storm}, without expending a spell slot or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A pale blue fruit with white swirl patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit empowers its user to generate intense cold, allowing them to lower the temperature of objects they touch, emit chilling waves of cold around them, and even freeze liquids on contact.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Chilling Touch
entries: You learn the {@spell Frostbite|XGE} cantrip. Additionally, you are immune to cold damage.

entries.name: Cold Emission
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to emit a wave of biting frost in a 15-foot radius around you. Creatures in this area must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, creatures take {@damage 3d6} cold damage, and half as much on a success. The cold freezes any liquid in the area.

entries.name: Frostbite Armor
entries: As a bonus action, for up to 1 hour or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, you can lower the temperature of your body to such an extent that any creature making a melee attack against you and hits within 5 feet takes {@damage 1d6} cold damage. A creature which touches you or starts its turn in contact with you also takes {@damage 1d6} cold damage. You can end this effect early as a bonus action.

entries.name: Spells (Cold Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Frost Fingers|IDRotF} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Rime's Binding Ice|FTD} (2 charges), {@spell Sleet Storm} (3 charges), {@spell Ice Storm} (4 charges), {@spell Fire Shield} (chill {@spell shield} only; 4 charges), {@spell Cone of Cold} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Blizzard Emanation)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast Freezing Sphere at the 7th level, without expending a spell slot or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A golden, translucent fruit with a slightly reflective surface, resembling a shimmering crystal orb.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit grants its user the unique power to emit "Noro Noro" beams, which can slow down any object or creature they touch, making them experience time at a drastically reduced speed.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Slow Immunity
entries: You cannot be slowed by any means, such as by the {@spell Slow} spell or by a Stone Golem.

entries.name: Slowing Shot
entries: As an action, you can target a creature, or a Large or smaller object, within 30 feet with a miniature slowing beam. A creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature is slowed, as if affected by the {@spell Slow} spell for 1 minute. A creature affected by this ability makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end each of its turns. On a successful save, the effect ends for it. An object targeted by this ability remains nearly frozen in place for the duration, only moving 5 feet per turn if it was in motion.

entries.name: Slowing Beam
entries: As an action, you can spend 3 devil fruit charges to shoot a 30-foot cone of slowing energy from your hands. Each creature in this cone must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, they are affected by the {@spell Slow} spell for 30 seconds. A creature affected by this ability makes another Wisdom saving throw at the end each of its turns. On a successful save, the effect ends for it. Any objects in this cone remain nearly frozen in place for the duration, only moving 5 feet per turn if it was in motion. You do not need to concentrate to keep a creature slowed in this way.

entries.name: Spells (Slow Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges.
