You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Hold Person} (2 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Slow} (3 charges), {@spell Temporal Shunt|EGW} (5 charges), or {@spell Hold Monster} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Temporal Lockdown)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Time Stop}, without expending a spell slot or material components, as the world around you slows to a halt. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Producer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A silvery fruit, resembling a chain wrapped in a tight ball with small links and padlock motifs imprinted on its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit bestows upon its user the ability to generate and manipulate iron shackles and cages. With a mere gesture or touch, the user can bind or imprison their foes, making escape incredibly difficult.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Chain Whip
entries: You learn the {@spell thorn whip} cantrip, no material components required. It deals bludgeoning damage instead of piercing, and appears as steel chains.

entries.name: Shackling Touch
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature within 5 feet. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature is bound by iron shackles, becoming {@condition restrained} until it can break free. A creature can use its action to make a Strength check against your Devil Fruit save DC, breaking free on a success.

entries.name: Cage Conjuring
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to conjure a cage around one creature you can see within 30 feet. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature is trapped inside the cage, which has an AC of 20 and 30 hit points. The bars are spaced far too narrowly for creatures or weapons to fit through, giving it full cover. The cage lasts for up to 1 minute, after which it disappears.

entries.name: Spells (Cage Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Entangle} (1 charge), {@spell Hold Person} (2 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Web} (reskinned as chains instead of webs; not flammable; 2 charges), Dimension Cage ({@spell Banishment}; 4 charges), {@spell Wall of Force} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Prison Realm)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to manifest a large prison complex in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see within 60 feet. Within this area, iron walls and cages transforming the terrain into a labyrinthine jail. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, they are trapped within individual cages, becoming {@condition restrained}. A creature can break free by making a Strength check against your Devil Fruit save DC. If a creature is freed, it must also spend an action to make a DC 20 Intelligence check to find the exit within the labyrinth prison, at which point it appears 5 feet outside of the prison complex in an area it chooses. The prison lasts for 10 minutes or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, after which it disappears. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A dark brown, almost earthen-colored fruit with undulating ridges on its surface, reminiscent of clay.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit bestows its user with the unprecedented ability to alter and mold the very ground beneath their feet. They can push, pull, or shape terrain as if it were soft clay, creating structures or modifying the landscape to their whims.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Enhanced Pushing
entries: When you use an action to {@action shove} a creature, you gain advantage on your Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. If you choose to push a creature away, you can choose to push it up to 15 feet away from you instead.

entries.name: Tunnel Pushing
entries: You gain a burrowing speed of 30 feet. You can burrow through solid rock at half your burrow speed and leave a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in your wake. As an action, you can reshape a 10-foot cube of earth or stone you can touch within 5 feet. You can form it into any shape that suits your purpose: creating ramps, walls, pits, or any other structure. The reshaped terrain has the durability of its original material.

entries.name: Ground Wave
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to create a wave-like ripple on the ground in a 15-foot wide line that's 60 feet long. Each creature standing on the ground in that area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. If the ground in that area is loose earth or stone, it becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3} until cleared.

entries.name: Spells (Pushing Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Earth Tremor|XGE} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Maximillian's Earthen Grasp (2 charges), {@spell Erupting Earth|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell Wall of Stone} (5 charges), {@spell Passwall} (5 charges), or {@spell Transmute Rock|XGE} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Infinite Tunnel)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to exert total control over the ground to form a 10-foot magical tunnel in the earth leading to one location you're aware of. After you create the tunnel, any creature that jumps into it teleports to a location of your choosing, as if using the {@spell Teleport} spell (there can only be one target destination). The destination must be known to you, it must be connected to the earth, and it must be on the same plane of existence. The tunnel lasts for 1 minute, then collapses and disappears. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A vibrant orange fruit, resembling a bell with multiple musical note motifs across its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit grants the user the capability to manifest musical instruments from their body. Using these instruments, they can produce sound waves that can have a range of effects, from disorienting enemies to causing physical harm.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Sound Immunity
entries: You are immune to thunder damage and the {@condition deafened} condition.

entries.name: Instrumental Manifestation
entries: As a bonus action, you can generate any musical instrument from your body, from flutes to drums to guitars. When you produce an instrument, you are proficient with it and can immediately play it. You must use this as the focus for your Devil Fruit spells and abilities.

entries.name: Dissonant Blast
entries: You learn the {@spell thunderclap|XGE} cantrip. Additionally, as an action while holding an instrument you've manifested, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to play a harsh note that emits a blast of disruptive sound. Each creature in a 30-foot cone originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC, taking {@damage 3d8} thunder damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that is immune to the {@condition deafened} condition is not affected by this ability.

entries.name: Spells (Sound Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Thunderwave} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Shatter} (2 charges), {@spell Hypnotic Pattern} (reskinned as a captivating melody; 3 charges), {@spell Destructive Wave} (thunder damage only; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Orchestra of Doom)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to manifest an orchestra of instruments around you. For the next minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, these instruments play a haunting and overpowering symphony. Each creature of your choice within a 60-foot radius of you must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC at the start of each of their turns or take {@damage 7d8} thunder damage, half as much on a success. A creature that is immune to the {@condition deafened} condition cannot be affected by this ability. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A maroon fruit with a rough texture, resembling corroded metal with flaky patches and rust-like patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit gives its user the uncanny ability to induce rapid rusting and decay in metals. With just a touch or gesture, the user can make the sturdiest of metals brittle and fragile.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Rust Body
entries: Any weapon made of metal that hits you corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Ammunition made of metal that hits you is destroyed after dealing damage.

entries.name: Corroding Touch
entries: You corrode a ferrous metal object you can see within 5 feet of you. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the touch destroys a 1-foot cube of it. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC to avoid your corroding touch.

If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, its takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held metal weapon, it rusts as described in your Rust Body feature.

entries.name: Spells (Rusting Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Rust Blast ({@spell Tasha's Caustic Brew|TCE}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Rust Arrow ({@spell Melf's Acid Arrow}; 2 charges), Rusting Sphere ({@spell Vitriolic Sphere|XGE}; 4 charges), {@spell Transmute Rock|XGE} to Mud (but only for unworn and unheld metal to rust; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Kingdom of Decay)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to release an aura of intense corrosion in a 30-foot radius centered on yourself. This aura turns the ground into a rust-colored, metal-corroding field. Every unworn and unheld metallic object or creature that starts its turn or enters the area for the first time must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. Constructs made of metal have disadvantage on this saving throw. Unworn and unheld objects corrode instantly, and creatures take {@damage 5d10} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature's held or worn metallic objects take a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty, as described in your Rust Body and Corroding Touch features, if it fails the save. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A silver fruit with hard, angular facets similar to castle turrets, crowned by a flag-like stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: The user of this devil fruit transforms into a living fortress, capable of enclosing allies for protection or to strategize, and possesses the ability to generate castle-like structures and weapons.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Fortress Body
entries: As an action, you can absorb any willing creature or large or smaller object within 5 feet of you into your body. A creature or object absorbed into you becomes tiny while within you and treats your body interior as if it were Mordenkainen's Magnificent Mansion. It gains full cover from within your body and half cover while looking outside the orifices on your body, which are treated as battlements. A ranged weapon used within your body targeting a creature outside it is treated as a regular ranged weapon attack, regardless of the user's size.

entries.name: Interior Manipulation
entries: While in your fortress form, you can reshape the rooms, hallways, mundane objects, furniture, and other structures inside you at will. You can create traps, barriers, or beneficial features like healing rooms, which can heal allies for {@dice 2d6 + 4} hit points once per short rest. You can spend an action to eject a creature from your Fortress Body into an empty space within 10 feet of you.

entries.name: Castle Cannons
entries: Once per turn, while at least one creature is within your fortress body, you can use 1 devil fruit charge as an action to activate castle-mounted cannons that fire at a target you can see within 60 feet. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or take {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Spells (Castle Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Castle Tank ({@spell Longstrider}; Self; 1 charge), {@spell Stoneskin} (Self; 4 charges), {@spell Conjure Volley} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Majestic Bastion)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to enter an enhanced Fortress Body Form to instead become a colossal fortress, as if using the {@spell Mighty Fortress|XGE} spell. You can absorb any allied creature, weapons, or huge or smaller objects within 30 feet into you when you first enter this form. You cannot attack or cast spells while in this form, you can only walk, and your walking speed becomes 40 ft. This form has resistance to all damage except force, and all damage dealt to its walls is also dealt to you. This effect lasts for 10 minutes or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A clear, almost translucent fruit with subtle shimmering patterns that play across its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit bestows its user the power to become {@condition invisible} at will. Not only can the user render themselves unseen, but also anything they touch, allowing them to move stealthily or execute surprise attacks.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Vanish from Sight
entries: As an action, you can become {@condition invisible}. This effect remains as long as you concentrate (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell) up to an hour. Anything you are wearing or carrying becomes {@condition invisible} with you. Attacking or casting a spell ends the invisibility.

entries.name: Cloak Others
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to touch another creature or object to render it {@condition invisible} for up to 10 minutes. The invisibility ends early if the targeted creature attacks or casts a spell. You can use this ability on one creature or object at a time, using another action to end the effect early.

entries.name: Spells (Invisibility Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell See Invisibility} (2 charges), {@spell Nondetection} (3 charges), {@spell Greater Invisibility} (4 charges), {@spell Mislead} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Realm of Unseen)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a 30-foot radius sphere of invisibility centered on yourself. Anything inside this sphere, including other creatures, becomes {@condition invisible}. The sphere moves with you and lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. Only you and creatures you choose inside the sphere can see other {@condition invisible} creatures in the sphere but unselected creatures cannot. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A steely blue-gray fruit, its surface covered in overlapping, blade-like scales, with a stem that looks like a twisted, sharpened spike.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit empowers its user with the ability to transform any part of their body into sharp blades. The blades are incredibly tough, sharp enough to cut through most materials with ease.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Blade Body
entries: As a bonus action, you can transform any part of your body into a melee weapon which deals slashing damage. This can range from turning an arm into a longsword, fingers into dagger-like blades, or even combining your arms or legs into a greatsword. Weapons you create have the same properties as their normal counterparts but are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance. You can use this part of your body as a weapon attack, and you are proficient with it. You can only use one weapon active this way at a time, and can dismiss it using a bonus action.

entries.name: Steel Skin
entries: Your AC can't be less than 18, regardless of what kind of armor you are wearing. By spending 1 devil fruit charge as a bonus action, you can gain a +2 bonus to your AC for up to 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious} (this effect doesn't stack).

entries.name: Cyclone of Slices
entries: You can create a number of blades from your body and spin to attack with them. You learn the {@spell sword burst|TCE} cantrip.

entries.name: Spells (Bladed Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Thunderous Smite} (1 charge), {@spell Cloud of Daggers} (2 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Staggering Smite} (4 charges), {@spell Stoneskin} (Self; 4 charges), {@spell Steel Wind Strike|XGE} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Blade Tempest)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Blade Barrier}, without expending a spell slot or material components. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A fruit with a golden-hued exterior, looking almost like a radiant, miniature sun with its surface glowing soft light.

entries.name: Description
entries: The bearer of this devil fruit acquires the astonishing capability to send themselves or others forward in time. They cannot, however, rewind time or bring anyone back from the future.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Time Leap
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge and touch a willing creature, sending it forward in time. The target disappears, effectively entering a state of suspended animation, and reappears in the same location up to 20 years into the future in the nearest empty space. If the specified time is not given, the default is 1 day. You can also use this power on yourself.

entries.name: Future's Guidance
entries: As an action, once per 24 hours, you mentally receive an omen for what is to come. This functions similarly to the spell Commune, but comes from a future version of yourself or another creature you temporarily communicate with.

entries.name: Spells (Temporal Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Foreshadow ({@spell Gift of Alacrity|EGW}; 1 charge), Future Knowledge ({@spell Borrowed Knowledge|SCC}; 2 charges), Time Shift ({@spell Blink}; 3 charges), Quicken Time ({@spell Haste}; 3 charges), {@spell Temporal Shunt|EGW} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Time's Nexus)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a zone where time is in flux within a 30-foot radius centered on yourself. For the next minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, any creature that starts its turn within the zone or enters it for the first time must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failure, the creature is sent 1 round into the future and temporarily disappearing, effectively losing its next turn. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A golden-yellow, grainy-textured pear, tied with a green leafy bow.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit empowers its user to create, control, and transform into straw at will. The straw crafted by this power isn't ordinary; it has the unique capability to redirect damage dealt to it, turning the tide of battle in unexpected ways.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Straw Doll
entries: As an action, you can create a small straw voodoo doll of a willing creature you touch. If a creature is unwilling, it must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save or if the target is willing, you produce a tiny doll version of that creature which is linked to it, and then absorb it into your body. While you hold at least one doll in your body, any damage you are dealt can instead be redirected to a creature linked to the corresponding doll you contain. If a creature with a linked doll you contain drops to 0 hit points, its corresponding doll is destroyed. Alternatively, you can use a bonus action to expel a doll linked to a creature and negate the effect of this ability on that creature. You can hold up to 10 straw voodoo dolls this way.

entries.name: Straw Monster
entries: As an action, you can spend 4 or more devil fruit charges to use the {@spell Summon Construct|TCE} spell (Clay), which summons a straw monster that fights for you. You can spend additional devil fruit charges to cast it at higher levels (1 charge per total spell level).

entries.name: Spells (Straw Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Entangle} (1 charge), {@spell Spike Growth} (2 charges), Straw Form (Guardian of {@skill Nature}, great tree form only; 4 charges), Compulsion (only targets creatures with straw dolls and save made at disadvantage; 4 charges), Dominate Person (only a target with a straw doll and save made at disadvantage; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Straw Invulnerability)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to enter an invulnerable straw form for 1 minute. You must concentrate to maintain this form as if it were a spell. During this awakening, you appear as a god-like straw being and you redirect all the damage you take, except force damage, onto the environment around you. When you are hit by an attack or damaging effect in this form, a nomagical object of your choice that isn't being held or worn within 60 feet of you takes the damage instead of you. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enahncer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. An orange citrus fruit vaguely resembling the shape of a skull.

entries.name: Description
entries: This incredible devil fruit grants the user a second chance at life after death, imbuing them with spectral powers sourced from the underworld.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Rebirth
entries: Upon dying, your soul does not pass on. Instead, after 1 minute, your soul returns to you and you resurrect at the spot of your physical body's death with half of your maximum hit points. This resurrection purges any poisons, diseases, or other conditions afflicting you. This does not work if your physical body is completely destroyed.

entries.name: Spectral Form
entries: As a bonus action, you can assume a ghostly, intangible form for up to 10 minutes. While in this form, you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, though ending your movement inside an object deals {@damage 1d10} force damage to you. Attacks against you have disadvantage, and you have immunity to non-magical damage. Your physical body is temporarily separated from you while you are in this form, and is left {@condition incapacitated} in the spot where you first used this ability until you return to it instantly by spending a bonus action or waiting until the end of the duration. Your spectral form and physical body share hit points.

In your spectral form, you can't fall and remain hovering in the air even when {@condition stunned} or otherwise {@condition incapacitated}. You can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects you were carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. You also can't attack or cast spells.

entries.name: Gift of the Underworld
entries: You learn the {@spell chill touch} cantrip, and your melee weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d8} cold damage. Additionally, you can spend an action to re-attach any limbs you are missing.

entries.name: Spells (Underworld Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Ice Slash ({@spell Ice Knife|XGE}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Hunger of Hadar} (3 charges), {@spell Fear} (3 charges), Underworld Barrage ({@spell Ice Storm}; 4 charges), Soul Parade ({@spell Cone of Cold}; 5 charges), {@spell Greater Restoration} (Self; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Underworld Release)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to channel the amazing power of the underworld around you for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. So long as you are conscious, at the start of each of your turns for the duration, all dead creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you are resurrected, as if brought back by the {@spell Revivify} spell. Once you activate this awakening, you can't do so again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A bright yellow fruit with a jagged, crackling pattern across its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Bestowing the might of the electric element, this devil fruit grants the user the ability to generate, control, and emit electricity. The holder can electrify their surroundings and channel raw energy.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Static Body
entries: You learn the {@spell Shocking Grasp} cantrip. Additionally, you are immune to lightning damage.

entries.name: Electrical Discharge
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to emit a wave of electricity in a 15-foot radius around you. Creatures in this area must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, creatures take {@damage 3d6} lightning damage, and half as much on a success. The lightning enables or disables (your choice) any electrical device in the area until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Static Field
entries: As a bonus action, for up to 1 hour or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, you can raise the electrical current through your body to such an extent that any creature making a melee attack against you and hits within 5 feet takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage. A creature which touches you or starts its turn in contact with you also takes {@damage 1d6} lightning damage. You can end this effect early as a bonus action.

entries.name: Spells (Electric Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Witch Bolt} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Lightning Bolt} (3 charges), {@spell Storm Sphere|XGE} (4 charges), Shocking Current ({@spell Immolation|XGE}; deals lightning damage instead of fire; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Static Blast)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Chain Lightning} at the 7th level, without expending a spell slot or material components. Additionally, any electrical devices within 150 feet of you are enabled or disabled (your choice) for 1 minute. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environemnt Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A jelly-like, translucent fruit with an iridescent sheen, mimicking the look of a wobbling gelatin. It's slightly squishy to the touch and has a spiral, coiling stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: This quirky devil fruit grants the user the ability to induce wobbling vibrations in both living beings and inanimate objects, causing unpredictable disruptions and alterations in their structure and function.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Bounce Back
entries: When hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction and spend 5 devil fruit charges to wobble your form, causing the damage to become 0. The attacker must make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the attacker takes half of the damage they would have dealt to you, as the force is bounced back to them.

entries.name: Wobble Infusion
entries: As an action, you can touch an object or creature, making it wobble uncontrollably for up to 1 minute. Non-living objects have their functions disrupted (e.g., a locked door might wobble open, a sword might wobble making it harder to wield). Creatures affected must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC at the start of each of their turns. On a failed save, they are considered to have disadvantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until the start of their next turn due to the wobbling. Once a creature saves, it is no longer affected by this ability.

entries.name: Wobble Wave
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge emit a wave of wobbling energy in a 15-foot cone. All objects and creatures within the area are affected as if by the Wobble Infusion. Creatures in the area must also make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Spells (Wobble Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Earth Tremor|XGE} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Erupting Earth|XGE} (3 cahrges), {@spell Confusion} (3 charges), {@spell Gravity Sinkhole|EGW} (4 charges), Wrath of {@skill Nature} (caused by precisely wobbling the earth; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Reality Tremor)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can, as an action, induce a fundamental wobble in the very fabric of reality within a 60-foot radius centered on you. For 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, the ground, air, and everything within the area starts to wobble and shift. Every creature except you within the area have disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. Additionally, any spells cast within or into the area have a 25% chance to fail, as the wobbling reality distorts their effects. Once you activate this awakening, you can't do so again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A pale, folded fruit with an ornate polygonal shape. The fruit's stem appears twisted, like a thin strip of folded paper.

entries.name: Description
entries: This unique devil fruit grants the user the artistry of origami on a grand and magical scale, allowing them to fold and manipulate objects and creatures as if they were paper, as well as turn their own body into a paper-like form.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Paper Folding
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failure, it is folded in half like paper causing it to become {@condition incapacitated} for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Origami Forms
entries: As an action, you can touch an allied creature or yourself and transform the target into an origami form for 1 minute, or until you or the creature transform back using a bonus action. You can choose one of the following origami forms which gives its own benefits (doesn't stack):

entries.name: Paper Plane:
entries: When you fall at least 10 feet above the ground, you can use your reaction to extend your paper wings to glide horizontally a number of feet equal to your walking speed, and you take 0 damage from the fall. You determine the direction of the glide.

entries.name: Paper Boat:
entries: You can float and walk on water at a speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Paper Frog:
entries: Your long jump is up to 20 feet and your high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Paper Elephant:
entries: You gain a 10 temporary hit points.

entries.name: Paper Fox:
entries: You gain a +10 feet bonus to your walking speed.

entries.name: Spells (Origami Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Find Familiar} (Origami-Themed Familiar; 1 charge), Paper Fall ({@spell Feather Fall}; 1 charge), Paper Wings ({@spell Fly}; Self; 3 charges), {@spell Fabricate} (folding objects into new shapes; 4 charges), Origami Hand (as {@spell Bigby's Hand} but made of origami paper; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Origami Vortex)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Whirlwind|XGE}, without expending a spell slot or material components, as origami birds emerge and create a vortex of wind. Additionally, you and allied creatures within 300 feet of you grow paper wings and gain 60 feet of flying speed for the duration of Whirlwind (and do not take fall damage if they fall immediately after this ability is used). You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. This fruit is a white apple with playing card suits decorating its surface, and its stem mimics the appearance of a joker card.

entries.name: Description
entries: This enigmatic devil fruit bestows the power of playing cards upon its user. The wielder can manifest and manipulate playing cards with varying effects and even adopt traits from the cards themselves.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Card Manifestation
entries: As an action, you can produce up to 52 playing cards from your hands. These cards are razor-sharp and can be thrown as ranged weapons with a range of 30/90 feet, dealing {@damage 1d6} slashing damage on a hit. You cannot use this action again to produce playing cards until the next dawn. You can only have up to 52 playing cards at a time.

entries.name: Card Suit Abilities
entries: You can infuse your actions with the power of one of the card suits. As a bonus action, you burn a number of cards based on the suit to adopt one of the following stances, which lasts until the start of your next turn:

entries.name: Hearts (12 cards):
entries: When you or an ally within 30 feet are targeted by an attack, you can use your reaction to attempt to block the attack being made against the target with cards. The attack is instead made at disadvantage. You must declare this reaction before the result of the attack roll is given.

entries.name: Diamonds (9 cards):
entries: Any card-based attacks you make deal an additional {@damage 2d8} radiant damage as they gleam with a dazzling shine.

entries.name: Clubs (4 cards):
entries: You can use your cards as a melee weapon, dealing {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage on a hit.

entries.name: Spades (1 card):
entries: You can dig or tunnel through the ground up to 10 feet during you turn with your card, as it slices through solid materials like a shovel through dirt.

entries.name: Spells (Card Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Numbered Cards ({@spell Magic Missile}; 1 charge; can be casted at higher levels by spending additional charges), Face Cards ({@spell Crown of Madness}; 2 charges), Ace ({@spell Fireball}; 3 charges), or Joker ({@spell Mislead}; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Final Draw)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to regain all expended playing cards which are reshuffled into your hand and cast {@spell Crown of Stars|XGE} (with glowing cards instead of motes of light). Once you activate this awakening, you can't do so again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. This fruit resembles a gleaming, oversized pearl with shimmering hues of blue and silver. Its surface pulses with a soft light, and has a swirling, thick stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Moa Moa No Mi grants its user the incredible ability to amplify the inherent qualities of any object or creature they touch, making them larger, faster, and more potent.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Qualitative Touch
entries: You learn the {@spell Magic Stone|XGE} cantrip. As an action, you can touch an object or creature. Depending on your intent, you can magnify one of the following qualities:

entries.name: Size:
entries: You can increase the size of the touched object or creature by one category (up to gargantuan). If a creature is enlarged in this manner, it gains the benefits of the {@spell Enlarge/Reduce} spell (only enlarge). This increase lasts for 1 minute.

entries.name: Speed:
entries: You double the movement speed of the touched object or creature for 1 round.

Strength: You amplify the strength of the touched object or creature. If an object is enhanced, its damage threshold increases by 20. If a creature is enhanced in this manner, it gains advantage on Strength checks, Strength Saves, and Strength-based attack rolls. This boost lasts for 1 round.

entries.name: Empowerment Pulse
entries: As an action, you can expend 1 devil fruit charge to release a wave of energy in a 30-foot radius. All allies within this radius have one of the qualities (Size, Speed, or Strength) enhanced, as per your Qualitative Touch, until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Spells (Amplification Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Catapult|XGE} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Jump} (1 charge), {@spell Enhance Ability} (2 charges), {@spell Conjure Barrage} (3 charges), {@spell Haste} (3 charges), {@spell Freedom of Movement} (4 charges), {@spell Conjure Volley} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Qualitative Realm)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, as an action you can envelop a 30-foot radius around you in a shimmering dome for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. Within this realm, the very air seems charged with energy. All objects and allies inside gain all the benefits of your Qualitative Touch simultaneously, while enemies find one of their qualities diminished if they fail a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC when the dome is created (Size is reduced by one category, Speed is halved, or Strength-based attacks deal {@damage 1d4} less damage) for the duration. A creature which has its equalities diminished can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. Once you activate this awakening, you can't do so again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia

Fruit appearance. The Buki Buki no Mi looks akin to a steel-gray pomegranate with sharp, angular facets. Its sheen reflects light as if made of polished metal, and the stem is shaped like the handle of a small dagger.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Buki Buki No Mi allows its user to transform parts of their body, or even their entire form, into various weapons. This unique power renders the user a veritable one-person armory, aptly termed a Full-Body Weapon Human.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Weapon Morphing
entries: As a bonus action, you can transform a part of your body into any weapon (e.g., swords, shields, bows, firearms, etc.), it's considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance. You can use this part of your body as a weapon attack, and you are proficient with it. You can only use one weapon active this way at a time, and can dismiss it using a bonus action.

entries.name: Full-Body Arsenal
entries: As an action, you can morph your entire body into a larger weapon or siege equipment (like a ballista or catapult). While in this form, you cannot move or take other actions, but allies can use the weaponized form to attack. This transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Impenetrable Defense
entries: Your AC can't be less than 18, regardless of what kind of armor you are wearing. By spending 1 devil fruit charge as a bonus action, you can gain a +2 bonus to your AC for up to 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious} (this effect doesn't stack).

entries.name: Spells (Weapon Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Thunderous Smite} (1 charge), {@spell Cloud of Daggers} (2 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Conjure Barrage} (3 charges), {@spell Staggering Smite} (4 charges), {@spell Stoneskin} (Self; 4 charges), {@spell Conjure Volley} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Living Armory)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, as an action, you create a whirlwind of shifting weaponry around you for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. Blades, firearms, and other armaments constantly morph and reshape across your body. For the next minute, whenever a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of you or moves into that area for the first time on a turn it must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failure, it takes {@dice 6d10} bludgeoning, piercing or, slashing damage from the weapons, or half as much on a success. After using this feature, you cannot use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. The Senko Senko no Mi is a radiant, lemon-yellow fruit that appears to softly glow from within, even in complete darkness.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Senko Senko No Mi grants the user the ability to harness and control light, allowing them to create blinding flashes, become a being of pure light, or even manipulate the perceptions of others through illusions.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Light Being
entries: You are immune to radiant damage and the {@condition blinded} condition.

Additionally, you emit {@quickref Vision and Light||2||bright light} in a 15-foot radius and {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} for an additional 15 feet. You can turn this light on or off as a bonus action. You can use an action to expand or reduce the radius of bright and {@quickref Vision and Light||2||dim light} by 5 feet each, to a maximum of 30 feet each or a minimum of 10 feet each.

entries.name: Blinding Flash
entries: As an action, you can release a powerful burst of light from your body. All creatures within a 30-foot radius must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Spells (Flash Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Faerie Fire} (1 charge), {@spell Mirror Image} (2 charges), {@spell Daylight} (3 charges), {@spell Blinding Smite} (3 charges), {@spell Sickening Radiance|XGE} (4 charges), {@spell Wall of Light|XGE} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Prismatic Surge)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Sunburst}, without expending a spell slot or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. The Pamu Pamu no Mi is a vivid crimson fruit with a rough, bumpy surface reminiscent of eruptive textures.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Pamu Pamu No Mi grants its user the ability to make any object they touch swell and erupt on command. The eruption's strength can vary, from a simple pop to a massive blast.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.
Explosion Immunity You gain immunity to thunder damage.

entries.name: Touch of Detonation
entries: As an action, you can touch an inanimate object or part of a surface, imbuing no larger than a 5-foot area of it with eruptive energy. As a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can detonate the object if it is within 60-feet of you, causing it to erupt and explode and deal {@damage 3d8} thunder damage to all creatures within a 10-foot radius of the touched spot. The explosion destroys the object if it is medium-size, and destroys a 5-foot cube of the surface if it is nonmagical. Only a number of spots equal to your proficiency bonus can remain imbued by this ability at a time, and it can only remain explosive in this way for 1 hour.

entries.name: Controlled Blast
entries: As a bonus action, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the weapon or ammunition hitting them to briefly swell and erupt, dealing an additional {@damage 2d8} thunder damage to the target. This does not destroy the weapon.

entries.name: Spells (Rupture Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Thunderwave} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Shatter} (2 charges), {@spell Thunder Step|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell Erupting Earth|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell Destructive Wave} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Omnipresent Detonation)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Reality Break|EGW}, without expending a spell slot or material components, as you cause space and time around the target to rupture randomly. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia

Fruit appearance. The Wapu Wapu no Mi is a shimmering violet fruit with spiral patterns cascading from its top to its base. The fruit has a transient feel to it, almost as if it's not entirely there, with subtle pulses of light emanating from within.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Wapu Wapu No Mi gives its user the remarkable ability to teleport themselves and, to a limited extent, other objects or people. With a thought, the user can vanish from one location and reappear in another.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Blinking Step
entries: As a bonus action, you can teleport to any location you can see within 60 feet. You must have a clear line of sight to your destination.

entries.name: Phase Shift
entries: As an action, you can touch an object or a willing creature, making them vanish and reappear at any location you can see within 30 feet. The size of the object or creature cannot exceed a 10-foot cube.

entries.name: Distant Warp
entries: Once per 24 hours, as an action, you can visualize a location you've previously visited and teleport there, regardless of the distance. The location must be on the same plane of existence. You can spend 6 devil fruit charges to bring up to eight willing creatures within 10 feet of you with you.

entries.name: Spells (Teleporting Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Thunder Step|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell Dimension Door} (4 charges), {@spell Teleportation Circle} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Chaotic Warpgate)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, as an action, you can force all creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, a creature is teleported to a random location of the DM's choice that must be at least 100 miles away from you. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia

Fruit appearance. The Fude Fude no Mi is a gradient fruit, transitioning from dark indigo at its top to a pastel pink at its base. It feels like soft bristles to the touch, with swirled patterns reminiscent of flowing ink or paint.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Fude Fude No Mi grants its user the mystical ability to bring their artistic creations to life. By drawing or painting with their hands or tools, the user can create tangible, functioning objects or creatures from their imagination.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Artist's Knowledge
entries: You can spend an action to manifest Painter's supplies into your hands, which you are proficient with. You have advantage on any check made using Painter's Supplies.

entries.name: Artistic Creation
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to paint a creature or an object on a surface, then peel it off to make it manifest for up to 1 hour. You must maintain {@status concentration} on this power to keep it (like {@status concentration} on a spell), or else the creature will return to your book. This can create simple objects no larger than huge or non-hostile, non-magical beasts (like horses, dogs, etc.) with a CR no greater than 1. The created creatures are friendly to you and your companions and follow simple commands.

entries.name: Spells (Artistic Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Ink Cloud ({@spell Fog Cloud}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Find Steed} (2 charges), {@spell Conjure Animals} (3 charges), {@spell Conjure Barrage} (3 charges), {@spell Conjure Woodland Beings} (4 charges), Conjure Minor Elemetnals (4 charges), {@spell Find Greater Steed|XGE} (4 charges), {@spell Conjure Elemental} (5 charges), {@spell Conjure Volley} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Final Masterpiece)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, as an action, you can cast {@spell Animal Shapes}, without expending a spell slot or material components. Instead of targeting creatures, you instead target a number of animal artpieces you've created on a surface within range to transform. After using this feature, you cannot use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. The Ito Ito no Mi is a light gray pear with swirling patterns on its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: This coveted Devil Fruit allows its user to create, manipulate, and control string. The user's mastery over string can be employed for both offensive and defensive purposes, as well as for puppetry, ensnaring, or even flight.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: String Creation
entries: As a bonus action, you can create strings from any part of your body, which last for 1 minute. These strings are incredibly durable and sharp, and extend up to 120 feet from you. You can make a ranged weapon attack with them, dealing {@damage 2d8} slashing damage on a hit. You are proficient with these strings, and you can use Dexterity or Strength for the attack and damage rolls.

Additionally, you can use an action to attempt to trap a creature you can see within 120 feet in your strings. The creature must make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or become {@condition restrained} by string.
A creature {@condition restrained} by the string can use its action to make a Strength check against your Devil Fruit save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer {@condition restrained}.

entries.name: String Puppetry
entries: As an action, you can attempt to control a creautre you have {@condition restrained} with your strings. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be controlled by you until the start of your next turn. While controlled, the creature moves and acts as you dictate on its turn.

entries.name: Bird Cage
entries: As an action, you can spend 6 devil fruit charges to cast {@spell Wall of Force}, no material components required. However, you can only form it into a hemispherical dome with a radius of 10 miles. While you maintain {@status concentration} on this wall, you can use an action to decrease its radius by 1 mile once per minute. The decrease doesn't happen immediately, but rather slowly over the next minute. Nonmagical objects are pushed along with the wall when the radius decreases, or get destroyed if they are fixed in place. The wall does not extend into the material plane.

entries.name: Spells (String Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: String Tentacles ({@spell Arms of Hadar}, but deals bludgeoning damage; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Web} (2 charges), {@spell Hold Person} (2 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), String Puppet ({@spell Crown of Madness}; 2 charges), String Clones ({@spell Mirror Image}; 2 charges), Sky Path ({@spell Fly}; 3 charges), String Parade ({@spell Compulsion}; 4 charges), or {@spell Hold Monster} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (String World)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Blade Barrier}, without expending spell slots or material components, by creating sharp string sheets from objects around you. While the Blade Barrier is active, you can use a bonus action on your turn to move and reshape the blades in any way you choose (up to the range of the spell).

Additionally, as an action, you can sacrifice up to 10 feet of the blade barrier in diameter and length to use God Thread. When you do so, you shoot out a sharp arrow of concentrated string a 100 foot long and 5 foot line originating from you. Any creature in the line must make a Dexterity save against your Devil Fruit save DC. A creature takes {@damage 6d10} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
After using this feature, you cannot use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. The Haipa Haipa No Mi is a pineapple with a shimmering silver-blue hue. It has patterns that resemble trails of gusty winds wrapping around it.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Haipa Haipa No Mi bestows its user with unparalleled speed, reflexes, and the ability to think at an accelerated rate, making them a true "Speed Human".

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.
Unparalleled speed. You gain a +30 feet bonus to your movement speed.

entries.name: Quick Reflexes
entries: You can spend 1 devil fruit charge as a bonus action to take the dodge, disengage, or dash action.

entries.name: Evasion
entries: Your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a blue dragon's lightning breath or a {@spell fireball} spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

entries.name: Spells (Velocity Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Jump} (Self; 1 charge), {@spell Blur} (2 charges), {@spell Misty Step} (2 charges), {@spell Haste} (Self; 3 charges), {@spell Freedom of Movement} (Self; 4 charges), {@spell Steel Wind Strike|XGE} (5 charges), {@spell Swift Quiver} (5 charges), or {@spell Far Step|XGE} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Mass Acceleration)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, as an action, you can create a zone of accelerated time in a 120-foot radius centered on yourself. Inside this zone, all allies' speed is doubled, and they gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws. Any hostile creature's speed is halved, and they have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. After using this feature, you cannot use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. The Raki Raki No Mi is a radiant golden star fruit with glimmering star patterns etched onto its skin.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Raki Raki No Mi grants its user the power to manipulate luck, bringing fortune to themselves or casting misfortune onto others, turning the user into a "Luck Human".

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Luck Control
entries: You learn the {@spell guidance} cantrip. Additionally, as a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 3 devil fruit charges to use a "Luck" die. Roll a {@dice d20} and record the number rolled. For the next hour, you can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with the result of this dice. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn. You can only hold one Luck die at a time.

entries.name: Luck Thief
entries: As an action, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to touch a creature within 5 feet of you. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on one roll of your choice per round while you have advantage one roll of your choice per round, for {@dice 1d4} rounds. The creature can make another Wisdom save at the end of each of its turn to end this effect on itself and you.

entries.name: Spells (Fortune Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Bane} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Bless} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Fortune's Favor|EGW} (2 charges), {@spell Bestow Curse} (3 charges), {@spell Circle of Power} (5 charges), or Deadly Misfortune ({@spell Contagion}; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Wheel of Fortune)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, as an action, you can create a zone of intensified fortune within a 30-foot radius centered on yourself. While inside this zone, you and up to four other allied creatures roll a {@dice d20} at the start of their turn and must record the result. Until the start of its next turn, any creature that makes this roll can use the result in place any any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by itself or another creature it can see inside the zone. It must choose to do so before the roll, and it can replace a roll in this way only once per turn. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. After using this feature, you cannot use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia

Fruit appearance. The Peto Peto no Mi is a deep green fruit, covered in a slimy gel-like substance that has an eerie shine to it. Its appearance is reminiscent of an overripe lime, with multiple wrinkles and soft spots, yet it glistens in any form of light.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Peto Peto No Mi grants its user the ability to control the minds of living creatures by placing upon them a green, gel-like collar, turning the user into a "Mind Control Human".

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Collar Creation
entries: As an action, you can produce a green gel-like collar from your hand. Placing this collar on a creature requires a melee or ranged Devil Fruit spell attack if they resist. Alternatively, a willing creature can be given a collar without the need for a roll. Any creature wearing this collar has disadvantage on any Enchantment spells you cast on it. Escaping the collar requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 20 Strength check. A collar has 15 hit points and 20 AC. If you fall {@condition unconscious}, all collars are destroyed.

entries.name: Enthrall
entries: Once a creature has a collar on them, you can use an action to attempt to control it. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit DC. On a failed save, the creature is under your control and {@condition charmed} by you for up to 1 hour, during which they will follow any verbal commands. If the creature receives a command that might result in danger for itself, it gets another saving throw to resist the command. Removing the collar ends the control effect.

entries.name: Spells (Mental Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. Any spell cast using this feature must target creatures wearing one of your collars. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Command} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Suggestion} (2 charges), {@spell Enthrall} (2 charges), {@spell Fast Friends|AI} (3 charges), {@spell Confusion} (4 charges), {@spell Dominate Beast} (4 charges), {@spell Compulsion} (4 charges), {@spell Dominate Person} (5 charges), or {@spell Geas} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Master Manipulator)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can control multiple creatures simultaneously. As an action, you can produce and place special collars which emerge out of the ground on up to 5 creatures within 30 feet of you. This feature requires each creature wearing one of your collars to immediately make a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit DC or be controlled as per the Enthrall feature. These awakened collars last for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, after which they are destroyed. After using this feature, you cannot use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. The Hemo Hemo no Mi resembles a deep crimson pomegranate with darker vein-like patterns crisscrossing its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Hemo Hemo No Mi grants its user the chilling ability to manipulate and control blood, both their own and that of others. This fearsome power crowns the user as the "Blood Bender".

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Hematokinesis
entries: You learn the {@spell infestation|XGE} cantrip, no material components required, which allows you to control the blood in other living creatures.

entries.name: Blood Drain
entries: With a touch, you can drain the vitality of a creature. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon or melee spell attack, you can spend 1 devil fruit charge to absorb its blood. On a hit, the target takes an additional {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

entries.name: Vascular Control
entries: If you can see a creature that's been injured (and thus is bleeding) within the past minute, you can attempt to control their movement by manipulating their blood flow. As an action, choose a creature within 60 feet. They must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit DC or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of your next turn. Alternatively, on a failed save you can instead have the creature use all of its movement to move in a direction of your choice during its turn.

entries.name: Spells (Blood Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Inflict Wounds} (Can be casted at higher levels by spending additional charges; 1 charge), {@spell Ray of Enfeeblement} (2 charges), {@spell Hold Person} (2 charges), Blood Bridge (as {@spell Life Transference|XGE}; 3 charges), {@spell Vampiric Touch} (3 charges), Staunch (as {@spell Stoneskin}, but the user's skin becomes iron-hard due to concentrated blood; 4 charges), {@spell Blight} (4 charges), Blood Puppet (as {@spell Dominate Person} but only works on bleeding targets; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Total Blood Puppet)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Finger of Death}, without expending a spell slot or material components, as you ravage the target's body with your blood control. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. An extremely heavy, dark gray-colored cylindrical melon with a sturdy stem and swirls across its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: This fruit grants the user the ability to manipulate their weight without changing their size. At will, the user can become as light as a feather or as heavy as a ton, granting them significant advantages in combat and mobility.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Weight Manipulation
entries: As an action, you can adjust your weight to 1 gram or 10,000 tons for 1 minute, or return to your regular weight. Changing your weight does not change your physical size or shape, and you return to your normal weight if you are knocked {@condition unconscious}.

When you weigh 1 gram: Your movement speed doubles, you can move over water or fragile surfaces without breaking them, you don't take fall damage, and you make dexterity checks and saving throws at advantage but make strength checks and saving throws at disadvantage. Your jump distance is also tripled.

When you weigh 10,000 tons: Your melee attacks deal an extra {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage, your speed and jump distance is halved, and you make strength checks and saving throws at advantage but make dexterity checks and saving throws at disadvantage. You are also immune to being pushed or pulled against your will.

entries.name: Hell Vice
entries: When you're in the air (such as from a jump or fall), as a part of your action to become 10,000 tons, you can also deliver a crushing blow to enemies below you. All creatures within a 15-foot radius from where you land must make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (their choice) against your Devil Fruit save DC or take {@damage 8d10} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. If they succeed, they take half damage and aren't knocked {@condition prone}. You do not take fall damage so long as you don't fall more than 30 feet as a part of this ability.

entries.name: Spells (Ton Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Earth Tremor|XGE} (while 10,000 tons; Self; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Misty Step} (while 1 gram; 2 charges), {@spell Erupting Earth|XGE} (while 10,000 tons; Self; Doesn't affect you; 3 charges), {@spell Levitate} (while 1 gram; Self; 3 charges), {@spell Destructive Wave} (while 10,000 tons; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Final Vice)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Gravity Fissure|EGW} at the 9th level, without expending a spell slot or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

item.name: Bigu Bigu No Mi (Growing in Size)

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. The Bigu Bigu no Mi is a bulky fruit with an exterior resembling inflated, tight green skin, with sporadic, oversized pores.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Bigu Bigu No Mi bestows upon its user the wondrous power to increase their size, transforming them into a colossal version of themselves and earning them the epithet of the "Giant Human".

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Growing Might
entries: As an action, you can increase your size up to gargantuan, along with anything you are wearing or carrying. This growth lasts for 10 minutes or until you end it as a bonus action. While grown, you increase the weapon damage dice on Strength-based weapons you wield by {@dice 1d4} for each size category greater you are than medium, and you gain advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

entries.name: Extended Reach
entries: Your reach increases by 5 feet for each size category greater than medium you are when you are enlarged using your Growing Might, enabling you to grasp and interact with objects or targets from a distance.

entries.name: Spells (Growth Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Earth Tremor|XGE} (while at increased size; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Erupting Earth|XGE} (while at increased size; Self; Doesn't affect you; 3 charges), {@spell Destructive Wave} (while at increased size; 5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Titanic Surge)
entries: Upon awakening, as an action, you can increase the sizes of up to four allies using your Growing Might feature, as well as giving them the benefits of your Extended Reach feature. Additionally, you can increase the size of any nonmagical object that isn't being held or worn within 60 feet of you to garganutan. This effect lasts for 1 minute, or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. After using this feature, you cannot use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. The Mosa Mosa no Mi resembles a small, lime-green melon with twisting vine patterns wrapping around its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Mosa Mosa No Mi grants its user the incredible ability to stimulate and control rapid plant growth, from the tiniest of seeds to the mightiest of trees. The user becomes known as the "Plant Human."

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Plants Growth
entries: You learn the {@spell Thorn Whip} cantrip. Additionallly as a bonus action, you can cause any seeds or plants within a 10-foot radius to grow at an accelerated rate. The plants can be manipulated to grow in shapes or directions you desire. You can use this to make the area {@quickref difficult terrain||3}, produce 100 feet of rope-like vines, or double the size of a plant (up to gargantuan).

entries.name: Nature's Embrace
entries: You can spend an action to summon thick vines and foliage from the ground or nearby vegetation to restrain enemies. Creatures within 10 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit DC or be {@condition restrained}. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns to break free.

entries.name: Spells (Growth Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Entangle} (1 charge), {@spell Goodberry} (1 charge), {@spell Locate Animals or Plants} (plants only; 2 charges), {@spell Spike Growth} (2 charges), {@spell Plant Growth} (3 charges), {@spell Speak with Plants} (3 charges), {@spell Grasping Vine} (4 charges), {@spell Awaken} (plants only; 5 charges), or Wrath of {@skill Nature} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Living Forest)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Druid Grove|XGE} (casting time 1 action), without expending a spell slot or material components, as you awaken the plant life around you. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. The Shiku Shiku no Mi is a sickly green, bulbous fruit with purple pulsating veins.

entries.name: Description
entries: The Shiku Shiku No Mi allows its user to induce and control various diseases, making the user a "Disease Human." The wielder can cause mild to severe illnesses in targets, but also has the unique ability to draw upon the strength of the diseases they control.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Disease Immunity
entries: You are immune to all diseases, both mundane and magical.

entries.name: Infectious Touch
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature, forcing them to make a Constitution saving throw against you Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the target contracts a disease of your choice (it must save against your Devil Fruit DC for each disease):

entries.name: Cackle Fever
entries: See "sample diseases" in standard 5e DMG.

entries.name: Sewer Plague
entries: See "sample diseases" in standard 5e DMG.

entries.name: Sight Rot
entries: See "sample diseases" in standard 5e DMG.

entries.name: Hormone Reversal
entries: A creature's sex is swapped after {@dice 1d4} hours. A creature can attempt to recover from this condition by repeating the Constitution save after it finishes a long rest. Once it recovers from this disease, it becomes immune to it.

entries.name: Pandemic Wave
entries: As an action, you can spend 3 devil fruit charges to unleash a wave of disease in a 30-foot radius. Every creature within the radius must make a Constitution saving throw or contract a disease of your choice (see Infectious Touch).

entries.name: Spells (Pathogenic Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 9 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Ray of Sickness} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Sudden Fever ({@spell Phantasmal Force}; 2 charges), Extreme Fever ({@spell Phantasmal Killer}; 4 charges), {@spell Blight} (4 charges), {@spell Contagion} (5 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Pestilence Wave)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Contagion}, without expending a spell slot or material components, on each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.
