item.name: Inu Inu no Mi, Model: Wolf

entries.name: Type
entries: Standard Zoan
Fruit appearance. This devil fruit appears as a gray and black peach with thick fuzz across its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into a large wolf.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Shape
entries: As an action, you are able to transform into a Dire Wolf from the standard 5th Edition {@book Monster Manual|MM}. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Hybrid Form
entries: You can use your action to enter a "hybrid" zoan state, combining a mix of qualities from both your humanoid form and beast form together for a temporary period of time. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Awakening
entries: Upon the awakening of your Zoan Devil Fruit power, when you enter your Hybrid Form, you can temporarily enter your Awakened State, which lasts for 1 minute.

While your Awakened State is active, your hit point maximum and hit points increase by 50, your weapon attacks and unarmed strike attacks deal extra damage of their primary damage type equal to your character level, and you are able to select an additional hybrid form option. Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

Should the duration of your Awakened State expire, you hold the option to extend its span for an additional minute, at the cost of incurring a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If needed, you can further extend this state by enduring an extra level of {@condition exhaustion} for each additional minute. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

item.name: Neko Neko no Mi, Model: Lion

entries.name: Type
entries: Standard Zoan
Fruit appearance. This devil fruit appears as a yellow strawberry with swirling patterns across its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into a lion.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Shape
entries: As an action, you are able to transform into a Lion from the standard 5th Edition {@book Monster Manual|MM}. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Hybrid Form
entries: You can use your action to enter a "hybrid" zoan state, combining a mix of qualities from both your humanoid form and beast form together for a temporary period of time. entries.name: Sea Weakness

entries: As an action, you are able to transform into an Crocodile from the standard 5th Edition {@book Monster Manual|MM}. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Hybrid Form
entries: You can use your action to enter a "hybrid" zoan state, combining a mix of qualities from both your humanoid form and beast form together for a temporary period of time. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Awakening
entries: Upon the awakening of your Zoan Devil Fruit power, when you enter your Hybrid Form, you can temporarily enter your Awakened State, which lasts for 1 minute.

While your Awakened State is active, your hit point maximum and hit points increase by 50, your weapon attacks and unarmed strike attacks deal extra damage of their primary damage type equal to your character level, and you are able to select an additional hybrid form option. Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

Should the duration of your Awakened State expire, you hold the option to extend its span for an additional minute, at the cost of incurring a level of {@condition exhaustion}. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

item.name: Tori Tori no Mi, Model: Owl

entries.name: Type
entries: Standard Zoan
Fruit appearance. This devil fruit appears as a dark white and brown strawberry with black polka dots across its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into an owl.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Shape
entries: As an action, you are able to transform into a Giant Owl using the stat block to the right. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Hybrid Form
entries: You can use your action to enter a "hybrid" zoan state, combining a mix of qualities from both your humanoid form and beast form together for a temporary period of time. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Awakening
entries: Upon the awakening of your Zoan Devil Fruit power, when you enter your Hybrid Form, you can temporarily enter your Awakened State, which lasts for 1 minute.

While your Awakened State is active, your hit point maximum and hit points increase by 50, your weapon attacks and unarmed strike attacks deal extra damage of their primary damage type equal to your character level, and you are able to select an additional hybrid form option. Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

Should the duration of your Awakened State expire, you hold the option to extend its span for an additional minute, at the cost of incurring a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If needed, you can further extend this state by enduring an extra level of {@condition exhaustion} for each additional minute. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A light-beige, paw-shaped fruit with swirls and dark spots across its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Grants the user the ability to repel anything they touch with their paw-padded palms, including intangible concepts such as pain and fatigue, by using the paw pads on their palms.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Paw Push
entries: If you take the {@action Attack} action to shove a target and push it back, you can choose to push it back 30 feet using your paw-padded palms. If a pushed target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was pushed. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

Additionally, you may expend additional devil fruit charges to increase the distance the creature is pushed as a part of this attack. If you do so, you push the creature back an additional 10 feet per devil fruit charge expended, up to 100 feet in total.

entries.name: Paw Cannon
entries: You have the ability to repel the air around you, allowing you to fire paw-shaped air shockwaves. As an action, you can make a ranged spell attack against a target within 120 feet. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} thunder damage and must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be knocked {@condition prone}. You can spend 1 or more devil fruit charges to increase the damage of this attack, dealing an extra {@damage 1d6} damage per charge expended, up to {@dice 12d6} total thunder damage.

entries.name: Defensive Repel
entries: When targeted and hit by an attack, you can use your reaction and spend 7 devil fruit charges to attempt to repel the attack, causing the damage to become 0. The attacker must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the attacker takes half of the damage they would have dealt to you, as the attack is redirected back to them.

entries.name: Ursus Shock
entries: As an action, you may spend 1 or more devil fruit charges to concentrate a large volume of air into your palms, allowing you to unleash it out as a devastating shockwave centered on a point within 120 feet that you can see. If you do so, you target each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. A creature takes {@damage 3d10} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw. A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the shockwave's area. The shockwave's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and it's radius increases by 5 feet for each additional devil fruit charge expended over 1, dealing up to {@damage 11d10} thunder damage and having up to a 50-foot radius in total.

entries.name: Pain Repel
entries: As an action, you may expend 1 or more devil fruit charges to touch a creature and repel the pain from its body. If you do so, the target creature regains {@dice 1d10} hit points for every devil fruit charge spent. This ability has no effect on undead or constructs. Additionally, the repelled pain congeals and forms into a 10-foot-radius bubble in an empty space next to the target, and stores a number of pain equal to the amount healed from the target. The bubble lasts for up to 1 hour or until it pops. As an action, you may push the bubble up to 30 feet away from you by touching it. If you push the bubble into a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC, and the bubble pops. The creature takes the amount of stored pain in necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Extended Travel Repel
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and spend 7 devil fruit charges to attempt to teleport it to a location by repelling it at extreme speeds. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. A willing creature automatically fails this save. On a failure, the creature is teleported to a place you are aware of, landing in a random empty space in the region of the DM's choice. If no target destination is given, the target is teleported to a random location of the DM's choosing in the direction it is pushed, at least 1 mile away. On a successful save, the creature is instead repelled 30 feet away from you, as per your Paw Push ability.

entries.name: Spells (Repelling Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 13 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Misty Step} (2 charges), {@spell Air Bubble|AAG} (2 charges), {@spell Thunder Step|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell Wind Wall} (3 charges), {@spell Gravity Sinkhole|EGW} (4 charges), {@spell Destructive Wave} (5 charges), {@spell Far step|XGE} (5 charges), {@spell Scatter|XGE} (6 charges), or {@spell Teleport} (7 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Extended Group Vacation)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to target up to 5 creatures within 30 feet of you, threatening to repel them at extreme speeds away from you. A target creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failure, the creature is subjected to your Extended Travel Repel feature. On a success, the creature is instead repelled up to 30 feet away from you, as per your Paw Push ability.
After using this feature, you cannot use it again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Body Enhancer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A shimmering blue berry with multifaceted crystalline surfaces.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit empowers its user with the ability to transform or harden any part of their body into diamond.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Sharpened Diamond Body
entries: As a bonus action, you can transform any part of your body into a melee weapon of your choice. This can range from turning an arm into a diamond longsword, fingers into dagger-like diamond blades, or even combining your arms or legs into a diamond greatclub. Weapons you create have the same properties as their normal counterparts but are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance. You can use this part of your body as a weapon attack, and you are proficient with it. You can only use one weapon active this way at a time, and can dismiss it using a bonus action.

entries.name: Diamond Skin
entries: Your AC can't be less than 20, regardless of what kind of armor you are wearing. By spending 1 devil fruit charge as a bonus action, you can gain a +2 bonus to your AC for up to 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious} (this effect doesn't stack).

entries.name: Brilliant Punk
entries: You can spend a bonus action to bolster the next melee weapon attack you make during your turn with your diamond body. On a hit, the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} damage of the weapon's damage type. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be pushed 10 feet away from you and knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Spells (Diamond Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 13 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Thunder Step|XGE} (3 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Stoneskin} (Self; 4 charges), {@spell Destructive Wave} (5 charges), or {@spell Tenser's Transformation|XGE} (6 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Brilliant Wave)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to unleash a mighty earth shockwave affecting any creature standing on the ground within 60 feet of you. Any creature hit by the shockwave must make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 10d10} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 10d10} thunder damage, and is knocked {@condition prone}. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. Additionally, immediately after you use this ability, the ground within 60 feet of you becomes extremely hard and diamond-like for 1 minute, and cannot be destroyed or affected by any spells or other effects for the duation. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. An extremely shiny golden pear, with cloud-like spiral patterns across its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit empowers its user with the ability to manipulate and move around massive amounts of gold telekinetically.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Chrysokinesis
entries: You can use the {@spell Telekinesis} and {@spell Levitate} spells at will, without expending a spell slot, charge, or material components. You can only target objects made of gold and creatures wearing or holding gold items using these spells this way.

entries.name: Gold Manipulation
entries: As an action, you can target any gold within 60 feet of you to form up to thirteen 5-foot diameter spheres worth of affected gold, allowing you to telekinetically control the gold (as if using the {@spell Telekinesis} spell). You cannot have more than thirteen of these gold spheres under you control at once. You require 100,000 gold pieces or 400 gold bars (or ฿1,000,000,000 worth of gold) to form each individual 5-foot diameter sphere this way. Once you use this action, you cannot use it again for another 24 hours.

Any gold being telekinetically controlled by this ability is considered liquid (but doesn't count against a Devil Fruit user's Sea Weakness) unless otherwise stated, and counts as {@quickref difficult terrain||3} when moved through in its liquid state. Creatures will suffocate inside liquid gold if they remain inside it. Any gold forcibly moved 60 feet away from you while being telekinetically controlled returns to an empty space you can see within 60 feet of you at the start of your next turn. Additionally, while the spheres are under your telekinetic control, you can spend an action to use one of the following effects on the gold during your turn:

entries.name: Combine/Separate:
entries: You can combine the volumes of the gold spheres to form a larger mass of liquefied gold with a total volume no greater than the total volumes of your currently controlled gold, or split the mass back apart into independent 5-foot diameter spheres.

entries.name: Slam:
entries: You can slam a single 5-foot diameter sphere of gold into a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC, or take {@damage 3d10} bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Armory:
entries: You can use a single 5-foot diameter sphere of gold to form any weapon or armor of your choice. You are proficient with any gold weapon or armor you use, and ignore strength requirements to use it. Weapons you create have the same properties as their normal counterparts but are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance. The gold cannot be controlled or used while it is used as a weapon or piece of armor, unless you reform it back into a sphere a bonus action.

entries.name: Bind:
entries: You can use a single 5-foot diameter sphere of gold to target a creature within 30 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC, or become {@condition restrained} by the gold for 1 minute or until it breaks free (escape DC equal to your Devil Fruit save DC). The gold cannot be controlled or used while it restrains a creature, unless you free the creature from it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Animate:
entries: You use one sphere of gold to construct a solid Gold Golem (as Iron Golem; stats found in the standard 5th Edition {@book Monster Manual|MM}). It is under your control, and it understands and obeys your spoken commands. When it falls to 0 hit points or otherwise gets destroyed, so does the gold sphere used to construct it. You can only have one Gold Golem activate at a time, and once you create one you can't create anohter one for 24 hours.

entries.name: Collect:
entries: You condense the gold into tiny rings you collect, one ring per 5-foot diameter sphere of gold. You gain 1 devil fruit charge per ring collected, not exceeding 13 total charges, but can no longer affect the collected gold telepathically using your Gold Manipulation feature until you re-activate the feature.

entries.name: Spells (Golden Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 13 maximum charges, but you start with none. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Golden Burst (as {@spell Thunderous Smite}; 1 charge), Golden Arms (as {@spell Arms of Hadar}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Gold Wave (as {@spell Tidal Wave|XGE}, made of liquid gold; 3 charges), Golden Tentacles (as {@spell Evard's Black Tentacles}; 4 charges), Golden Hand (as {@spell Bigby's Hand}; 5 charges), Golden Wall (as {@spell Wall of Stone}; 5 charges), Flesh to Gold (as {@spell Flesh to Stone}; 6 charges), and Golden Inferno (as Firestorm; 7 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges when you use your "Collect" ability. All material created using these spells return back to the original gold value used to create the devil fruit charges to fuel it after the spell's duration ends.

entries.name: Awakening (Gold Splash)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to temporarily alchemically manifest gold from the environment, which you can control telepathically. When you do so, you can use this gold to cast {@spell Tsunami}, with a 1 action casting time. After the Tsunami ends, the gold returns back to mundane, nonmagical materials. Once used, you can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Special Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A creamy white fruit with a swirl pattern across its surface. It appears to have a pinched off, flattened foot toward the bottom of it.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit allows the user to create, control, and transform into mochi

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Mochi Body
entries: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, as physical objects pass through your mochi body. Additionally, you can move across {@quickref difficult terrain||3} created by mochi or sticky surfaces without spending extra Movement.

entries.name: Mochi Creation
entries: As a mochi being, you are able to produce and control mochi in various ways. Any mochi produced with this devil fruit is thick and viscous enough to not be considered water to devil fruit users, but creatures fully submerged in mochi will suffocate and drown normally as if they are underwater. You are immune to suffocating in your own mochi.

You can spend 1 devil fruit charge to cast {@spell create or destroy water} as a 1st-level spell slot, without expending a spell slot or material components. Instead of producing or destroying water with this spell, you produce or destroy edible mochi that is much thicker than water in the same amount and volume. This mochi counts as food when consumed, but spoils after 24 hours. You may spend additional devil fruit charges to increase the level of this spell by 1 for every charge expended as a part of casting the spell. Additionally, you learn and can use the {@spell Shape Water|XGE} cantrip on this mochi.

Additionally, you can spend a bonus action to harden the mochi into a solid block of mochi which can expand up to a 10-by-10 ft cube, but counts as the same amount of food. A creature in the mochi's space when it expands is pushed out safely to the nearest space.

entries.name: Mochi Reach
entries: You learn the {@spell mage hand} cantrip. Additionally, when you make a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can make its reach extend up to 30 feet by stretching your mochi limbs.

entries.name: Mochi Weapon
entries: As a bonus action, you can transform any part of your body into a melee weapon of your choice. This can range from turning an arm into a longsword, fingers into dagger-like blades, or even combining your arms or legs into a greatclub. Weapons you create have the same properties as their normal counterparts but are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance. You can use this part of your body as a weapon attack, and you are proficient with it. You can only use one weapon active this way at a time, and can dismiss it using a bonus action. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon created this way while it is within 5 feet of you, it must make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or become {@condition grappled} by you as it sticks to the mochi surface.

entries.name: Spells (Mochi Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 13 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Buzz Cut Mochi (as {@spell Zephyr Strike|XGE}; 1 charge), Willow Mochi (as {@spell Arms of Hadar}; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Burning Mochi (as {@spell Scorching Ray}; 2 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), Mochi Grasp (as Maximillian's Earthen Grasp; 2 charges), Wall of Mochi (as {@spell Wall of Water|XGE}, but made of mochi; 3 charges), Mochi Tentacles (as {@spell Evard's Black Tentacles}; 4 charges), Mochi Hand ({@spell Bigby's Hand}; 5 charges), or Mochi {@spell Shield} (as {@spell Fizban's Platinum Shield|FTD}; Self; 6 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Unstoppable Donuts)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to temporarily manifest large amounts of concentrated mochi from the environment, which you can control telepathically to create two floating fists which emerge from mochi donuts. When you do so, the two large hands appear within 120 feet of you at a point you can see, which act as Bigby's Hand (no {@status concentration} required), and last for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. You can use an action on your turn to create an additional hand this way, which appears within 120 feet of you, and lasts until the duration of this ability ends. As a bonus action, you can move and act with any number of mochi hands you control at once, as per the spell description of Bigby's Hand for each. Once used, you can't use this awakening again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. An emerald green melon with a swirl pattern across its surface and a crescent-shaped stem. Its surface is extremely hard, and very difficult to bite through.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit allows the user to create and manipulate magical barriers made of force.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Barrier Creation
entries: As an action, you can cast {@spell Wall of Force} at will without expending a spell slot, charges, or material components. However, when you cast it using this feature, you can only produce one 10-by-10 foot panel or a 5-foot diameter sphere centered on you with it.

entries.name: Barrier Crash
entries: While {@status concentration||concentrating} on a Wall of Force barrier you have created using this devil fruit power, you can spend an action to push it up to 30 feet in any direction, or until it collides with an unmovable object or terrain. Anything in the path of the moving barrier must make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC, as the barrier slams against it. On a failure, the target is knocked {@condition prone}, takes {@damage 2d8} force damage, and is pushed by the barrier up to the total distance you move it. On a success, it is only pushed by the barrier. If a creature is squished between your barrier and another object and fails the saving throw, it instead takes {@damage 4d8} force damage and is {@condition restrained} until it breaks free (escape DC equal to your Devil Fruit save DC). On a success or if the creature breaks free, it is pushed out to the nearest empty space that your barrier isn't pushing against.

entries.name: Barrierbility
entries: As an action, you can manipulate any active Wall of Force you have created to rearrange its panels into a shape of your choice, so long as each panel is still connected to another panel. For example, you can reform it into a staircase with each step being an individual panel of the wall. Any creature or object in the path of the shifting wall is not pushed or damaged by it.

entries.name: Barrier Fist
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend 1 devil fruit charge to deal an {@damage 2d8} force damage to the target, and it must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or you can knock it {@condition prone}. You can expend additional devil fruit charges to deal another {@damage 1d8} force damage per additional charge expended, up to a total of {@damage 10d8} force damage.

entries.name: Spells (Barrier Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 13 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Otiluke's Resilient Sphere} (4 charges), {@spell Wall of Force} (5 charges), Barrier Hand (as {@spell Bigby's Hand}; 5 charges), or {@spell Forcecage} (7 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Gigabarrier)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to temporarily manifest large amounts of energy from the environment, which you can then form and reshape into a massive barrier. When you do so, you cast a special Wall of Force, without expending a spell slot or material components. This special wall of force can have up to a hundred panels, and its radius is up to 100 feet instead. Once used, you can't use this awakening again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia

Fruit appearance. A stainless steel fruit with tons of bolt-shaped barbs and cloud-like swirls across its surface. It has a yellow coil wrapping around it up to the stem, which appears like a bolt of lightning.

entries.name: Description
entries: This devil fruit allows the user to control the magnetism and control metallic objects using magnetic forces.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Magnetokinesis
entries: You can use the {@spell Telekinesis} and {@spell Levitate} spells at will, without expending a spell slot, charge, or material components. You can only target objects made of metal and creatures wearing or holding metal or metallic items using these spells this way.

entries.name: Magnetic Repel
entries: When targeted and hit by an attack from a weapon or ammo which is made of metal, you can use your reaction and spend 7 devil fruit charges to attempt to repel the attack, causing the damage to become 0. The attacker must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the attacker takes half of the damage they would have dealt to you, as the attack is redirected back to them.

entries.name: Magnetic Assembly
entries: As an action, you can attract a large amount of metal within 120 feet of you toward your body to assemble onto your body. You must spend 1 devil fruit charge for every 5-foot square of metal you attract and assemble onto your body. For each square of metal you assemble onto you, you gain 10 temporary hit points (which only stacks with each additional shadow absorbed) up to a maximum of 30, your weapon attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage (up to a maximum bonus of {@dice 3d4}), your reach with melee weapons extends by 5 feet (up to a 15 foot total bonus), and your size increases by one (up to gargantuan). While this form is active, you have advantage on strength checks and saving throws. When you lose all temporary hit points granted by this ability, the metal you assembled is destroyed, and this ability ends.

entries.name: Electromagnetic Cannon
entries: As an action, you can spend 3 devil fruit charges to create a large electromagnetic cannon from metal around you. When you do so, you can fire a beam of electromagnetic energy forming a line of 100 feet long and 5 feet wide out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save and is pushed back 20 feet away from you, or half as much damage on a successful one and isn't pushed. You can spend additional devil fruit charges to increase the bludgeoning damage by {@dice 1d6} and the push distance by 10 feet for each additional charge spent, up to a total of {@damage 12d6} bludgeoning damage and 80 feet.

entries.name: Spells (Magnetic Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 13 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Catapult|XGE} (targeting metal; 1 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Cloud of Daggers} (2 charges, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Fly} (Self; 3 charges), {@spell Conjure Barrage} (3 charges), {@spell Conjure Volley} (5 charges), Scrap Metal Hand (as {@spell Bigby's Hand}; 5 charges), {@spell Blade Barrier} (6 charges), or {@spell Reverse Gravity} (only affecting metallic objects and creatures wearing metal; 7 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Magnetic Assignment)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to mark two targets, which can be objects or creatures you can see within 120 feet of you, which causes them to become magnetically attracted to each other, even if they aren't made of metal or wearing metal. This magnetic attraction lasts for 1 minute, or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. While these two targets are magnetically attracted to each other this way, each target at the start of each of its turns must make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save. On a failure, it is magnetically pulled up to 120 feet toward the other target, taking {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage per 10 feet traveled, unless the target is already within 5 feet of it. A target that is slammed into by an object or creature this way must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking the same damage on a failure or half as much on a success. Alternatively, you may force a target that fails its strength saving throw on its turn to be pushed away from the other target, up to a 120 foot gap between the two targets. If it is pushed away this way and crashes into an object, it takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage per 10 feet traveled from the crash.

Additionally, you may spend an action on subsequent turns for the duration to cause metalic objects in the area to crash into a target you have marked this way, forcing the target to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the target takes {@damage 8d6} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. If both marked targets are within 5 feet of each other, both must make this saving throw.
Once used, you can't use this awakening again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Substance Generator Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A reddish-purple pineapple with black skull and crossbones.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to produce deadly poisons and toxins from their body that can be controlled.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Poison Resistance
entries: You are immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition.

entries.name: Toxic Spray
entries: You learn the {@spell Poison Spray} and {@spell Acid Splash} Cantrips. Any time you deal poison damage to a creature using this devil fruit's spells and cantrips, if the effect doesn't already inflict the {@condition poisoned} condition, the creature is {@condition poisoned} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Poisonous Vapor Aura
entries: Any creature of your choice that starts its turn within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. You can activate or deactivate this aura as a bonus action.

entries.name: Poison Hydra Heads
entries: As an action, you can expend 3 devil fruit charges to create three giant poisonous hydra heads which connect to your body. These heads last for 1 minute and require {@status concentration} (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell) to maintain. You can use a bonus action to send one of the hydra heads crashing toward one creature or object you can see within 60 feet of you. When you do so, make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d12} poison damage. Whether you hit or miss, the head is expended. This ability ends early if all heads are expended.

Alternatively, you can expend a head of this hydra as a bonus action to fly up to 60 feet toward an empty space you can see without spending any movement, traveling along the hydras neck to the target destination. If you land in a space midair, you fall.

entries.name: Spells (Poison Gas and Blast)
entries: This devil fruit power has 13 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Poison Armor (as {@spell armor of agathys}, but dealing poison damage instead; 1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Dragon's Breath|XGE} (self; poison damage; 2 charges), Vitrolic Sphere (4 charges), {@spell Cloudkill} (5 charges), {@spell Contagion} (5 charges), {@spell Prismatic Spray} (choosing between green or orange rays only; 7 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Toxic Demon)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast Poison Giant: Hell's Judgement^ (view Chapter 8 in the Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB), without expending any charges or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

item.name: Zou Zou no Mi, Model: Mammoth

entries.name: Type
entries: Ancient Zoan
Fruit appearance. This devil fruit appears as a massive brown apple with black furry stripes, and two white tusk-like stems.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into a mammoth.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Shape
entries: As an action, you are able to transform into a Mammoth from the standard 5th Edition {@book Monster Manual|MM}. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Hybrid Form
entries: You can use your action to enter a "hybrid" zoan state, combining a mix of qualities from both your humanoid form and beast form together for a temporary period of time. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Awakening
entries: Upon the awakening of your Zoan Devil Fruit power, when you enter your Hybrid Form, you can temporarily enter your Awakened State, which lasts for 1 minute.

While your Awakened State is active, your hit point maximum and hit points increase by 50, your weapon attacks and unarmed strike attacks deal extra damage of their primary damage type equal to your character level, and you are able to select an additional hybrid form option. Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

Should the duration of your Awakened State expire, you hold the option to extend its span for an additional minute, at the cost of incurring a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If needed, you can further extend this state by enduring an extra level of {@condition exhaustion} for each additional minute. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

item.name: Ryu Ryu no Mi, Model: Brachiosaurus

entries.name: Type
entries: Ancient Zoan
Fruit appearance. This devil fruit appears as a massive yellow-orange pear with a hard scale-like surface and swirls.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into a brachiosaurus.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Shape
entries: As an action, you are able to transform into a Brontosaurus (reflavored as a brachiosaurus) from {@book Volo's Guide to Monsters|VGM}. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

entries: Ancient Zoan
Fruit appearance. This devil fruit appears as a colossal reddish-orange durian fruit with black strips across its surface and multiple feather-like leaves emerging from it's thick stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into a tyrannosaurus rex.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.
