entries.name: Type
entries: Gaseous Logia
Fruit appearance. Puffy and extremely light white melon with cloud-like swirls and a swirly green stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows its user to create, control, and transform into smoke at will.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Logia Immunity
entries: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, as physical objects pass through your smoke body. Additionally, you can see normally through smoke, cloud, and fog-like effects that cause an area to become lightly or {@quickref Vision and Light||2||heavily obscured}.

entries.name: Elemental Form
entries: You can use the "Logia Elemental Form" feature listed under "Designing a Logia Devil Fruit Sheet".

entries.name: Smoke Strike
entries: You learn the {@spell mage hand} cantrip. Additionally, when you make a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can make its reach extend up to 30 feet by stretching your smoke limbs.

entries.name: Smoke Screen
entries: You can use the {@spell Fog Cloud} spell at will, casting at the 1st level, without expending a spell slot, charge, or material components. You can cast it at higher levels by spending a Devil Fruit charge for each level you cast it higher.

entries.name: Smoke Prison
entries: As an action during your turn, you can target any number of creaturs within any of your smoke or fog spell areas. Each creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or become {@condition restrained} for the duration of the smoke or fog (Escape DC equal to your Devil Fruit save DC).

entries.name: Spells (Smoke Plumes)
entries: This devil fruit power has 13 charges. Using your ability to produce smoke, you can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Misty Step} (2 charges), {@spell Gaseous Form} (3 charges), {@spell Stinking Cloud} (3 charges), {@spell Cloudkill} (5 charges), {@spell Investiture of Wind|XGE} (6 charges), {@spell Wind Walk} (6 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Explosive Plume)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Incendiary Cloud} without expending any charges or material components. You can't use this feature again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Solid Logia
Fruit appearance. A white and light blue starfruit with snowflake patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows its user to create, control, and transform into snow at will.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Logia Immunity
entries: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, as physical objects pass through your snow body. Additionally, you are immune to cold damage and you can move across {@quickref difficult terrain||3} created by ice or snow without spending extra Movement.

entries.name: Elemental Form
entries: You can use the "Logia Elemental Form" feature listed under "Designing a Logia Devil Fruit Sheet".

entries.name: Crippling Frost
entries: You learn the {@spell Frostbite|XGE} Cantrip. Any time a creature takes cold damage from your Devil Fruit Spells or Cantrip, its speed is reduced by 10 until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Snow Demon
entries: As an action, you can spend 3 devil fruit charges to enter a snow demon form for 1 minute. When you do so, your size grows to large, you gain 30 temporary hit points, and you grow an icy fanged maw, which is a natural weapon you can use to make unarmed strikes for the duration. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 2d6}, plus an additional {@damage 1d6} cold damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. Additionally, when you hit a creature with your bite attack in this form, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or become {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Spells (Snow Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 13 charges. You can use an action, bonus action, or reaction and expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell armor of agathys} (1 charge, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell snilloc's snowball swarm|XGE} (2 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell elemental weapon} (cold; 3 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell ice storm} (4 charges), {@spell cone of cold} (5 charges), {@spell investiture of ice|XGE} (6 charges), {@spell wall of ice} (6 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Ten-Layer Igloo)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Prismatic Wall}, with each layer being Blue, without expending any charges or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Liquid Logia
Fruit appearance. A light brown pear with drooping s-shaped swirl patterns, which smells of sulfur.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows its user to create, control, and transform into mud and other liquid "swamp" elements at will.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Logia Immunity
entries: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, as physical objects pass through your swamp body. Additionally, you can move across {@quickref difficult terrain||3} created by mud or swamps without spending extra Movement, and you do not suffocate inside of your swamp waters.

entries.name: Elemental Form
entries: You can use the "Logia Elemental Form" feature listed under "Designing a Logia Devil Fruit Sheet".

entries.name: Swampy Storage
entries: You learn the {@spell Mold Earth|XGE} Cantrip. Additionally, you can store additional equipment inside your swamp body, multiplying your carrying capacity by 10.

entries.name: Swamp Trap
entries: As an action, you can transform a 5-foot diameter section of dirt or rock you can see within 30 feet of you into a swampy sinkhole, which is 20 feet deep. This sinking ground remains this way for 10 minutes or until you return it back to normal as a bonus action. This area is considered {@quickref difficult terrain||3} when walked across, and a creature which moves into it or starts its turn standing in the area must make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failure, the creature is {@condition restrained} and sinks 5 feet deeper into the hole at the start of each of its turn. A creature can repeat the Strength saving throw at the start of each of its turns to escape, after which it then must use at least 20 feet of movement to crawl out of the swampy hole. A creature which is fully submerged in the swampy hole begins to suffocate and is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} for the duration, but it doesn't trigger a Devil Fruit user's Sea Weakness.

entries.name: Spells (Swamp Control)
entries: This devil fruit power has 13 charges. You can use an action, bonus action, or reaction and expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell earth tremor|XGE} (1 charge, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell entangle} (1 charge), maximillian's earthen grasp (2 charges), {@spell wall of water|XGE} (made of muddy swamp material; 3 charges), {@spell stone shape} (4 charges), {@spell transmute rock|XGE} (5 charges), {@spell move earth} (6 charges), {@spell investiture of stone|XGE} (6 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Calamity Swamp)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cause all ground within 120 feet of you to become affected by your Swamp Trap feature for 10 minutes. Additionally, your allies can move through the terrain normally without sinking or needing to spend extra movement. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Gaseous Logia
Fruit appearance. A small neon light purple melon with cloud-like swirl patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows its user to create, control, and transform into various gases at will.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Logia Immunity
entries: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, as physical objects pass through your gas body. You are immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition, and you are immune to suffocating, but not from drowning.

entries.name: Elemental Form
entries: You can use the "Logia Elemental Form" feature listed under "Designing a Logia Devil Fruit Sheet".

entries.name: Gas Control
entries: You learn the Gust, Thaumaturgy, and {@spell Produce flame} Cantrips, no material components required. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to create or remove oxygen up to 30 feet around you for up to 10 minutes (see suffocating rules in the D&D {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}).

entries.name: Spells (Deadly Gases)
entries: This devil fruit power has 13 charges. You can use an action, bonus action, or reaction and expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell chromatic orb} (1 charge, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell sleep} (1 charge, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell flame blade} (2 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell gust of wind} (2 charges), {@spell warding wind|XGE} (2 charges), {@spell gaseous form} (3 charges), {@spell stinking cloud} (3 charges), {@spell wind wall} (3 charges), {@spell fireball} (3 charges), {@spell cloudkill} (5 charges), {@spell Investiture of Wind|XGE} (6 charges), {@spell prismatic spray} (7 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Terror Gas)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Weird}, without expending any charges or material components. You can't use this action for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Gaseous Logia
Fruit appearance. A tan cactus shaped like a ball with swirling patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows its user to create, control, and transform into sand at will.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Logia Immunity
entries: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, as physical objects pass through your sand body. Additionally, you can move across {@quickref difficult terrain||3} created by desserts without spending extra Movement.

entries.name: Elemental Form
entries: You can use the "Logia Elemental Form" feature listed under "Designing a Logia Devil Fruit Sheet".

entries.name: Dry Sands
entries: You learn the {@spell Mold Earth|XGE} and {@spell Toll the Dead|XGE} Cantrips. Additionally, any creature that fails its save against one of your Devil Fruit spells or abilities which deal necrotic damage becomes dehydrated until the start of your next turn. A dehydrated creature gains two temporary levels of {@condition exhaustion} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Dessert Sword
entries: As an action, you can spend 3 devil fruit charges to create a large piercing sand blade. When you do so, you can fire a beam of sand, forming a line of 100 feet long and 5 feet wide out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} piercing damage and {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage on a failed save. and is dehydrated until the start of your next turn, or half as much damage on a successful one and isn't dehydrated. You can spend additional devil fruit charges to increase the piercing damage by {@dice 1d6} for each additional charge spent, up to a total of {@damage 9d6} piercing damage and {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spells (Desert Sands)
entries: This devil fruit power has 13 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell earth tremor|XGE} (1 charge, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell dust devil|XGE} (2 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell gaseous form} (3 charges), {@spell wall of sand|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell blight} (4 charges), {@spell transmute rock|XGE} (5 charges), {@spell investiture of wind|XGE} (6 charges), {@spell circle of death} (6 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Ground Death)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Abi-Dalzim's Horrid Wilting|XGE}, without expending any charges or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A red heart-shaped melon with swirls

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to create a zone of control around them that they can manipulate in a variety of ways.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Counter Shock & Room
entries: You learn the {@spell Shocking Grasp} cantrip. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to create a 60-foot radius psychic sphere, or "room", centered on where you are standing when you create it. You must maintain {@status concentration} on this room (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). The room lasts for 1 minute, or until you end it using a bonus action. You can only have one room up at a time. Each turn, you can use an another bonus action to increase the radius of the room by another 60 feet. Any creature you can see within the room can be targeted by any leveled spell casted using this devil fruit under "Room Spells", regardless of spell range. Additionally, the range of spells or any spell effect listed in "room spells" can be extended to anywhere within the "room", but is also limited by the range of the room and cannot be cast outside it or affect anything outside the room's radius. For example, misty step's range increases from 60 feet up to the range of anywhere within the room's radius. Room Spells which normally require {@status concentration} don't require {@status concentration} while cast within the Room's radius, but will end when the Room's duration ends or when you lose {@status concentration} on the room.

You can spend an action to Scan the radius of your room to spot a creature you are aware of that is behind full cover or hidden within the room's range. You can do this by rolling a perception check against the creature's stealth to locate it. A creature spotted this way cannot gain the benefits of full cover against your Devil Fruit Spells while within the room's range, and can be seen by you as if they were fully visible, becoming outlined by Faerie Fire.

entries.name: Surgery Scalpel
entries: As an action, you can designate a melee weapon you are proficient with that deals slashing or piercing damage as your Surgery Scalpel when using your Ope Ope no Mi powers. The weapon becomes magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance if it isn't already. Additionally, when you hit a creature within your Room with your Surgery Scalpel, once per turn you can forego dealing damage and instead use one of the following effects against the target:

entries.name: Injection Shot:
entries: You can spend 1 devil fruit charge to deal an extra {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage to the target with your Surgery Scalpel.

entries.name: Gamma Knife:
entries: You can spend 3 devil fruit charges to deal an extra {@damage 3d8} radiant damage to the target with your Surgery Scalpel. Additionally, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turn, ending the condition on a success.

entries.name: Amputate:
entries: You cleanly slice off one of the creature's limbs for 10 minutes, but dealing no harm to it in the process. Each time you remove a creature's limbs this way, it gains a level of {@condition exhaustion} (up to a maximum of 5 levels of {@condition exhaustion}) so long as the limbs aren't attached. A creature that has had its limbs removed this way can spend an action to re-attach all its limbs, ending all levels of {@condition exhaustion} applied by the amputation on itself. You can spend 1 devil fruit charge when using this attack during your turn to apply "Radio Knife" to the Amputation, dealing {@damage 1d8} electric damage to the target, and causing the creature to become unable to re-attach it's missing limb unless its succeeds on a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC as a part of its action to re-attach its limbs. If the creature fails the saving throw, its action is wasted and its limbs remain unattached.

entries.name: Shambles
entries: You can target two creatures or objects, including yourself, within your "room" as an action. The two targets magically teleport to each other's spaces and swap places.

entries.name: Immortality Surgery
entries: By spending 10 minutes operating on another creature, you grant it immortality. The target stops aging. It is immune to any effect that would age it, and it can't die from old age. However, you will die and be reduced to dust upon completing this surgery.

entries.name: Room Spells
entries: This devil fruit power has 17 charges. While within the "room", you can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell catapult|XGE} (1 charge, can be cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell detect poison and disease} (1 charge), {@spell cure wounds} (1 charge, can be cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell find traps} (2 charges), {@spell hold person} (2 charges, can be cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell levitate} (2 charges), {@spell silence} (2 charges), {@spell see invisibility} (only within room; 2 charges), {@spell vortex warp|SCC} (2 charges), {@spell gravity sinkhole|EGW} (4 charges), {@spell hold monster} (5 charges), {@spell mass cure wounds} (5 charges), {@spell telekinesis} (5 charges), {@spell move earth} (6 charges), {@spell whirlwind|XGE} (7 charges), or {@spell tether essence|EGW} (7 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (K-ROOM and R-ROOM)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to activate K-ROOM or R-ROOM, or use an action to alternate between the two, ending any currently active Rooms. You can use either of these special rooms for 1 minute after activating your awakening (but cannot activate your regular Room or both at the same time), or until you fall {@condition unconscious}, and they do not require {@status concentration} to maintain:

K-ROOM: You apply your Room to your designated Surgery Scalpel as a special coating for the duration. While this special Room is active, your Surgery Scalpel weapon's reach becomes 60 feet. You can use a bonus action while your K-ROOM coating is active to extend your Surgery Scalpel's reach by an additional 60 feet. Additionally, when you hit a creature with K-ROOM coated Surgery Scalpel, once per turn you can forego dealing damage and instead use one of the following effects against the target:

entries.name: Shock Surge:
entries: You send a deadly shock through the target, dealing {@damage 10d10} lightning damage to it.

entries.name: Puncture Surge:
entries: The target is pushed away from you to the end of your weapon's reach and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was pushed. If the target is pushed into another creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

R-ROOM: You apply your Room to a target within 120 feet of you. The room is a 10-foot-radius sphere which surrounds the target. Until the duration ends, the sphere moves with the target, centered on it. This room acts as an {@spell Antimagic Field} spell.
You can't use this feature again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A massive light blue pear with S-shaped spiral patterns, which rumbles and shakes occasionally on its own.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to produce catastrophic earthquakes and move the earth and sea with ease.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Quake Immunity
entries: You are immune to thunder damage.

entries.name: Mini Quakes
entries: You learn the {@spell Thunderclap|XGE} and {@spell Mold Earth|XGE} cantrips, no material components required. Additionally, you can cast {@spell earth tremor|XGE} (1st level) as an action, no charges required. You can cast it at higher levels by spending a devil fruit charge for each additional level the spell is cast at.

entries.name: Quake Strike
entries: Once per turn, when you hit with a melee weapon attack, you can expend 1 or more devil fruit charges to release a quake strike. If you do so, the target and all other creatures within 15 feet of you must also make a Constitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failure, a target takes {@damage 1d8} thunder damage, plus {@dice 1d8} for each charge expended, and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a success, a target takes half as much thunder damage, and isn't pushed. In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 10 feet away from you by the attack's effect, and the effect emits a thunderous boom audible out to 300 feet.

entries.name: Spells (Deadly Quakes)
entries: This devil fruit power has 17 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell shatter} (2 charges, can be cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell thunder step|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell erupting earth|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell move earth} (6 charges), {@spell gravity fissure|EGW} (6 charges), {@spell investiture of stone|XGE} (6 charges), {@spell tsunami} (8 charges), {@spell earthquake} (8 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Island Shaking)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast Island Shaking^ (view Chapter 8 in the Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB), without expending any charges or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. a round, pink fruit with multiple colored stripes across it middle section resembling a musical staff, and a green stem shaped like an accented eighth note.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to bring the consciousness of creature's into a dream world of song by singing.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Song World
entries: As an action, you can sing to all humanoid creatures of your choice that can hear you within 120 feet to attempt to pull them into a special Song World. Each targeted creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or magically fall {@condition unconscious}. A willing creature automatically fails this saving throw. While a creature is {@condition unconscious} this way, it has its astral body projected into a closed-off section of the Astral Plane (following the rules of the {@spell Astral Projection} spell), named the "Song World". The Song World closely resembles the real world, and you can manipulate and affect the world and objects or creatures within it using your Devil Fruit powers.

You are able to enter the Song World while you are still conscious, projecting your astral body into the Song World at will. You can control your astral body and physical body at the same time. You can only use your Song World Spells against creatures within your Song World using your astral body and your Song World Spells with a range of Self can only be used on your astral body, not your physical body. Additionally, if you fall {@condition unconscious} while creatures are within your Song World, their astral bodies are returned to their physical bodies and their physical body regains consciousness.

entries.name: Song Puppets
entries: As an action, if a humanoid creature is {@condition unconscious} due to your Song World feature, you are able to make its physical body a Song Puppet while it remains {@condition unconscious}. A Song Puppet is controlled by you as if using the {@spell Dominate Person} spell, no {@status concentration} required.

entries.name: Song Minions
entries: You can use the Animate Objects, Telekinesis, and {@spell Mirage Arcane} spells at will, without expending a spell slot, charge, or material components. You can cast these spells this way from within the Song World using your astral body.

entries.name: Song World Spells
entries: This devil fruit power has 17 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell shield} (1 charge), {@spell hold person} (2 charges, can be cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell fly} (3 charges), {@spell dispel magic} (3 charges), {@spell mass healing word} (3 charges), {@spell wrath of nature|XGE} (5 charges), {@spell guards and wards} (6 charges), {@spell project image} (7 charges), {@spell antimagic field} (8 charges), {@spell reality break|EGW} (8 charges), or {@spell wish} (9 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn. You can only use these spells against a creature's astral body within the song world.

entries.name: Awakening (Tot Musica)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to summon Tot Musica, the Demon King of Songs, in an empty space within 120 feet of you, for 1 minute, until you fall {@condition unconscious} or end it as a bonus action. Tot Musica has the stats of an Elder Tempest from {@book Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes|MTF}. While Tot Musica is alive, the Song World and material plane are temporarily fused for the duration. For the duration, all creatures which have their astral bodies trapped in the Song World have them returned to their physical bodies and regain consciousness, after which their astral bodies are returned back to the Song World as per your Song World ability. Your astral body is also temporarily returned to your physical body for the duration of your awakening. You can use all of your Devil Fruit abilities and Song World Spells within the real world and material plane, casting them from your physical body while the worlds remain fused. Once used, you can't activate your awakening again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. a large, pink plum with spiral shapes along its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to interact with and manipulate the souls of other living creatures.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Soul Pocus
entries: As an action, you can target a creature that can see and hear you within 60 feet and rip away a part of it's soul to attempt to rob it of it's lifespan. The creature must have a challenge rating of 1/8 or higher for this ability to work on it. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or the creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. A creature that is {@condition frightened} of you has disadvantage on this saving throw. If a creature is immune to the {@condition frightened} condition or necrotic damage, it is not affected by this ability. This reduction is permanent, unless a Greater Restoration, Heal, or {@spell Wish} spell is used on the target. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. Additionally, whenever a creature fails this saving throw and has its hit point maximum reduced by this ability, you gain 1 devil fruit charge.
Additionally, you can spend an action to sacrifice 10 hit points and reduce your hit point maxmimum by 10 to gain 1 devil fruit charge. This reduction lasts until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Soul Homies
entries: As an action, you can spend 5 devil fruit charges to create a "Homie" by filling a target with collected soul power. You use the Aniamte Objects or {@spell Awaken} spell descriptions on applicable targets for this ability. Homies created this way follow your commands and last indefinitely.

Alternatively, you can use this action and spend 9 devil fruit charges to create a Special Homie made of stronger soul energy and raw elemental power. For a special homie, use the {@spell Conjure Elemental} spell description instead, and you can summon an elemental with a challenge rating of 9 or lower which follows your orders and lasts indefinitely.

entries.name: Incarnations
entries: You can expend 2 devil fruit charges to create an Incarnation within 30 feet of you. An Incarnation has the statistics of a Specter (view the standard 5e monster manual). An Incarnation cannot attack, but can use your Soul Pocus on willing creatures to collect soul energy, though it cannot reduce a creature's maximum hit points below 1. If a creature only has 1 maximum hit point, an Incarnation cannot use Soul Pocus on it. An Incarnation follows your orders and lasts until you dismiss it as a bonus action. It can collect up to 5 devil fruit charges from creatures this way, which it can then transfer to you as an action while it is within 5 feet of you.

entries.name: Spells (Soul Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 17 maximum charges, but you start with none. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell chromatic orb} (1 charge, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell phantasmal force} (2 charges; can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell elemental weapon} (3 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell fear} (3 charges), {@spell fireball} (3 charges), {@spell lightning bolt} (3 charges), {@spell Blight} (4 charges), {@spell Dominate Person} (5 charges), {@spell Flame Strike} (5 charges), Wrath of {@skill Nature} (5 charges), Chain Lightning (6 charges), Soul Cage (6 charges), Prismatic Spray (7 charges), Fire Storm (7 charges), Feeblemind (8 charges), or Psychic Scream (9 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges when you use your Soul Pocus ability.

entries.name: Awakening (3000 Leagues of Misery)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to attempt to siphon the souls of all creatures within 60 feet of you. Each creature of your choice in the area is subjected to your Soul Pocus ability and must save against it. Additionally, as a part of this action, you also summon a Soul Monster in an empty space you can see within 60 feet of you, which lasts for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. This Soul monster has the statistics of a Boneclaw from {@book Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes|MTF}, loses its Reujuvenation feature and gains the Incorporeal Movement feature instead.

The Soul Monster is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, it shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge} action and uses its move to avoid danger.
Once used, you can't activate your awakening again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. An unusually heavy dark gray melon with purple cracks and ripples along its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to create and manipulate gravitational forces.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Gravity Control
entries: You learn the {@spell Sapping Sting|EGW} cantrip, no material components required. Additionally, you can cast {@spell magnify gravity|EGW} (1st level) as an action, no charges required. You can cast it at higher levels by spending a devil fruit charge for each additional level the spell is cast at.

entries.name: Gravity Wave
entries: As an action, you can spend 3 devil fruit charges to emit a large wave of enhanced gravity. When you do so, you can fire a wave of gravitational energy forming a line of 100 feet long and 5 feet wide out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} force damage on a failed save and is knocked {@condition prone}, or half as much damage on a successful one and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. You can spend additional devil fruit charges to increase the force damage by {@dice 1d6}, up to a total of {@damage 12d6} force damage.

entries.name: Spells (Gravity Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 17 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell immovable object|EGW} (2 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell levitate} (2 charges), {@spell pulse wave|EGW} (3 charges), {@spell gravity sinkhole|EGW} (4 charges), {@spell telekinesis} (5 charges), {@spell gravity fissure|EGW} (6 charges), {@spell reverse gravity} (7 charges), {@spell dark star|EGW} (8 charges), or {@spell meteor swarm} (9 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Extreme Gravity Field)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a 60-foot radius gravity aura around you for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. When you activate this aura, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and when the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 10d8} force damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. While in the aura, any object that isn't being worn or carried in the sphere requires a successful Strength check against your spell save DC to pick up or move. Ranged attacks made against you and any creature within this field are made at disadvantage. Once used, you can't activate your awakening again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. A long yellow pear with black spirals across its surface and a swirling brown stem. It seems to remain stationary, floating in the air even when dropped.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to levitate themselves and non-living things into the air, which can be controlled telepathically.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Permanent Levitation
entries: As an action, you can touch any object that isn't being worn or held, or up to a 20-foot cube of terrain, and cause it to levitate up to 20 feet in the air (as if using the {@spell levitate} spell) at will, no {@status concentration} required, and regardless of its weight. You can move one object you are levitating up to 20 feet during your turn. You can cause multiple objects to permanently levitate this way, and can end this levitation effect on any number of them as a bonus action. If you fall {@condition unconscious}, every object you are levitating this way loses its levitating properties and begins to fall if it is midair, unless you command them to levitate again as an action.

entries.name: Bodily Levitation
entries: You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and hover mid-air.

entries.name: Spells (Floating Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 17 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell catapult|XGE} (1 charge, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell immovable object|EGW} (2 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell control water} (4 charges), {@spell animate objects} (5 charges), {@spell move earth} (6 charges), {@spell reverse gravity} (7 charges), {@spell earthquake} (8 charges), or {@spell tsunami} (8 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn. These spells only work on objects or regions of terrain you have touched before.

entries.name: Awakening (Float Zone)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a 120-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see within 300 feet for 1 minute or until you fall {@condition unconscious}. Any creature or object within this sphere can be targeted by any of your Devil Fruit spells for the duration, even if you haven't touched them before. Additionally, if a creature starts its turn in the sphere or enters it for the first time during its turn, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature is levitated 20 feet in the air (as if affected by the {@spell Levitate} spell), and has its movement halved for the rest of its turn. Once used, you can't activate your awakening again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Environment Alterer Paramecia
Fruit appearance. An flat blue melon with siwlrs across it and a green, leafy top. The stem resembles a tree, emerging from the top.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows the user to merge with an island's environment and manipulate it.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Stone Meld
entries: As an action, you can merge with any stone surface, allowing you to traverse through it, effectively disappearing from sight. While merged, you can move within and emerge from any connected stone surface within 60 feet.

entries.name: Island Manipulation
entries: You can use the Stone Shape, Passwall, Transmute Rock, and {@spell Wall of Stone} spells at will so long as you are touching the ground, without expending a spell slot, charge, or material components.

entries.name: Island Body
entries: You can spend 4 devil fruit charges to mold the stone around you to polymorph (as if using the {@spell polymorph} spell) yourself into a stone construct or earth elemental that has a challenge rating equal to or less than your level for up to 1 hour. However, your mental ability scores remain the same and you can speak while in this form. You remain this way as long as you concentrate on maintaining it (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). The transformation lasts for the duration, or until you drop to 0 hit points or die. You can continue to use your Devil Fruit abilities and spells in this form, so long as they don't require {@status concentration}, but cannot use any other class or racial features or spells for the duration.

entries.name: Spells (Island Techniques)
entries: This devil fruit power has 17 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell Earth Tremor|XGE} (1 charge, and can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell Maximilian's Earthen Grasp|XGE} (2 charges), {@spell Erupting Earth|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell Stoneskin} (4 charges), Wrath of {@skill Nature} (5 charges), Investiture of Stone (6 charges), Move Earth (6 charges), Earthquake (8 charges), or Tsunami (8 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Total Island Dominion)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can spend an action to polymorph into a Zaratan from {@book Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes|MTF} for 1 minute, using your Island Body feature. However, you still have a swim speed of 0 in this form and are subject to your Sea Weakness. Once used, you can't activate your awakening again for another 24 hours.

item.name: Tori Tori no Mi, Model: Phoenix

entries.name: Type
entries: Mythical Zoan
Fruit appearance. This devil fruit appears as a bright blue pineapple with swirling flame patterns across its surface, and a bright golden crown.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into a phoenix.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Shape
entries: As an action, you are able to transform into a Phoenix from {@book Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes|MTF}. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Hybrid Form
entries: You can use your action to enter a "hybrid" zoan state, combining a mix of qualities from both your humanoid form and beast form together for a temporary period of time. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Awakening
entries: Upon the awakening of your Zoan Devil Fruit power, when you enter your Hybrid Form, you can temporarily enter your Awakened State, which lasts for 1 minute.

While your Awakened State is active, your hit point maximum and hit points increase by 50, your weapon attacks and unarmed strike attacks deal extra damage of their primary damage type equal to your character level, and you are able to select an additional hybrid form option. Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

Should the duration of your Awakened State expire, you hold the option to extend its span for an additional minute, at the cost of incurring a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If needed, you can further extend this state by enduring an extra level of {@condition exhaustion} for each additional minute. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

item.name: Ryu Ryu no Mi, Model: Red Dragon

entries.name: Type
entries: Mythical Zoan
Fruit appearance. This devil fruit appears as a large, red pear with bright scales across its surface and a flame-shaped leaf emerging from its stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into a red dragon.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Shape
entries: As an action, you are able to transform into an Adult Red Dragon from the standard D&D 5th Edition {@book Monster Manual|MM}. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Hybrid Form
entries: You can use your action to enter a "hybrid" zoan state, combining a mix of qualities from both your humanoid form and beast form together for a temporary period of time. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Awakening
entries: Upon the awakening of your Zoan Devil Fruit power, when you enter your Hybrid Form, you can temporarily enter your Awakened State, which lasts for 1 minute.

While your Awakened State is active, your hit point maximum and hit points increase by 50, your weapon attacks and unarmed strike attacks deal extra damage of their primary damage type equal to your character level, and you are able to select an additional hybrid form option. Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

Should the duration of your Awakened State expire, you hold the option to extend its span for an additional minute, at the cost of incurring a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If needed, you can further extend this state by enduring an extra level of {@condition exhaustion} for each additional minute. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

item.name: Uma Uma no Mi, Model: Unicorn

entries.name: Type
entries: Mythical Zoan
Fruit appearance. This devil fruit appears as a shiny pearlescent melon with cloud-like swirls, a rainbow-striped center, and a swirling conical white stem pointing upward.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into a unicorn.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Shape
entries: As an action, you are able to transform into a Unicorn using the stat block to the right. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Hybrid Form
entries: You can use your action to enter a "hybrid" zoan state, combining a mix of qualities from both your humanoid form and beast form together for a temporary period of time. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Awakening
entries: Upon the awakening of your Zoan Devil Fruit power, when you enter your Hybrid Form, you can temporarily enter your Awakened State, which lasts for 1 minute.

While your Awakened State is active, your hit point maximum and hit points increase by 50, your weapon attacks and unarmed strike attacks deal extra damage of their primary damage type equal to your character level, and you are able to select an additional hybrid form option. Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

Should the duration of your Awakened State expire, you hold the option to extend its span for an additional minute, at the cost of incurring a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If needed, you can further extend this state by enduring an extra level of {@condition exhaustion} for each additional minute. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

item.name: Uma Uma no Mi, Model: Unicorn

entries.name: Type
entries: Mythical Zoan
Fruit appearance. This devil fruit appears as a shiny pearlescent melon with cloud-like swirls, a rainbow-striped center, and a swirling conical white stem pointing upward.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into a unicorn.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Shape
entries: As an action, you are able to transform into a Unicorn using the stat block to the right. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Hybrid Form
entries: You can use your action to enter a "hybrid" zoan state, combining a mix of qualities from both your humanoid form and beast form together for a temporary period of time. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Awakening
entries: Upon the awakening of your Zoan Devil Fruit power, when you enter your Hybrid Form, you can temporarily enter your Awakened State, which lasts for 1 minute.

While your Awakened State is active, your hit point maximum and hit points increase by 50, your weapon attacks and unarmed strike attacks deal extra damage of their primary damage type equal to your character level, and you are able to select an additional hybrid form option. Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

Should the duration of your Awakened State expire, you hold the option to extend its span for an additional minute, at the cost of incurring a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If needed, you can further extend this state by enduring an extra level of {@condition exhaustion} for each additional minute. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

item.name: Inu Inu no Mi, Model: Okuchi no Makami

entries.name: Type
entries: Mythical Zoan
Fruit appearance. This devil fruit appears as flat orange with swirl patterns emerging from its stem and five leaves connecting to its swirling yellow stem.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into a Okuchi no Makami, aka a Large-Mouthed True/Pure God Dog.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Shape
entries: As an action, you are able to transform into an Okuchi no Makami using the stat block to the right. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Hybrid Form
entries: You can use your action to enter a "hybrid" zoan state, combining a mix of qualities from both your humanoid form and beast form together for a temporary period of time. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

entries.name: Awakening
entries: Upon the awakening of your Zoan Devil Fruit power, when you enter your Hybrid Form, you can temporarily enter your Awakened State, which lasts for 1 minute.

While your Awakened State is active, your hit point maximum and hit points increase by 50, your weapon attacks and unarmed strike attacks deal extra damage of their primary damage type equal to your character level, and you are able to select an additional hybrid form option. Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

Should the duration of your Awakened State expire, you hold the option to extend its span for an additional minute, at the cost of incurring a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If needed, you can further extend this state by enduring an extra level of {@condition exhaustion} for each additional minute. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

item.name: Hebi Hebi no Mi, Model: Yamata no Orochi

entries.name: Type
entries: Mythical Zoan
Fruit appearance. A violet apple with swirling scales and seven green stem leaves on top of the fruit with a round triangular shape on the ends.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into a yamata no orochi.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Shape
entries: As an action, you are able to transform into a Hydra (reflavored as a Yamata no Orochi) from the standard D&D 5th Edition {@book Monster Manual|MM}. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

While your Awakened State is active, your hit point maximum and hit points increase by 50, your weapon attacks and unarmed strike attacks deal extra damage of their primary damage type equal to your character level, and you are able to select an additional hybrid form option. Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

If needed, you can further extend this state by enduring an extra level of {@condition exhaustion} for each additional minute. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

item.name: Hito Hito no Mi, Model: Nika

entries.name: Type
entries: Mythical Zoan
Fruit appearance. This devil fruit appears as spherical violet fruit with S-shaped swirls and bumps across its surface and a horizontal t-shaped flat green stem with a swirl at the right end.

entries.name: Description
entries: This zoan devil fruit allows its user to transform into the sun god Nika.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Beast Shape
entries: As an action, you are able to transform into Nika using the stat block to the right. You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

You follow the rules given in Chapter 7 under "Designing a Zoan Devil Fruit Sheet" in the One Piece Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB.

Furthermore, at the start of each of your turns for the duration of this state, you regain hit points equivalent to your character level + your Constitution modifier.

Should the duration of your Awakened State expire, you hold the option to extend its span for an additional minute, at the cost of incurring a level of {@condition exhaustion}. If needed, you can further extend this state by enduring an extra level of {@condition exhaustion} for each additional minute. These levels of {@condition exhaustion} can only be removed by completing a long rest.
Once your Awakened State ends, it can't be activated again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Gaseous Logia
Fruit appearance. A bright yellow starfruit with sharp swirling patterns and several sharp protrusions on its surface.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows its user to create, control, and transform into light at will.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Logia Immunity
entries: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, as physical objects pass through your light body. Additionally, you are immune to radiant damage and the {@condition blinded} condition.

entries.name: Elemental Form
entries: You can use the "Logia Elemental Form" feature listed under "Designing a Logia Devil Fruit Sheet".

entries.name: Radiant Body
entries: You learn the Word of Radiance, Light, and {@spell Dancing Lights} Cantrips, no material components required. Additionally, you can cast {@spell guiding bolt} (1st level) as an action, no charges required. You can cast it at higher levels by spending a devil fruit charge for each additional level the spell is cast at.

entries.name: Sacred Mirror
entries: You can expend 1 devil fruit charge as an action to direct your light form at blinding speeds in order to teleport, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

entries.name: Spells (Light Beams)
entries: This devil fruit power has 17 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell faerie fire} (1 charge), {@spell daylight} (3 charges), {@spell sickening radiance|XGE} (4 charges), {@spell wall of light|XGE} (5 charges), {@spell holy weapon|XGE} (5 charges), {@spell dawn|XGE} (5 charges), {@spell sunbeam} (6 charges), {@spell crown of stars|XGE} (7 charges), {@spell holy aura} (8 charges), or {@spell sunburst} (8 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Light Speed)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Time Stop}, without expending any charges or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Gaseous Logia
Fruit appearance. A bright blue pineapple with sharp swirling patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows its user to create, control, and transform into lightning at will.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Logia Immunity
entries: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, as physical objects pass through your lightning body. Additionally, you are immune to lightning damage and the {@condition deafened} condition, as well as resistant to thunder damage.

entries.name: Elemental Form
entries: You can use the "Logia Elemental Form" feature listed under "Designing a Logia Devil Fruit Sheet".

entries.name: Electric Body
entries: You learn the {@spell Lightning Lure|TCE} and {@spell Shocking Grasp} Cantrips, no material components required. Additionally, you can cast {@spell witch bolt} (1st level) as an action, no charges or material components required. You can cast it at higher levels by spending a devil fruit charge for each additional level the spell is cast at.

entries.name: Electromagnetic Surveillance
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing. Additionally, you can expend 1 devil fruit charge cast Clarivoyance with only the ability to hear, no material components required.

entries.name: Spells (Lightning Strikes)
entries: This devil fruit power has 17 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell thunderwave} (1 charge, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell shatter} (2 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell heat metal} (2 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional charges), {@spell thunder step|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell lightning bolt} (3 charges), {@spell call lightning} (3 charges), {@spell storm sphere|XGE} (4 charges), {@spell chain lightning} (6 charges), {@spell control weather} (8 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Kingdom Come)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Storm of Vengeance}, without expending any charges or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Solid Logia
Fruit appearance. A long white and blue sharp fruit shaped like an icicle with sharp swirling patterns.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows its user to create, control, and transform into ice at will.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Logia Immunity
entries: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, as physical objects pass through your ice body. Additionally, you are immune to cold damage and you can move across {@quickref difficult terrain||3} created by ice or snow without spending extra Movement.

entries.name: Elemental Form
entries: You can use the "Logia Elemental Form" feature listed under "Designing a Logia Devil Fruit Sheet".

entries.name: Ice Body
entries: You learn the {@spell Ray of Frost} Cantrip, no material components required. Additionally, you can cast {@spell ice knife|XGE} (1st level) as an action, no charges or material components required. You can cast it at higher levels by spending a devil fruit charge for each additional level the spell is cast at.

entries.name: Ice Age
entries: So long as you are conscious, you can walk on water normally as if using the {@spell Water Walk} spell. Additionally, you can expend 1 devil fruit charge as an action to lower the temperature in a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see within 300 feet of you, causing the land, water, and other liquids to freeze over. The ice persists without melting for up to 1 hour or until you destroy it as an action.

entries.name: Spells (Ice Time)
entries: This devil fruit power has 17 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell armor of agathys} (1 charge, can cast at higher levels by spending additional devil fruit charges), {@spell rime's binding ice|FTD} (2 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional devil fruit charges), {@spell elemental weapon} (cold; 3 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional devil fruit charges), {@spell ice storm} (4 charges), {@spell cone of cold} (5 charges), {@spell otiluke's freezing sphere} (6 charges), {@spell investiture of ice|XGE} (6 charges), {@spell wall of ice} (6 charges), flesh to ice (6 charges; as {@spell Flesh to Stone} except that the target turns to solid ice with the density and durability of stone), ice capsule (as Power Word: Stun; 8 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Global Ice Age)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast Ice Age^ (view Chapter 8 in the Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB), without expending any charges or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Liquid Logia
Fruit appearance. A small bright red and orange melon with a drooping circular swirling pattern.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows its user to create, control, and transform into magma at will.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Logia Immunity
entries: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, as physical objects pass through your magma body. Additionally, you are immune to fire damage and you can move across {@quickref difficult terrain||3} created by rocky terrain or magma without spending extra Movement.

entries.name: Elemental Form
entries: You can use the "Logia Elemental Form" feature listed under "Designing a Logia Devil Fruit Sheet".

entries.name: Magma Body
entries: You learn the Lava Splash Cantrip (as Acid Splash, but dealing fire damage instead), no material components required. Additionally, you can cast {@spell searing smite} (1st level) as an action, no charges or material components required. You can cast it at higher levels by spending a devil fruit charge for each additional level the spell is cast at.

entries.name: Spells (Red Hound and Eruptions)
entries: This devil fruit power has 17 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: Hell Armor (as {@spell armor of agathys}, but dealing fire damage instead; 1 charge, can cast at higher levels by spending additional devil fruit charges), {@spell aganazzar's scorcher|XGE} (2 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional devil fruit charges), {@spell melf's minute meteors|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell erupting earth|XGE} (3 charges), {@spell wall of stone} (5 charges), {@spell immolation|XGE} (5 charges), {@spell investiture of stone|XGE} (6 charges), {@spell incendiary cloud} (8 charges), or {@spell meteor swarm} (9 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Volcanic Lava
entries: You can expend 1 devil fruit charge as an action to cause a volcanic eruption in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see within 300 feet of you. After {@dice 1d4} rounds at the start of your turn, the surface in that area becomes covered with 1 foot of lava. The lava is considered {@quickref difficult terrain||3} and deals {@damage 10d10} fire damage to any creature that starts its turn in it or enters it for the first time on its turn. The lava also sinks beneath any liquid it enters. This effect lasts for 1 hour, after which the lava hardens into rock.

entries.name: Awakening (Grand Eruption)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to create a massive volcanic eruption in a 120-foot radius sphere centered on you. Each creature in the radius must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes {@damage 10d10} fire damage, or half as much on a success. Additionally, the ground in the radius is covered in 5-foot deep lava for 1 minute, after which the lava solidifes into 5 feet of solid stone over the ground. Wading through the lava causes a creature to take {@damage 10d10} fire damage. Being fully submerged in the lava causes a creature to take {@damage 18d10} fire damage. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Gaseous Logia
Fruit appearance. A bright orange citrus fruit with a swirling flame patterned spikes stemming from its skin.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows its user to create, control, and transform into fire at will.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Logia Immunity
entries: You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks, as physical objects pass through your fire body. Additionally, you are immune to fire damage.

entries.name: Elemental Form
entries: You can use the "Logia Elemental Form" feature listed under "Designing a Logia Devil Fruit Sheet".

entries.name: Flame Body
entries: You learn the Fire Bolt, Produce Flame, and {@spell Control Flames|XGE} Cantrips. Additionally, you can cast {@spell burning hands} (1st level) as an action, no charges or material components required. You can cast it at higher levels by spending a devil fruit charge for each additional level the spell is cast at.

entries.name: Burning Wave
entries: You can expend 1 devil fruit charge as an action to ignite all flammable materials or extinguish all flames within 100 feet of you. Objects or equipment that hold fire, such as torches and lanterns, are suddenly lit. Flammable objects that aren't worn, such those made of wood or wool, catch on fire. A flammable object that is small or smaller is instantly burnt up and reduced to ash. A flammable object that is medium or larger burns at a rate of {@damage 1d4} fire damage per round until its fire is put out as an action.

entries.name: Spells (Flame Commandments)
entries: This devil fruit power has 17 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell hellish rebuke} (1 charge, can cast at higher levels by spending additional devil fruit charges), {@spell flaming sphere} (2 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional devil fruit charges), {@spell heat metal} (2 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional devil fruit charges), {@spell scorching ray} (2 charges, can cast at higher levels by spending additional devil fruit charges), {@spell fireball} (3 charges), {@spell ashardalon's stride|FTD} (3 charges), {@spell wall of fire} (4 charges), {@spell fire shield} (warm {@spell shield}; 4 charges), {@spell flame strike} (5 charges), {@spell investiture of flame|XGE} (6 charges), {@spell fire storm} (7 charges), or {@spell incendiary cloud} (8 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Flame Emperor)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast Flame Emperor^ (view Chapter 8 in the Dungeons and Devil Fruits PHB), without expending any charges or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.

entries.name: Type
entries: Special Logia
Fruit appearance. A light-purple fruit with upward swirling teardrop protrusions stemming from its skin.

entries.name: Description
entries: Allows its user to create, control, and transform into darkness at will.

entries.name: Sea Weakness
entries: You are weak to water and seastone.

entries.name: Darkness Immunity
entries: You are immune to necrotic damage, but vulnerable to every other damage type. You also gain {@sense darkvision} up to 120 feet, and can see through magical darkness.

entries.name: Black Spiral
entries: As an action, you can target a creature within 60 feet of you, attempting to pull it closer to you using intense gravity from your darkness. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or be pulled up to 60 feet toward you and become {@condition grappled} by you. While it is {@condition grappled} this way, it is {@condition restrained} by the darkness in your palm until the grapple is broken.

entries.name: Black Hole
entries: As an action, you may spend 1 or more devil fruit charges to form a large pool of darkness on the ground around you. If you do so, you target each creature and object in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on you must succeed on a Costitution saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC. A creature takes {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage on a failed save and becomes banished into your darkness (as if using the {@spell banishment} spell, no {@status concentration} required) for 1 minute, or half as much damage and doesn't get banished on a successful one. An unworn or unheld object in the radius is automatically banished into the darkness. A creature banished into your darkness is freed if you are reduced to 0 hit points or fall {@condition unconscious}, reappearing in its original space after it is freed. A creature banished this way has all of it's devil fruit abilities and active effects nullified for the duration. The darkness's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and it's radius increases by 5 feet for each additional devil fruit charge expended over 1, dealing up to {@damage 11d10} necrotic damage and having up to a 50-foot radius in total.

entries.name: Liberation
entries: As an action, you can free any object or creature banished into your darkness. If a creature or object is freed this way, it is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Devil Fruit save DC or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Darkness Storage
entries: Your carrying capacity is multiplied by 100, as you are able to store objects within black holes on your body. Any object you carry that isn't being worn or held is stored in a pocket dimension (as if using a bag of holding) which can only be released by you. If you fall {@condition unconscious} or drop to 0 hit points, all objects you are storing in your pocket dimension is released from your body.

entries.name: Devil Fruit Nullification
entries: When a creature is {@condition restrained} or {@condition grappled} by you or a spell cast by this devil fruit, it is unable to use any devil fruit abilities for the duration of the grapple or restraint, and any active devil fruit effects it was using are suddenly ended, as if the creature was touched by seastone.

entries.name: Spells (Black Hole)
entries: This devil fruit power has 17 charges. You can expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it without needing to expend material components: {@spell absorb elements|XGE} (1 charge), {@spell darkness} (2 charges), {@spell vortex warp|SCC} (2 charges), {@spell hunger of hadar} (3 charges), {@spell pulse wave|EGW} (3 charges), {@spell shadow of moil|XGE} (4 charges), {@spell evard's black tentacles} (4 charges), {@spell banishment} (4 charges), {@spell destructive wave} (necrotic; 5 charges), {@spell circle of death} (6 charges), {@spell dark star|EGW} (8 charges). The devil fruit regains expended charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Awakening (Infinity Black Hole)
entries: Once you've awakened your power, you can use an action to cast {@spell Ravenous Void|EGW}, without expending any charges or material components. You can't use this action again for another 24 hours.
